Reviews.Title: “Review of Our Stay at the Hotel Fita, Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BettyBG2012
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fita was a treasure of a find in Amsterdam. Located in the quiet museum district, it offered a quaint, extremely clean accommodation with friendly hotel staff always ready to serve and make your stay the most enjoyable. The breakfasts were lovely including great coffee and delicious made-to-order dutch pancakes in addition to other treats. The hotel provides free laundry service which allowed us to take less clothing on the trip. We stayed 4 nights and will stay again the next time we are in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: CavendishAve
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita was more than we anticipated. Very friendly and helpful staff, ideal location, clean and comfortable rooms, delicious breakfast as part of the package -- this hotel has it all. We will return when next in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Fita!!”
Reviews.Author: MicheleInToronto
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 7 nights as a solo traveler at the Hotel Fita and my comments echo those of many others here on TA. The location is perfect (less than a 5 min walk to the tram, Van Gogh museum, Bols museum, shopping and restaurants), the price is excellent value (you even get a delicious breakfast included each morning and in-room coffee and tea making facilities), the hotel is very clean and comfortable and the service is friendly and efficient. Both Martijn and Roel contributed to my wonderful experience at their hotel - always smiling, willing to answer questions and help with any request no matter what it was. I would strongly reccomend this to anyone seeking the unique and memorable experience of a boutique hotel. Hotel Fita is fantastic and I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Treasure in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BrittSanRafael
Reviews.Content: This 15 room, all non-smoking hotel, was a perfect way to start and end our four days in Amsterdam. Roel, Martin and Queenie, along with the other staff, made us feel at home and very pampered. The breakfasts were superb and the company delightful. Our room was just the right size, warm, immaculate and quiet. The bed was extremely comfortable. The umbrella for loan in each room was a nice feature, even though we had atypical sunny and warm March weather. Not only is Hotel Fita close to the museums, tickets were available for purchase in the Hotel to avoid the lines. With its location, we were close to the trolley line, and walking to the city center was easy. Roel had recommendations for wonderful restaurants as well. The elevator was a treat, especially for the one sore knee on the trip. We both felt safe and secure. Our email contact before our arrival for directions was timely and clear. I have already recommended Hotel Fita to five couples. It is a charming Hotel with a B & B feel. We highly recommend Hotel Fita.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming is just the beginning”
Reviews.Author: TwinOak_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for my husband and I. Now owned and operated by two brother we found these accommodations perfect for our stay. Our room was comfortable and large with a large bathroom. All very clean. Being an older couple, an elevator was a must. It is quite small which adds to the fun! Breakfast in the morning, yum. Pancakes by Martin (the other younger brother a promising chef). Just the right options for a light, satisfying breakfast. Loads of information and assistance offered by Roel. One block from the very busy Van Gogh museum. We purchased our tickets from Roel. Cab to the front door from the airport and to our ship. Tram also one block away. Purchase the full day ticket. Rijksmuseum & Royal Concertgebouw easy walking distance. Perfectly situated for all one's needs. This isn't a luxury, high end hotel. Our needs were met and then some with. Thank you Roel & Martin if your reading!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Leslie T
Reviews.Content: This small hotel located just steps from the Van Gogh Museum is a real find! Roel, Martijn, Ria made us feel like part of the family from the emails we exchanged before our arrival, all during our stay as well as the email we received when we got home thanking us for staying with them. The rooms are clean, comfortable and well appointed. The breakfast is included and was delicious. We had eggs bacon and waffles made to order and a beautiful spread of fruit and bread and yogurt. If narrow steep steps or a small elevator is something that would make you uncomfortable you should be aware that this hotel has both although this is something very typical to European hotels. I can not recommend the Fita more highly!

Reviews.Title: “Nice small Hotel with terrific location”
Reviews.Author: WaveWatcher16
Reviews.Content: This small three star hotel in the southwestern part of Amsterdam is very well located only 100 meters or so from the VanGogh Museum. It is on the main trolley line that feeds to the city center in only 10 minutes. The rooms are good sized for Europe the staff is wonderful. Run by two brothers Martin and Rould they can help with all your needs. The included breakfast is very good. Ask for the Dutch pancakes.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Family run Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: osspeak
Reviews.Content: It is worth going to Amsterdam, just to stay at the Hotel Fita. I have stayed at a lot of Hotels in my 21 World trips, but loved this place. The two sons, Roel and Martijn could not be more helpful and treat you as if you were their first ever customer, every time. The room was very comfortable, lovely and warm, despite being freezing outside, and the bed was exceptional. Location is very good, unless you turn the wrong way out of the Hotel, like we did, then it is a very long walk. Breakfast was excellent and despite not being on my strict diet, I could not resist the Pancakes. Typical continental Hotel in steep steps and tiny lift, but this was all part of the charm. I cannot recommend the Fita highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes.”
Reviews.Author: forgerons
Reviews.Content: When reviewing we always look for some faults before giving our rating. Trouble is we couldn't really find anything here. Ticked all the boxes. The room was a very good size with nice bathroom and good towels. Hairdryer, tissues, plastic cup dispenser were all pluses. In the room there was a safe, nespresso coffee maker and regular kettle, ironing facilities etc. Even little details like swish easy to draw curtains, being an essential point with two large windows. The breakfasts were really nice, always fresh and the scrambled eggs and bacon not the congealed mass you often get in some hotels (often at a price!). Yes the pancakes are very good, considering neither of us have sweet tooth yet repeated our order each morning says it all. The family are really freindly and helpful, and most of all really care about what they are doing. To top it all the location is excellent, not too far away from anything but in a nice quiet street. Enough said just try it for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Most friendliest staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: Mackins
Reviews.Content: Very warm welcome and they could not do enough for us during our stay, including help with days out, transport, restaurants and much more. Had 3 nights at the hotel in lovely comfortable rooms and very scrummy breakfast (especially the dutch pancakes!!). Location is just outside the hustle and bustle, but everything is in walking distance or if not, the trams and buses are really close by too - so ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: mara002
Reviews.Content: Only stayed the one night on a business trip but was made to feel very welcome. Single room was adequate and breakfast room had just been updated and was very nice. Everyone was very friendly and accomadating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot - Wonderful People”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights in the Fita and had a splendid time. Hotel comfortable, very tidy, great breakfast, wonderfully friendly and accomodating staff. Would stay again in an instant. Note: the kids from the youth hostel across the street can be a bit noisy late at night if the windows are open.

Reviews.Title: “Makes the visit easy”
Reviews.Author: Barry17149021
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 5-day stay at the Hotel Fita in Amsterdam. Like many other guests at the Hotel, we were treated with warmth, welcome, and patience for all our questions and needs. Roel and his staff were uniformly great. The hotel's location is on a quiet, pretty street right adjacent to the Van Gogh museum and a few minute's from the Rijksmuseum. You can get your tickets from the hotel and avoid the lines waiting to buy them. A tram stop around the corner enables you to go wherever you want within Amsterdam. Our room was comfortable, clean and larger than most European hotel rooms. We got one of the larger rooms. Finally, being able to call the US and Europe with no charge and to get your laundry cleaned at no charge were great add-ons.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality and Charm”
Reviews.Author: angusmom
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, family-run, lots of warm service and attention to the guests. Rooms are clean and practical, with everything you need and a comfortable bed. The location is ideal for museums, the Concertgebouw, the fashion district, and Vondelpark, and is just a couple of blocks from the trams (at Rijksmuseum) and the bus to/from the airport so no taxis are needed. Take the tram and canal boats everywhere, or rent a bike and join the locals if you can keep up with them -- they're fast!

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like Family!”
Reviews.Author: RenniePerth
Reviews.Content: Once again, booked solely based on reviews. Was soo happy with my choice here...once again scored points on this one (I do all the hotel booking). We arrived after a long flight from Perth. It was around 7am in Amsterdam and dark and cold. On the way to the hotel to drop our luggage i was thinking, goodness what are we going to do to entertain ourselves for the hours before our room was ready! Roel welcomed us with a smile and then proceeded to tell us "that we were in luck our room was ready". This was heaven to the ears. What I loved was that Roel was expecting us, new who we were and our situation (long flight). That felt so nice compared to bigger hotels! Hotel Fita was a family run hotel and is a tradtional style Amsterdam house. This however added to the charm for us Aussies as was a world away from how we live. Elevator available if you need. Hotel Fita consisted of around 15 rooms..we stayed in 2 of them (as we returned on two occassions). Rooms were perfect, clean, bright and comfortable!!! Bathrooms were excellent (heaps of room) and the best shower of our whole trip in Europe. Nespresso in the room (yay), no fridge however. The only instance I think you would need a fridge if you were travelling with a young baby or something and I know Roel/Martjin would assist if required (bottles etc). Breakfast is served daily downstairs and was lovely. Continental Breakkie and in addition they will make you eggs/bacon or dutch pancakes. There is a fridge downstairs with drinks, which was handy as sometimes you really didnt want to venture out just to get drinks. It works on the honesty system, you pay for what you consume!. Location - Hotel Fita is in a great place. Best shopping district (high end street) very close by. The canal tours leave just down the street and some of the best museums 2-5 minutes away! My husband and I will always look back on our trip and remember Hotel Fita, it was definately special. The family are wonderful. If your looking for an excellent value hotel, in a good location, nice staff and very clean and comfortable this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great place”
Reviews.Author: tammyvh
Reviews.Content: Overall I would recommend Hotel Fita as a place to stay while in Amsterdam. By American standards, the rooms are small - but that was expected when I went to Amsterdam. The staff was awesome and could help you with everything you needed while staying. The breakfast was good, especially the pancakes. The location is perfect as you are less than one block from the Van Gogh Museum and a short walk from everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ktfranks
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in February, and it was absolutely perfect. There are a vast number of ways to reach the hotel from the airport, including bus, train, and shuttle. I opted for the shuttle and had an easy ride to the hotel and back to the airport the next day. Once I reached the hotel, I felt very welcomed by the friendly staff. The clerk even drew on a map to show me a good walking path to see different parts of the city, since I only had one day. The hotel is in close proximity to many of the museums as well as some great shopping and restaurants. The room itself was quite comfortable, especially for the price. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff. Hotel Itself, Disappointing..”
Reviews.Author: ReindeerSpotting
Reviews.Content: Well, I was little unlucky - asked for an early check-in, which was unavailable, but according to Hotel Fina, Hotels.com never relayed the message to me...first up, the doors from the outside don't open automatically and the reception desk isn't staffed permanently; I find that uninviting, despite the fact that the bloke who showed up was a delightful man, full of useful tips etc. The room I was in overlooked a school yard, so it was noisy enough from early on and hard to work with the playground in full swing during the day. The room itself was fine - big, in fairness to it, complete with iron, tea & coffee making facilities and FREE WIFI, but the shower was just too fierce pressure-wise; the sockets available are not work-friendly in terms of where they are placed and the TV stations available are limited. But I suppose the most disappointing aspect for me is that the two single beds pushed together were small and I just didn't / couldn't get a good night's sleep. One of the in-built bedside tables is head height and I ended up banging my head of that for good measure! Look, its location is fantastic, staff are lovely, but Amsterdam is relatively cheap in my experience and for E135 - E140 per night, I expected better...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: lainey7200
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in Hotel Fita. Wish I had read more reviews before travelling as got train from to Central Station then (expensive) taxi to hotel - should have got Bus 197 to Rijksmuseum-stops at end of the street in which hotel is located. Very friendly, warm welcome. Large, bright and airy room (Room 34). Large bathroom with excellent shower. Good breakfast (and the pancakes are as good as every other reviewer has mentioned!)

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Elfi L
Reviews.Content: We enjoy the stay a lot. Hotel is located in museum district so very close to city center. Nice and warm welcome. As many advices as needed, on a city map given to you when check-in...they could make restaurant reservation for you if needed. The breakfast is wonderfull (you should try the pancakes!) Bedroom are cosy and very clean. They even had expresso machine inside. A trust bar in the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: wvhhrh
Reviews.Content: We stayed five days at the Fita Hotel--the location could not be better for the Van Gogh Museum (allow yourself most of a day) and the Rijksmuseum. Two tram lines which can take you direct to the Dam, the flower market, or the train station are only a block away. We got helpful suggestions from the staff about nearby restaurants and had very good breakfasts. And there is a economical shuttle service from the airport that can be easily arranged.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, cosy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: JKAT
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam at 6am, when it was -17 degrees. Fortunately our room was available when we got to the hotel at 8am, and we could check in, add a few more layers of clothes and start to explore the city. As others have said, it is close to the tram, the musuems and the direct bus to the airport. The coffee machine in the room was a nice extra touch. Breakfast was good, with the crepe being a highlight. Martijn was very helpful and we could buy tickets to the museums so we did not have to queue in the cold. A wonderful start to our European holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Lori3691
Reviews.Content: The room is well-appointed, the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The included breakfast was extra good. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EvelienGent_Belgium
Reviews.Content: Family owned hotel, with a good location near the museums. The people from the hotel were extremely helpful and friendly. We can certainly recommend this hotel if you don't like the big international hotel chains!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful base to visit Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: 209938Alexandra2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in Room 36 which was a fairly big, bright, comfortable room on the second floor (there is a lift)with shower & bath. The two young brothers who run the small hotel are polite & helpful. The location is perfect- in a quiet street, less than 5 minutes walk from the tramline which gives you quick access to the whole city for 7euros 50 for a 24 hour ticket - best transport system in any city we have visited- you just buy the ticket from the driver & the trams come every few minutes. The airport bus stop is beside the tram stop- ask for Rijkmuseum,( takes about 20mins from airport ) The lovely Vondelpark,Van Gogh museum ,Heineken Experience, House of Bol (fun & interesting tour costing11 euros which includes a cocktail & two shots) concert hall, fashion shops are all in the neighbouring streets. There is a selection places to eat & drink nearby but a 5min trip on the tram takes you to Leidesplein which has a larger variety. There is a simple buffet breakfast but we were offered a delicious, complimentary breakfast of scrambled eggs, bacon & Dutch pancakes freshly cooked for us- we gratefully accepted every morning! We found Amsterdam & Hotel Fita to be welcoming & highly enjoyable experience which we would not hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DebManchester61
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at Hotel Fita. The room was very big as was the bathroom, with lots of space either side of the sink and an excellent shower over a very wide bath. It was minus 7 outside but the room was warm. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was great, bacon and eggs cooked to order, as well as the wonderful pancakes, again made to order. Free internet and a 'trust' bar by the breakfast room. The bus from the airport stops about 50 meters away and the tram stop is even nearer. Museums on the doorstep too. If only all city hotels were this good!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: spurs150
Reviews.Content: Close to the museums and with very friendly staff. A really good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A nice weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: DavidgrNy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fita is located in a lovely part of Amsterdam, right near the Van Gogh Museum. It's easy to get to from Central Station (1 block from the #2 or #5 Tram stop). I later learned (from the hotel) that there is a quick bus between the airport and hotel - only 4 euros on bus #197 (or maybe it's #196). The hotel was small and intimate - very nice and the owners were very friendly. A delicious breakfast is included in the room rate. My room (#16) was very small (I was traveling from the US to Munich on business and decided to spend the weekend by myself in Amsterdam.) but comfortable. The only downside was that the room was very cold - I needed an extra blanket at night. Clearly the radiator wasn't able to handle the unusually frigid temperatures (14 degrees Farenheit) Oh yeah... bring shampoo! They don't supply it. Amsterdam is a very walkable city, and the Hotel Fita was within 20 minutes of all the major attractions. I'd stay there again, but would probably choose a larger (and warmer) room.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: dihaamir
Reviews.Content: It was not difficult to find this hotel, well thanks to its amazing location! We took the bus 197 from Schipol airport and stop at Hobbemastraat near the Rijksmuseum. You can easily find the street name leading to this hotel, Jan Luijkenstraat. We were greeted by Martin, the ever so friendly guy!While waiting for our room to be ready, he was so helpful by showing us the places we wanted to go, emphasizing on the shopping districts. We instantly felt at ease! =) We got room no 14 and it was amazing to the top! Love the warm feelings of the room, clean bathroom (with rubber ducky!), wide glass windows and most importantly, Nespresso machine! How does these guys know I love coffee?? ;) I will definitely come back again to stay at this hotel. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at Its Best”
Reviews.Author: amcglynn
Reviews.Content: My sister and I arrived early for check-in. Room was immediately readied and we were served coffee while we waited. Any question or request we had was answered immediately always with the warmest of smiles. Even though we woke after the official breakfast hour, we were encouraged to come down and enjoy a very tasty repast. Hotel is clean and every so welcoming. A real Amsterdam find particularly when you consider its prime location.

Reviews.Title: “Good services”
Reviews.Author: Catherine W
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazing. They were very helpful. The hotel location was so great, close to subway and walking distance to museums. The Breakfast was so great and varied. If you need samthing, it was delivered to you rapidly.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: anes1
Reviews.Content: I adore Amsterdam, and visit regularly--on my own and with my family (we have two young kids). I have, at last, found my favourite hotel in this charming city. The Hotel Fita is located on a quiet pedestrian street within a stone's throw of the Van Gough and Rijksmuseum, and in the other direction, close to one of the city's exclusive shopping streets (perfect for window-shopping). The Concertgebouw is no more than 6 mins' walk; the stunning Vondelpark is within a 2-min walk, and Bus-197 stops very close by--so you can get to/from Schiphol in 15 minutes for 4 euros. Within 10 minutes of my arrival, the owner Roel had done the following: arranged for me to rent a bike (good idea); booked dinners are nearby restaurants (they were excellent and inexpensive); handed me an annotated map; had my speedy wifi working (no extra charge). Was I happy? Delighted. What's unique about this hotel? First, this building is a typical charming canal-house that is _not_ typically cramped and awkward. There is a lift (if you're not keen on steep stairs), and the energetic family who owns the hotel has not spared any expense to ensure everything works, everything is spotlessly clean, and that the guests' needs are paramount. Second, the rooms (I have stayed in two and seen three) are bright, newly-refurbished, and have Nespresso machines at our disposal. The showers are hot and powerful. The beds are new and the sheets are probably Egyptian cotton. The breakfast is excellent (eggs and pancakes in addition to cold options); the "honesty bar" is open 24hrs and has whatever cold drinks you can think of--for just 2 euros each. Yes, a glass of wine for 2 euros. Where else would you find that in Amsterdam? There is a large grocery store nearby. I should add that there are two primary schools nearby too--but that only adds to the neighbourhood atmosphere: it's nice to step outside and see kids running around. The street feels more like the Upper-West side in Manhattan than the stereotypical cold polish of an exclusive European quartier. I will be back, and next time I'll bring my kids. That's another bonus: Roel says that he charges just a nominal extra kids' beds in their parents' rooms--this will add up to a big savings. In my experience most European hotels require a full second room at a full second price. What a great stay. Go Fita!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: meganaus
Reviews.Content: Our extended family of 5 all loved the Fita. Whilst rooms were simply furnished they were spotlessly clean; hot water in bathroom and coffee machine in each room. The position is great (in museum area) but easy to walk to city centre -- or just catch a tram. The young owners are sensational. Nothing is too much trouble. They treat you as if you are the only guest and spend time making sure you know where to go, what to visit , where to eat. As others have written, breakfast is delicious . A weeks load of dirty clothes was cleaned free of charge! We will definitely stay here again if lucky enough to return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - though not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: alimarcam
Reviews.Content: I really cannot praise this hotel highly enough. From the moment we walked in, me and my husband were met with a very warm welcome and handshakes from Martijn, who then clearly explained everything in respect of timings for breakfast (particularly over New Year), the 'honesty' bar, local sights to see, etc, before being shown to our spacious, spotlessly clean room. Each of the staff we met over our 4 night stay were all as charming and friendly as Martijn and couldn't have been more helfpul. And the breakfasts were amazing too! Not only a delicious buffet and freshly prepared hot bacon and scrambled eggs each morning but the option of freshly made pancakes which my husband said were delicious! My comment about 'not for light sleepers' is not a criticism of the hotel though. The hotel is very centrally located and we stayed over New Year so predictably, people were letting off fireworks all New Year's Eve Day and Night - I am sure if we'd stayed at a different time of year, we wouldn't have noticed the noise. Finally, I have to praise the staff for their reaction to something unfortunate that happened during our stay. Despite being a 'no smoking' hotel, the people in the room next to ours decided to smoke the absolutely disgusting smelling 'skunk' and the smell filtered through to our room. We went and spoke to one of the hotel staff who immediately went and reprimanded the other guests who despite pathetically denying they were smoking, ceased and then the room was thankfully ventilated and sprayed with air-freshener. We very much appreciated the staff member's prompty action.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Terry O
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at the Hotel Fita. It was a wonderful vacation - but, I do have to say that arriving at the hotel with 3 heavy bags in hand at 11:00 in the morning and looking at the steep entry stairs made me think, "uh oh"! Fortunately, there was a lift just large enough for our 3 bags - which was great because our room was on the third floor! We were greeted by Queenie, who was very kind and patient with us - we were a bit jet lagged (and grumpy), but she made us feel welcome and got us into our rooms right away. If you asked our daughters, they would say the best thing about the hotel was the breakfast, in particular, the dutch pancakes. They were terrific! Breakfast was the same every day: scrambled eggs (fluffy and light), bacon (salty and delicious), yogurt, granola, dried fruit, baked goods, cheese, tomatoes, cucumbers, toast. But, there was enough variety that you had the opportunity to try everything. The rooms were nice and clean. A regular room with a comfortable bed. If you're looking for a posh, five star room - you should find another hotel. Hotel Fita is comfortable and clean. All you really need since you won't be staying in the room for long periods of time. There's so much to see and do in Amsterdam - you really just want to come back to a room that is inviting and comfortable. Free internet was fantastic and so valuable when looking for a good restaurant or checking the train schedules. But, for me - the best thing was the free laundry service! We didn't need to bring 3 bags of luggage! Laundry was sent out in the a.m. and when we returned in the evening, our clean laundry was waiting for us! Roel and Martijn were such wonderful hosts! And, so young! They spent time with each guest, asking how they could help, what we all needed - such great hoteliers! Location: IT CAN'T GET ANY BETTER! The tram (#2 and 5) are right outside your door (all right, it's around the corner!), the Diamond Museum, Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum are all within close walking distance. If you like shopping, the "Rodeo Drive" of Amsterdam is a block over from the hotel - nice for window shopping after a heavy meal. There is a supermarket (Albert Heijn) close by for wine and cheese. And, there are several nice restaurants within walking distance. Roel and Martijn are happy to make reservations for you or make suggestions for restaurants in other areas of the city. We know that when we return to Amsterdam, our base will be the Hotel Fita. Thanks Roel and Martijn for a wonderful and restful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint & Homey”
Reviews.Author: Chris F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Amsterdam on Dec. 27th and stayed 2 nights with Hotel Fita. We were impressed with the welcome email before we even left home, our welcome when we got there and the lovely thank you email when we got back home! Roel was our first impression of the hotel and couldn't have been made to feel more welcome. He gave us many ideas of where to go and what to see. Our room was immaculate and quaint. The breakfasts on both mornings were delicious and there were plenty of choices of what to have including amazing homemade pannekoek! The location is perfect to get to the canals, the museums, the transit... Roel's brother (sorry can't remember his name..) was also lovely when he waited on us in the breakfast room and super friendly, as was the young woman. It was a wonderful stay and everything was clean and comfortable and we would recommend a stay here to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Laura M
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fita was an absolutely wonderful place to stay. My father and I were only in Amsterdam for two nights, but the staff of the hotel Fita made certain our stay was as pleasant as possible. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The first thing they do when you arrive at the hotel is to make sure you know where all the best restaurants and attractions are. They are very attentive, and helpful, and include a free homemade breakfast in the half basement, which is a pleasant sunny room. Location was wonderful too. Not far from the central train station, and literally a block away from the Van Gogh museum. We highly recommend the Hotel Fita to anyone going to Amsterdam. We will most certainly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: laurel29438
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel Fita was a very pleasant experience for me. The hotel is located in an unusually quiet section of a bustling city. The staff was exceptionally helpful in every aspect of providing me a delightful hotel experience, I was given very useful and accurate travel advice. The room was very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was awesome. I was sorry to leave this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: barb1560
Reviews.Content: We were in Amsterdam right after Thanksgiving. Hotel Fita was a great find! Reasonably priced and a wonderful location - it's about a block from the Van Gogh Museum and the tram and bus stops. The rooms were quite large by European standards and very nicely furnished. The property was very quiet (no traffic noise), immaculate, and the price included a wonderful breakfast daily. It is family owned and they couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating. We definitely are recommending this hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Warm hospitality and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Journeyer
Reviews.Content: There are lots of hotel alternatives in all price ranges in Amsterdam, but it would be hard to beat the Hotel Fita â€“ it was just perfect for us. Of course whatâ€™s perfect for one would be not necessarily be so for others. So, here is what made it â€œperfectâ€� for us: Small and friendly â€“ from our initial check in through our last breakfast, we always received a warm and friendly welcome. Location â€“ we walked everywhere, except the one day we needed to be at the train station to catch an 8:41 AM departure when they called a taxi for us. The hotel is around the corner from the Van Gogh Museum and a few blocks from the Rijksmuseum. If we had wanted to take a tram, they were just around the corner. Our rooms faced the front of the hotel and had small balconies. There is little car and pedestrian traffic in the evenings. There is a schoolyard across the street but we were not in the hotel during the times the kids were out playing, so whatever noise there might have been wasnâ€™t an issue for us. Room size â€“ we and our friends had rooms 32 and 22, double room type A and both were spacious and large enough to have an afternoon happy hour sitting in chairs around a coffee table with our friends. Bathroom â€“ clean, modern, large bathroom with a shower with good pressure and plenty of hot water Honor bar â€“ reasonably priced snacks and drinks were available, which made it convenient since we didnâ€™t always stop off at a market to get snacks to go with the liquor we had purchased in the duty free shop at the airport. Free wireless internet â€“ we really donâ€™t like being nickled & dimed with extras, so we appreciated that it was included in the room rate. Yummy breakfasts â€“ warm hospitality extended into the breakfast room, where upon entry we were offered fresh brewed coffee or tea. They remembered from one day to the next our preferences for milk or cream, as an example. On the breakfast buffet were fresh croissants and rolls, cheese, yogurt, cereals, fresh fruit, tomatoes, cucumbers, scrambled eggs & crispy bacon, juices. We looked forward to the apple pancakes which were a real treat. Helpfulness â€“ from the requests for information prior to making our reservation and their prompt response to their suggestions for restaurants and making dinner reservations Roel, Martign and the Fita team were great. Overall, it is an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: trelights
Reviews.Content: Have just returned with 8 friends from a long weekend staying at the excellent Hotel Fita. The 2 brothers Roel and Martijn could not do more to make their guests welcome - they are so helpful (even booking restaurants for us in advance) and willingly answering all our questions as first-time visitors to Amsterdam.The hotel is very well situated close to the museums and upmarket shopping area, but within easy walking distance of the City centre (30 mins or so). The bus transport from the airport is easy too. Would not hesitate to recommend Hotel Fita to anyone ... and yes, the breakfasts are great (lovely soft scrambled egg and crisp bacon, and wonderful freshly made pancakes.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita - why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: Part_time_traveller
Reviews.Content: You've seen what other people say about the Hotel Fita, it's all true, I can't really add anything to what everyone else says. Just make sure you stay there! Why would you stay anywhere else? What I do have to say is that if you are a first time visitor to Amsterdam you need to know a couple of things. First Amsterdam is a small city, everything is in walking distance, second the tram system is brilliant, cheap and efficient if you don't want to walk. That makes Hotel Fita even more attractive, it may looks out of the centre but it's not, it's right in the museum district, surrounded by great shopping and restaurants. Stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Business & pleasure”
Reviews.Author: dlouis1144
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our 5 day November 2011 stay at Hotel Fita. The great location next to Museumplein and being just slightly off-center from the touristic core, matched with the team's hospitality and helpfulness (and delicious breakfast crepes!) made for an excellent choice for our part work - part pleasure stay in Amsterdam. WiFi included and easy access to public transport, direct all the way to Schiphol, are added bonuses.

Reviews.Title: “what a great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: TravellerFiliz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in november 2011. What an excellent hospitality. As I wrote on their guest book, the greetings and the smiles and the eagerness to make your guest happy make all the difference. You do not need luxurious rooms to make your guests happy. They were attentive to our needs, helpful and made us feel welcomed. i loved the breakfast, simple but enough. clean rooms, free wifi that actually works unlike some other hotels. I loved it and I would totally recommend others who check this website. If you go to Amsterdam you do not have to pay a lot to stay at a nice place. We stayed the first 2 nights at another very expensive place in Amsterdam and I was not even happy. Thankfully I got to stay at this cute little central location that made me happy.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Jono777
Reviews.Content: If you`re sick of big impersonal hotels then stay with Roel and his brother Martin at Hotel Fita just behind the Van Gogh museum. I`ve stayed there 3 times now and it keeps getting better. They are friendly and helpful although never intrusive. Very comfortable and clean. Lovely breakfasts. Great value. On my last trip I had to go to Brussels for one night and they said that I could just leave my things in my room as they had not booked the room that night. How generous of them. I`ve never had anything like that happen in all my travels - have you?

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful small hotel in a great location. My wife and I spent three nights at the Hotel Fita at the end of a three week trip in Europe, after making the reservation a year before, the room was ready when we arrived at 10:30 am. It's location is outstanding, as you can walk to everything, being on a quite street is a plus as well. The people were great, the berakfast was scrumptious and when the taxi did not arrive on time to take us to the airport they took us. What great service. Jeanne and Robert Cox- Minnesota

Reviews.Title: “Great central base for exploring Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: slimyslug
Reviews.Content: Warm, clean, friendly, great breakfast, well located on leafy street next to Rijksmuseum. Spacious comfortable room in grand 1900 house. Modern clean spacious bathroom with powerful shower over bath. It 's not a boutique hotel and no period features survive in the decor but everything you need is there including some nice touches like nespresso machine in room, free wi- fi and free use of safe in room. It seemed good price for Amsterdam. Spent 5 nights there, 4 full days a walking aimlessly around Amsterdam and earing in some great bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!!”
Reviews.Author: Skip W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent three nights at Hotel Fita on November 10-12, and look forward to returning soon. We basically agree with all of the positive reviews, and would just like to confirm a few of the other reviewersâ€™ compliments. First, we were warmly greeted by Roel, Martijn and Ria who are exceptionally charming, cheerful and caring hosts and hostess. The room was very clean and comfortable, and the breakfast was outstanding with a wide assortment of warm and cold dishes. Ria makes a fabulous crepe de pancake. As noted by other fans of Fita, the location is 1 block from the Van Gogh museum and 2 blocks from the Rijks. There is also an extremely convenient and inexpensive (4 euros) bus (197) between the airport and the Rijks museum (2 blocks away). We could not be more enthusiastic recommending this hotel, and look forward to returning for the opening of their rooftop restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hosts!!!”
Reviews.Author: mreinik
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my friends and we found this place very friendly and good value. Very friendly and helpfull staff. Rooms are clean and breakfast is small, but tasty. And THE PANCAKES are delicious. Not a luxury, but cosy place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like about this fantastic hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Educkie2
Reviews.Content: What makes this hotel special is the people,Roel,Martijn,Ria and the Fita team! All of the other reviews highlight the spaciousness of the rooms, cleanliness and excellent location with which I hardily agree. The bathroom is huge by european standards,lots of hot water and great water pressure. Anyone who gets up at 6:00 to make me breakfast is a hero and the breakfast here was hardy enough to last us through the day. Don't even think about refusing the pancakes! Yum and try the homemade jam on top. Remember, it's vacation and none of the food has any calories. Food, another one of my favorite topics. Role and Martijn made fantastic recommendations for dining and we were never disappointed . It is hard to say which was our favorite! They also pointed us in the right direction for many attractions and told us how to navigate the trams. I shouldn't be writing this review because I want to make sure we are able to get reservations when Martijn opens his restaurant!!! Role,Martijn and Ria, thank you! You are incredible hosts!(Tommy,too!) xoxox

Reviews.Title: “do yourself a favour and stay here!”
Reviews.Author: jerrydarby
Reviews.Content: We stayed 19th and 20th Nov guided by the good reviews here. They were more than accurate. Perfect location and run by a lovely family who made us so welcome as guests not customers. Hope to be back in the summer

Reviews.Title: “Great location, even better service”
Reviews.Author: Whatsinanayme
Reviews.Content: Just to agree with what everyone else has said, the Hotel Fita is a wonderful hotel in a great part of Amsterdam. It's only a few blocks from the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum, and a very quick walk to the Leidseplein and the center of town. It's a pretty bare bones hotel with simple but comfortable furnishings. We splurged and got the larger room (since my BF is 6"3') and really yearned for a little extra space. So the bathroom was a nice change from the closet-sized bathroom we had in Paris and Belgium. But for all of the wonderfulness of the hotel, it really is only second to the kindness of its owners. Roel, Martijn and their mother were so kind and helpful. We took advantage of the breakfast every morning (though it was a little early for our American taste) and so worth it. Pancakes, eggs and bacon, plus a nice assortment of pastries. Martijn is studying to be a chef, so gave us some great restaurant recommendations. I'd recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sue P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in November 2011. I was in a single room that was like a tiny dorm room, but bathroom ensuite, and what more do you need? It's very convenient to the trams to central Amsterdam and the train station, and a 4 Euro bus ride to the airport that the staff steered me to instead of a ~35 Euro taxi or 15.50 Euro shuttle. The owners are young and enthusiastic and aim to please. The fresh Dutch pancakes and scrambled eggs and bacon for breakfast are a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Little Hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Murphyslaugh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for around 6 days in the month of October 2011. The hotel in located very close to the Rijks and the Van Gogh Museums. Both are within walking distance. Public transport is very close by and there is a supermarket also quite close. The hotel rooms are clean and simple ( I would recommend staying in the larger rooms in the hotel if available). The breakfast is a simple spread but is very good (Loved the pancakes). The hotel has free laundry service and a free umbrella for daily use. The lifts are slightly on the smaller side but should not be too much of a concern. The hotel is located in a quite street on the city and gives the feel of living in an amsterdam home. The staff is lovely and is always eager to help you. They make you feel at home. I would highly recommend this great hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this small, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steens2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August with my parents and sister after celebrating my parents' 50th wedding anniversary on a Rhine cruise. The location, just around the corner from both the Rijks- and Van Gogh museums, was perfect. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, friendly and accommodating. The rooms are clean and simple, with everything in the right place. The breakfast is plentiful and delicious. We look forward to staying here again and would highly recommend it to anyone wanting to stay near the museums for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Blueman56
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is in an excellent location for any part of Amsterdam and is handily connected to the airport via the 197 bus. The rooms are clean and tidy with everything working as it should. The breakfasts are amazing and Roel and his team are adept at providing good tips for restaurants and other local info. Why stay anywhere esle?

Reviews.Title: “loved our stay here! :)”
Reviews.Author: SonaG
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to the city but the first stayat hotel fita.....am so glad to have found it! I was taking my mom for her firt trip to europe and am so glad that hotel fita in amsterdam was a perfect start. It was easy to get to from the station by tram as per the instructions given on their website. The owners were very welcoming, attentive and friendly. We were promptly shown to our large double room which was very well equipped with a coffee machine, ironing board, safe, umbrella, enough cosy furntiure and a lovely small balcony. The bath tub was great to soak in, particularly since we found amsterdam very cold at 9 degrees celsius, about 20 degrees less than the average we are used to! The entire property was very clean and welcoming. A computer is available for use in the basement. Breakfast was hearty and the pesonal touch added by encouraging us to have freshly made pancakes was delightful! It was with tremendous regret that we checked out after only one night as we had train tickets booked for further travel. Wish we could have stayed longer. Hope to be back sometime soon!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest welcome ever”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen K
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have recently returned from a 4-night stay at this hotel and we agree with all of the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. We received the friendliest welcome ever from Roel, Martijn and Suzanne. They did everything possible to make our stay in Amsterdam perfect. They were very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is perfectly situated close to the museums in a part of the city that is busy by day but quiet and peaceful at night. The rooms are clean and comfortable - we had a large double and it was very spacious. Yes, it is expensive, but so is everything in Amsterdam, and this hotel gives excellent value for money. The breakfast was ample for us and the pancakes are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Be carefull of the Hotel Fita booking process”
Reviews.Author: jyoung3381
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Fita several times over the years with complete satisfaction. I just tried to book the Hotel again for next year and encountered frustration with the booking process. We first booked through their automated internet booking. We received a confirmation at one price then received an additional confirmation the next morning at a different price. My brother booked at the same time and received yet a third price. When I looked at my confirmed reservations, it appeared that the 5% city tax was included. When I E-mailed Hotel Fita for clarification I was informed that the 5% tax was not included in the reservation. Yet, my brothers reservation included that additional 5% tax at that different price. The additional 5% tax is listed on my first confirmed reservation as follows: "City tax included: No 5% p.r.p.n." What does this mean? City tax Included, City Tax not included or there is no 5% p.r.p.n? At that point enough was enough! No more recommendations for the Hotel Fita. We booked the Marriott four blocks away. No hassles there.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: philBeds
Reviews.Content: The Fita is a great little hotel with very helpful staff. Go for the double "A" room - more space . The hotel is perfectly situated opposite tram stop and the Van Gough museum. The poshest shopping street in Amsterdam, Rijksmuseum and bus stop for the 197 to Schipol are all within 5 minutes. I was staying for the marathon and Roel was most helpful getting me on my way. If only I had eaten one of his amazing pancakes I would have run even faster. The next morning the pancakes were fantastic. Try them!!! A great city,biking great fun but not for the faint hearted. Surprised how expensive Amsterdam was- restaurants, museum entry.

Reviews.Title: “A real find in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MoMaggs
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with all the wonderful things everyone else has said about this hotel! Owners Roel, Ria, Martijn are excellent hosts. The location is great; I loved being in a neighbourhood where you feel real life is being lived, and yet soooo convenient to everything (including a public bus to Schipol for â‚¬4.00) The schools next door added the sound of children playing (for me, a delight, though maybe not great if you need quiet for an afternoon nap). The owners have only had the property about 6 months and do plan to put their own touches and upgrade some things--but not, I hope, pricing the hotel out of the moderate category! Thanks for everything, de Haas family. I hope I can come back. Tot ziens!

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Orphish
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Fita and were not disappointed. As other reviews note, Roel and his family are wonderful hosts, extremely accommodating. Terrific breakfasts, and yes, the pancakes are wonderful! Our room was comfortable, though basic. Amsterdam is expensive -- this was by far the most expensive of comparable hotels we stayed at on our trip through Belgium and the Netherlands. However, the value was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DGBRA
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita has an excellent location near Van Gogh Museum and close to nice shopping area in amsterdam. The staff is really helpful and warm, and will make you feel at home. The breakfast was delicious, specially the Dutch pancakes!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita Aims to Please”
Reviews.Author: tripletsg-ma
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is a small hotel, more like a bed-and-breakfast. The breakfast was excellent. Try the delicious pancakes and chef quality scrambled eggs. Martin and his brother, Roel, were very helpful answering questions with emails before our trip and throughout the trip. The area is quiet and very well located, by the tram, 2 museums and restaurants. Our room was very spacious, clean, plainly decorated, and comfortable. Who could ask for more? They also do laundry. I would highly recommend this hotel which also has an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “We will return!!!”
Reviews.Author: MKS_AZ
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel, much like a bed and breakfast. Fabulous location. Roel, the hotelier, could not have been more accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: Susan S
Reviews.Content: We were part of a three-couple group from Canada who selected Hotel Fita for a weekend in Amsterdam from Sept 30 to Oct 3. The hotel was very well located close to main areas, amenities and transportation. The hotel went under new management earlier this year and they are great! They were very helpful (did our laundry!!), rooms were clean, spacious and the breakfast served each stay was more than adequate - try the crepes (pancakes) - excellent! We would not hesitate to stay there again and would recommend to others as well.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Celia D
Reviews.Content: We love the area where the Fita is situated. The quiet streets are great for a late night stroll to admire the charming tiled entrance ways etc. The hotel staff were very helpful and enthusiastic. The hotel is pleasantly decorated with quiet plain rooms that are spacious , clean and airy. The breakfast was served in the basement breakfast room and was delicious with freshly made pancakes ! This was our 2nd stay in the Hotel Fita but the owners have changed since our previous trip but the standard have remained high.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helen8631
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is located on a pleasant, tree-lined street close to the major museums, the Concert Hall, the film center, a beautiful park, good restaurants, and a street of luxury shops. The rooms are bright and comfortable, and the breakfast, included in the price of the room, is bountiful and delicious. The hotel is the most accommodating and personable I have encountered in all my years of travel. My husband and I spent a lovely five days in Amsterdam, helped in great part by this perfect small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: chucktown8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are currently on the train to Paris, but I wanted to share our experience at Hotel Fita while it is fresh. The hotel is in a part of the city that is more like a neighborhood, but the walk to any area is extremely easy and Roel and the staff will assist with anything. The hotel is clean, breakfast is great, and it is a 2 minute walk to the tram which will take you to many popular destinations. In addition, the hotel is right across the street from the famous Van Gogh museum which is a must. We would definitely stay here again because at Hotel Fita you are treated as a guest of the house, not a number in a machine that spits you out a room assignment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Aporo
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in previous reviews Hotel Fita ticks all the boxes in the areas that matter. Rooms are not luxurious but are decently furnished & very clean, with comfortable beds, ironing board & iron, both nespresso & instant coffee, tea & hot chocolate, ceiling fan & umbrella. Our bathroom was spacious with a powerful shower & good lighting. Recently installed reasonably priced honesty bar for soft drinks & beer makes up for lack of mini bar in room. Breakfast choices excellent for such a small establishment, with fresh & dried fruits, nuts, seeds, cereals, muesli, yogurt, juices, rolls, toast, pastries, cheeses, scrambled egg & bacon and Ria's delicious homemade raspberry jam & pancakes. Fresh flowers on tables a nice touch. Location can't be bettered for visiting Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh & Stedelijk Museums. Close to canal boat and tram stops but within walking distance to most attractions. Decent cafes close by but many more easily accessible. Very upmarket shopping in next street. We enjoyed being in the quiet mainly residential area. Our room overlooked the childrens play area and whilst we could hear the children playing between 4.00 - 6.00 p.m. the noise did not bother us and we are notoriously 'child un-friendly'. Owners/managers Roel, Martijn & Ria are perfect hosts, always on hand to offer help & advice in excellent English but never overpowering. All in all Hotel Fita provides good quality 3 star accommodation at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: Spacious room with a balcony. Great location 1/2 block from Van Gogh museum and tram line. Outstanding breakfast. Wonderful people. Owner, Roel de Haas, and coworkers were friendly and enthusiastically helpful. Would return in a heartbeat. Dave in Texas

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable”
Reviews.Author: SeattleShanu
Reviews.Content: Great Location,Comfortable rooms,excellent service --more than adequate breakfast. Lastly, most importent for travelers free laundry service!!!!! WOW

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anthony S
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week in this very comfortable boutique hotel, with staff (5 stars) who were genuinely helpful and friendly......the new owner-manager has a genuine talent for hospitality, and has the energy of youth to look after the guests in this small, very well located, peaceful hotel if you love art, shopping (high-end) or quality food, as my wife does. Was actually sad to leave, and will return again next time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, The Great Reviews are True!”
Reviews.Author: waynelim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently visited Amsterdam and were very happy to have stayed in Hotel Fita. The hotel was a very short tram ride (Line 2 & 5) from the main entertainment districts and nightlife, but nicely situated in the museum district which is surrounded by a nice park and well to do and peaceful neighborhoods. We enjoy the nightlife but are happy to have stayed in a Hotel away from it, the endless bars, coffee shops, crowds grow tiring after time. The family that runs Hotel Fita are exceptional Hoteliers. They really get the meaning of being in "Hospitality" and can easily teach the fancy pants hotels around the world a thing or two about making customers feel welcome by adding a personal touch. All the great reviews are true!! I will not repeat!! PS. For a authentic dutch meal visit Hap Hmm, a small little restaurant with fair prices about 10 mins from Hotel Fita by walk.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, family-run hotel packages the best Amsterdam has to offer in the charm of a small town B&B”
Reviews.Author: Djyfn
Reviews.Content: I was surprised from the get-go. Nice staff greeted me with a complimentary map and explanation of various areas of the city. Room was small but not cramped. Hotel had a working elevator. Room came with an umbrella and a nespresso and, if I recall, two complimentary cartridges. Stay included breakfast and laundry service. Hotel had tickets for sale for the nearby Van Gogh museum and Rijkmuseum plus a computer/printer in the basement which was helpful for me to buy last minute online tickets for the Anne Frank House. Great location near two museums and tram stop. The only drawback was limited eating options around the hotel. I should disclaim that i should have asked about places in the vicinity, but I was informed about the touristy places to eat (about 7 minute walk) and more upscale area a little bit further. I was most impressed by the taxi (to the airport) had the hotel reserve the night before. Driver was very nice, taxi very clean, and the airport fare was consistent with in-roon hotel information placard. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this place to others.

Reviews.Title: “Small but exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Northernphoenix
Reviews.Content: This hotel has 15 rooms, so the management knows your name. The breakfast is a special treat, since the pancakes received rave reviews! Location is perfect for those who are museum bound, and what a surprise, but the "Rodeo Drive" of Europe is just one street over. The new ownership is maintaining the standards of cleanliness, and certainly gives one a feeling of being a welcome guest. I would recommend this accommodation to my friends, and would not hesitate to return!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place-Great People”
Reviews.Author: Texastraveler011
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in terrific location. Rooms are of adequate size, bathrooms modern and of ample size. Many very good restaurants within walking distance and hotel owners will provide advice as to which ones would be best to frequent based on your tastes and budget. Good advice! Breakfast was excellent. Owners and staff very helpful and happy to provide guidance and advice. Will definitely stay here again if we return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “coffee”
Reviews.Author: JKDK72e
Reviews.Content: a very clean hotel, good location, good hearty breakfast and in the centre. it had all the usual things in the room the only thing i can comment on the negative side is, please either give the peculated coffee free of charge or take it away and just leave the normal sachets. there was a charge for extra tubs after you had used your 4 free tubs. we had the 3 day travel ticket which is a must great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Yury G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on Sept. 2011. The location is great, in the museum area of Amsterdam. The staff did their best to help us, without any problems or delays. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Trams 2 or 5 will get you to the city center and the central train station of Amsterdam. The hotel's location makes it very attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Stay with a "Family," not a Corporation”
Reviews.Author: Egonvonessen
Reviews.Content: Roel, Martijn, Ria and the Fita team will treat you as one of the family. This family run small boutique Hotel, near the Museums, is ideal for a trip to Amsterdam. It is close to shopping, transportation, restaurants and of course the Museums. My stay could not have been more enjoyable. The breakfast was superb: Hot and welcoming. Don't miss out on the homemade Dutch Pancakes, A must!. The room was compact, (As you would expect in Amsterdam) but efficiently designed. Everything worked like it was supposed to. The room was clean and comfortable. I am already trying to look at my schedule to see when I maybe able to return. This time I will bring my wife! The internet was reliable and easy to access. (Not always a given in Europe)

Reviews.Title: “lives up to its reviews”
Reviews.Author: Tony Y
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my wife & daughter we arrived directly from the air port we wanted to leave our bags and start exploring while we were being checked in we were given maps explanations in such an easy relaxed manner that by the time we had finished our room was ready . the location was fantastic as we like walking we did every thing on foot would go back in a flash the hotel is a little expensive but hey you pay for such a good location the room we had was certainly big enough for the three of us.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. We stayed at this hotel with our two young children prior to a baltic cruise. The location is safe, quite, yet close to tram and shopping. There are many play areas near by for the kids. The hotel is non-smoking which reassured us that the kids will not be subjected to pot/tobacco smell. The breakfast is lovely. The owners (Roel and Martijn) are genuinely caring, attentive, made us feel welcome and have a great future ahead of them. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of individual attention”
Reviews.Author: dusty_girl60
Reviews.Content: We felt at home the minute we walked through the door. Roel, the proprietor, & his staff were very friendly & couldn't do enough for us. Good location with good restaurants nearby. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Twiglet2
Reviews.Content: Agree with all the positives from everyone else. Good location - felt pretty safe - although there don't seem to be any good restaurants nearby, the tram stop is only a few minutes walk. Good breakfasts, lovely clean rooms etc. Beds reasonably comfy. Not quite perfect (!) ...Roel said he's going to do up the rooms but there are a couple of things that could be tweaked now... towels thin and a bit rough & could do with replacing, Nespresso machine in rooms are excellent - but could I suggest allowing 1 capsule per day per person - at the moment you get 4 but have to ask for more or buy them at 4 Euros for 4. However, these things are very minor, and the positives far outweigh the not-quite-positives. The family were all very welcoming and helpful. Definitely good value for money and a very pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay - would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Barbara T
Reviews.Content: We were made to feel at home at the hotel and were welcomed as individuals (rather than ananomous travellers) which can be the case in large corporate hotels! The staff are young and enthusiastic and nothing seems to be too much trouble for them. We were on a short break away and we found the location of the hotel and the friendliness of the staff made our stay all the more enjoyable. We would definitely stay there again. As we are in our early 60's we certainly appreciated the use of the lift (elevator) to get to our room after a long day sightseeing around Amsterdam!!! Barbara & Alan Tynan (UK)

Reviews.Title: “The right place at the right time!”
Reviews.Author: vietvet
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fita is a small, independent family run hotel located just around the corner from Amsterdam's famous museums. It is a very short walk to trams 2 and 5 which will get you most everywhere a tourist would go. Our room was spotless and very comfortable. Restaurants abound within a short walk or by tram. The young owner and/or one of his family members is on the premises all the time. Breakfast was a wonderful treat . Dutch pancakes cooked to order, a nice continental breakfast and freshly cooked scrambled eggs and bacon were available each day. The coffee was wonderful

Reviews.Title: “New owners; same high standards”
Reviews.Author: cameraman612
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Fita for five days with my daughter in August 2011 and it was a major contributor to our enjoyment of Amsterdam. It has a fantastic location in the Museum District, just a block from the Van Gogh Museum and easily reached by tram and bus. It is also close enough to other major Amsterdam attractions that they can easily be reached by foot. The neighborhood is charming and quiet, a nice contrast to the crowds and noise of central Amsterdam. Many reviews of the Fita praised its prior owners, Hans and Loes de Rapper. They recently sold the hotel to another family, but the things that people seemed to like about the de Rappers have been maintained by the new owners, and particularly the two brothers Roel and Martin who seem to deal most with the guests (including the delicious pancakes at breakfast). I would definitely stay at the Fita again the next time I go to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Tu a beat tu”
Reviews.Author: Californialove77
Reviews.Content: had a good tim in Amsterdam made better by this hotel. Good food and great service

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, fantastic service and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ButteryBiscuitBase
Reviews.Content: I've been to Amsterdam a few times before but usually in the more central locations. This location was so much nicer. It really made me want to go back to Amsterdam again. The owners are the nicest hoteliers i've ever met and bend over backwards to look after you and inform you about the city and where to go and what to do. The hotel interior does need a bit of updating decor wise (they plan on doing so soon) but otherwise its very clean and has everything you could ask for. Great value for money and I will definitely stay here again when I return. Great stuff guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Pauline958
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location to museums, tram and vongel park. You are about 30 steps to Van Gogh museum and the Reiks museum. Also the #2 and 5 tram that takes you all around. The hotel is spotless, good size bathrooms and delicious breakfast with a freshly made crepe. The owner, Roal, is charming and helpful. About 2 short blocks away is the fashion district while not so lively is a good place to relax at a cafe in a calmer environment.. This is a very good value and we would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Onthegogirl_11
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is one block from the tram, one block from the Van Gogh Museum, two blocks from the Rijksmuseum and the Canal Bus stop. It's convenient to the city center without being overcrowded. The Hotel is run by two brothers who are both friendly and helpful. I was greeted with a sparkling cocktail that tasted like a Bellini but was probably non-alcoholic and assorted nuts. Their Mom helps out and took lots of time explaining the sights and the best way to get around. My rate included breakfast with bacon, scrambled eggs, breads, juice, coffee, tea or hot chocolate, pastry, cereals and Dutch pancakes to die for. My single room was small but quite comfortable with a single bed. The furniture is modest but there was a TV that I never used, plenty of lights, a window that opened for fresh air and a good sized desk. There is free WIFI. The was a coffee maker that I didn't use and an umbrella was provided. There was an in room safe. I am looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hansblix
Reviews.Content: After spending a week at this hotel in late July, I can't say enough good things about the Fita. The guys that run the place do everything to make your stay as comfortable as possible. They even do your laundry for free if you ask them! The breakfast was excellent. The rooms, though small, were quiet and had everything I needed. The owners of the hotel also were very helpful in explaining to me the various attractions and the quirks of the city (including its useful but sometimes confusing public transport system). The location of this hotel is another plus. It is much more peaceful than the more historical center of the city, but close enough to many of the main musuems (such as the Van Gogh and the underrated Rijksmusuem). There is a myth that the service industry in Holland is poor, but you'd never know it at the Hotel Fita. If I'm lucky enough to go back to Amsterdam, I will stay at the Fita.

Reviews.Title: “Hope to be back next Spring.”
Reviews.Author: OrangeParkMagic
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita was one the first and best reservations I made when planning our first European trip this year. I was so disappointed that our visit was going to be a few days after Keukenhof Gardens closed for the season; I decided to try and do something about it. I first needed to see if I could change our Hotel reservations to arrive earlier. Roel answered my request within a few hours telling me that it wouldn't be a problem and that the garden would be worth a visit even on the last day. (The gardens were wonderful.) We arrived in Schipol and took Bus 197 from the airport to the Leidseplein stop (Just asked the driver to let us know when to disembark) we were just a few blocks from the hotel. While we purchased our bus tickets for the trip into Amsterdam from the driver, we had stopped at the tourist information shop at the airport and purchased our tickets to Keukenhof and a 72hour GVB pass. This saved both time and money. When we arrived at Hotel Fita, Roel greeted us and checked us in. He provided a map of Amsterdam and went over all the major areas, sites and transportation. Very basic information yet all we needed to get started. He showed us to our room downstairs...at first I wasn't sure about the location but we loved our cozy room away from everything. This did put us right next to the playground for the daycare center, yes the children where outside. Did we hear them YES they are very young children and they can get loud, we could hear them laughing, giggling, running, playing. Did it in anyway disturb us NO. Our room and the bathroom were spotless including our resident guest "Rubber Ducky." The standards for the maintenance and up keep of this hotel are the top priority for the new owners. We did speak with Martijn during our visit; he told us they have plans for improvement in the future. They would like to add additional rooms to the top floor of the hotel and a possible new full service restaurant downstairs. While we only saw other guest during breakfast, everyone had a nice rapport and it did seem that the guest were welcomed friends. Like many first time travelers when we started our journey we assumed this would be a once in a lifetime trip, after visiting so many wonderful places you find they have a way of calling you backâ€¦.so I have now started planning a new trip, first stop Amsterdam and Hotel Fita hope to be visiting next spring, early enough to see the tulip fields in bloom. The Kilpatricks

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita! A wonderful Choice!”
Reviews.Author: cambriah
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Hotel Fita for two nights this past July. The new owners were outstanding. The breakfast, which is included in the room rate, was lovely. Although the room was a bit small by American standards, it was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. It can be a bit noisy during the day, since there is some type of school or day care center located next door. The PERFECT location, close to the museums and hop on hop off canal boats

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Location, Wonderful Hosts”
Reviews.Author: ClumsyTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a 3 week trip to Europe and Amsterdam was our 3rd city. This was my first trip to Amsterdam and I wanted a clean hotel in a good area at a good price. The stay included a weekend so I was having a difficult time finding somewhere close to the center as the hotels fill up on the weekends. I saw the reviews for this place and they have availability so I booked it. It is a little bit from the center, maybe a 20-30 minute walk, but there is a tram about 2 minutes away. It is near the great museums, the park, and a few minutes to he canal cruises. My husband and I did not come to party so it was nice to have a quiet place to go back to especially how crazy it gets in the Red Light District. However, it may actually be the family that runs this place that is the best part. They could really teach classes on hospitality, I felt like I was in a 5 star hotel. They really try to get to know all of the guests and feel like you are just that, a guest. We requested on of the largest rooms but I think a smaller room would still be enough for 2 people without a lot of luggage. It is a fair price by Amsterdam standards. They even do your laundry for you and will have it ready the next day. What I liked: The family Clean room large, carpet and bathroom especially (great smelling hand soap that I wish I could buy for myself) Coffee and Nespresso machine in the room Comfortable Beds Internet Access Quiet Location Free Laundry Service Good European style breakfast (try the pancakes) What I did not like as much: The towels were decent but not great, not that big of a deal Not a lot to do in the area after dark

Reviews.Title: “PERSONAL ATTENTION”
Reviews.Author: dimsumgirl2
Reviews.Content: This is a family run hotel. New owners have been running the hotel for three months. Roels was nice and information. Ideal location, near museums, trams, and in a very quiet neighborhood. Where can you find a hotel that personally does your laundry? I lost a camera cord and emailed Roels. He right away answered my email. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “Please have the pancakes ready, We'll be back soon!!!”
Reviews.Author: ANIMOYAES
Reviews.Content: We had such an excellent stay at the great Hotel FITA, we really had a wonderful time visiting Amsterdam and a great ingredient for such a great experience was staying at Hotel Fita and having the opportunity to meet Hans, Loes & all Fitaâ€™s team; every single detail in Hotel Fita made us feel at home, welcomed, appreciated and cared. They have what we call â€œa special touchâ€� with their personal way to take care of guests, having always little but special details during our stay; breakfast experience was kind of inspirational every morning, their special juices & pancakes were a charge of energy every morning always accompanied with an illustrative chat with any of Hotel's owners and/or staff members, full of excellent recommendations for the day. At this time, we just began planning a trip to Europe with our kids for next year and nevertheless we already visited Amsterdam and Hotel Fita, we would like to share with them such a great experience, so I will be contacting them soon to make reservations at Hotel Fita in advance.

Reviews.Title: “10th Stay at Fabulous Hotel Fita !”
Reviews.Author: SFDutchman
Reviews.Content: This was our 10th visit to the lovely Hotel Fita in 8 years!!! My partner and I always have enjoyed our stay here. The hotel recently changed management and it looks like the new managers will continue the small hotel feel which was the old Fita. Have stayed in all room types, but mostly the Business room (Type A). All rooms have a large bathroom with deep tub and shower combo (American style) and very good water pressure. Beds are comfortable. All rooms have a coffee maker that makes delicious coffee...although we also recommend the coffee house around the corner (called the Brantmeesters!) No air condition but a great ceiling fan does the trick. Wonderful English buffet breakfast in the mornings.....served with a smile by the management. The staff are very friendly and truly go out of their way to give you a comfortable and memorable stay in Amsterdam. The hotel is ULTRA convenient to the Van Gogh Museum (1 block away) and the Rijksmuseum (2 blocks away), as well as the Stedelijk. If shopping is your thing, the PC Hoofdstraat is one block away! There is a small kindergarten diagonally across from the hotel with a playground. Usually a bit noisy but ONLY at lunchtime - otherwise a very quiet street. The #2 & #5 tram from Centraal Station stops one block away on Paulus Potterstraat (Van Gogh stop). Also, the Bus #197 to Schipol airport stops about 2 blocks away (Rijksmuseum). There is an Albert Hijn grocery store on the museumplein - a stone's throw away form the Fita. We have...and will continue to feel at home at the Fita Hotel whenever we are in Amsterdam... (Alexander & Joe)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: Ann1609
Reviews.Content: New owners were friendly and helpful. Yes, they did our laundry in one afternoon for FREE! Nice room -- smallish but just fine. Great breakfast. Near the major museums, but easy to get around the rest of Amsterdam by foot or trams or bike. You won't regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good family experience”
Reviews.Author: elisakiss
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in early July at the Hotel Fita with our girls, 9 and 7, and had a great time. Nice neighborhood with a school playground across the street within walking distance of the canals, good food and the tram. We arrived tired in the morning and Roel showed us immediately to our room.
