We really enjoyed the breakfast, especially the crepes.... some of the best we've had, anywhere. We and our kids are young, so we ended up walking to and from most places in the city directly from the hotel... what a beautiful city... walking is nice. The hotel is in the museum district and near a park... a nice quiet neighborhood that is bordered by the fashion boulevard which is served by central tram lines. This is a good place for families with children who want to see Amsterdam comfortably and safely.... highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: liapell
Reviews.Content: This 16-room hotel is a block away from the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum and close to Vondel Park and tram lines yet has a small neighborhood feel. New owner Roel and his brother Martin are personable, energetic, and create a welcoming but never cloying feel to this fabulous hotel. From the initial greeting and complimentary champagne to the comfortable room and beds, Hotel Fita creates an atmosphere that feels simultaneously homey and up for adventure. The breakfast is top-notch. Hotel Fita sits next door to a school so if you're averse to the sounds of children playing this might not be the spot for you. We found it enchanting.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experince during our 18 day trip in Europe”
Reviews.Author: JCK_Miss
Reviews.Content: This was our best hotel experince during our 18 day trip through Europe and we stayed at Hotel Fita for four nights. The hotel's location was great, the staff were welcoming and very helpful, the apple pancakes offered for breakfast were the best we had in Holland, and rooms were very clean and confortable. We would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos, Kudos, Applause, Applause !!!”
Reviews.Author: ezog
Reviews.Content: My Wife, 14 year old Daughter and 80 year old Mother stayed at the Fita for a week in July. I had very high expectations given the strong reviews on TripAdvisor (and elsewhere). The new owners, Roel and Martijn, met and exceeded my expectations in every way. Hospitable, earnest, and very, very helpful, the brothers/owners were really fantastic hosts. Great breakfast every morning and all the staff were wonderful. The location is excellent, in the Museum District of Amsterdam, still close enough to walk everywhere, but not in the crush of tourists that line some of the major streets in the center of downtown. Also, the Vondelpark is two blocks away, which is a lovely spot to walk, jog or ride a bike. We'd recommend the Fita to everyone and anyone. Just a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, quiet,clean and ultra friendly”
Reviews.Author: AK111
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, literally across the street from the Van Gogh museum and close to Rijks Museum. Roel the new owner and his staff are friendly and very accommodating in all regards. Rooms are very clean and comfortable, the beds are great. Bathrooms look a little industrial but Roel is planning improvements. Great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Bed and Breakfast right in the heart of the Museum District”
Reviews.Author: jessemoen
Reviews.Content: If you are in Amsterdam looking for a charming and quaint hotel in a quiet neighborhood close to the museums and restaurants, look no further. Roel and his family made us feel like we were a part of theirs from day one. We got to know his mother, his brother and a family friend quite well and they were excellent at sending us to all the right cafes, nightclubs, and even suggested a great town to visit one hour away by train right on the North Sea. My wife had fallen in love with this hotel back when Hans was running the place and we were excited to find out Roel and his family are keeping up the same level of service she came to expect from Hotel Fita. We were welcomed with a sparkling wine and snack when we got in our rooms, The daily breakfast of eggs, cheeses, meats, cereals and breads were always lovely, and Queenie was there to make us fresh coffee and dutch pancakes upon request. They have a lift so you aren't carrying luggage up the stairs and the room was quiet and comfortable. Laundry service also came with the price of the room. My wife and I know where we will be staying every time we visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: bobcatdeclan
Reviews.Content: The long weekend my wife and recently spent in Amsterdam was a belated honeymoon. It was made all the more special and enjoyable by staying at Hotel Fita. The hospitality shown to us was noteworthy. From the minute we walked in the front door, the staff took very good care of us. Our room was first-rate, large and comfortable, and it was well cleaned each day. The breakfast was very good, in particular, the pancakes, made to order. The location of the hotel is perfect--museums, the park, restaurants, shopping, and especially transportation are all minutes away, yet the hotel is set on a quiet, leafy street. The service and assistance by the new, young owner and his brother could not have been better. We will not only tell our friends about the hotel, but we are telling the public by writing this review. The place to stay in Amsterdam is Hotel Fita. P.S. Take bus 197 from the airport (4 Euros per person), and it stops a 5 minute walk from the hotel. What a find! s/Bob and Cathy

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: WandE11
Reviews.Content: The service in this charming hotel was really unique. Where else do they offer to do your laundry, do it in one morning and then donâ€™t charge anything? Where else do they offer free phone calls to anywhere in the world? Where else does someone come to ask about your plans for the day while you are eating breakfast (a very good one) to offer advice on any details? Where else can one walk to two of the worldâ€™s great museums in less than five minutes? And the room in which we stayed was very nice too. W&E Woodbridge, CT USA

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and will definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: Wozzas2
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here in lovely quite area. Close to the canal boat rides and museums. Easy access to Trams. Lovely family run hotel and Roel the Manager was extremely helpful. Nice touch to offer laundry service and great pancakes for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Bed & Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Cindypeck
Reviews.Content: The family was most helpful, very accommodating. The breakfast was wonderful. Would highly recommend tis hotel, also good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Friendly Welcome”
Reviews.Author: mrsmccormick
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at Hotel Fita, but wished we stayed longer. We checked in rather late and were given a friendly greeting, a map with a quick overview of the sights in Amsterdam, restaurant recommendations and showed to our room. The hotel was very quiet, clean and pretty spacious. Breakfast was included with the room and it was delicious! This hotel is within walking distance of the main museums and has easy access to the trams to get into central Amsterdam within a few minutes. We bought our Van Gogh Museum tickets at the front desk and skipped the line at the museum too. Next time we go to Amsterdam, we'll be staying at Hotel Fita Again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Clean with the Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: 2Penguins1Hat
Reviews.Content: We were only one night at the Hotel Fita, but the short experience we did have was enough to bring us back the next time we visit Amsterdam. After a long plane ride we were welcomed by Ruul, warmly smiling from ear to ear. Friendly, informative and accommodating, we were quickly checked in and shown to our room. Room #10 is located adjacent to the front desk, which I will admit made me fear the noise of every hotel guest's arrival, but we did not hear a peep due to an extra door that separated our room from the activity. The room itself was larger than we expected and sparkling clean. I appreciated the clean, sparse decor as it makes it easier to pack up and not miss a thing upon departure. #10 has a large window that presents a lovely view of the street and the school across the way. Though other travelers reporting on this site found the school to be noisy, we were not bothered by the children playing during their recess hour. The school is active only during the day and, of course, never on the weekends. We are accustomed to a king bed at home, but did not have much of a problem with the two twins pushed together, which seems to be very common in European accommodations.The bathroom was also large with a shower steaming great water pressure and long, comfortable tub for relaxing after a lengthy plane ride or for tired muscles after a day of touring; all white tiles and squeaky clean, blow dryer included. The street outside is well traveled during the day with walkers and cyclists, and the parking near the hotel is limited and expensive$ We had rented a car, so Ruul referred us to a parking structure nearby that was much less expensive with easy access. We parked for the duration of our stay and walked, pedaled. and floated our way through Amsterdam. After a fitful night's sleep, we awakened to walk downstairs to a cozy little area for the breakfast that is included in the price of the room. All the regular breakfast goodies along with great coffee (Douwe Egberts) and a pancake made to order. We were checking out that morning, but wished to stow our luggage for a bit while we took in the sights. Though it was not under secure "lockdown", the staff at the Fita had no problem accommodating our luggage under their watchful eye for our convenience. If you are looking for a party atmosphere, fussiness, or high chic, then this is probably not the place for you. On the other hand, if you are looking for wonderful service, comfortable and clean rooms, and an excellent night's sleep for a pleasant tomorrow, we highly recommend the Hotel Fita, an Amsterdam gem!

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel outside the core”
Reviews.Author: short_stack101
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here in late June. If you're looking for a place that is new, swanky and in the centre of the city, look elsewhere. But if you want something that is clean, cozy, and a little off the beaten path I would recommend Hotel Fita. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, the room was very reasonably priced, and the location was perfect for what I wanted - very close to the Van Gogh museum, the Rijksmusem, and Vondelpark, and about a 25 minute walk to the train station. The breakfast was excellent and Ria makes a great "pankcake"!

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Angenmax
Reviews.Content: My family and I were overwhelmed by the hospitality extended to us by Roel and team at Hotel Fita. Firstly, our welcome was exceptional. Roel checked us in and spent time explaining where all of Amsterdams' main attractions were as well as recommending some great places to eat. We were then shown to our room which was fabulous....high ceilings, French doors, stained glass, huge bathroom...what more could you ask for. As if all this wasn't enough....free wi-fi in our room, breakfast pancakes to die for and our laundry was washed and dried completely free of charge while we were out sightseeing for the day! Did I mention that Hotel Fita is literally around the corner from the Van Gogh Museum? It's not often that you receive such exceptional service from a hotel, but Roel and his lovely family showed genuine hospitality above and beyond any I have received before. Thank you for making us feel so welcome. We hope to see you all again some day, and Max hopes to give Bella another pat!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita - Great People & Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: burkemtnman
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel near the Museumplein, the Rijksmuseum, the Van Gogh Museum and Vondel Park. Quiet location away from downtown but still walking distance to most of the sites in Amsterdam and on direct tram route to Amsterdam Centraal. Only a couple of blocks from the canals. Roel de Haas and his staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. There is a small lift for the luggage and the stairs are steep but this just adds to the ambiance of the hotel. One can not forget to mention the wonderful breakfast's, a variety of cheeses, yogurts, cereal, fresh fruit salad, breads and pastries but the best of all are the excellent dutch "pancakes" that Roel or his brother Martin make. We had great stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing level of helpfulness”
Reviews.Author: SophiagoestoItaly
Reviews.Content: We just spent two nights at the Hotel Fita, and concur with the glowing comments given here. The staff were gracious when we had to change our reservation dates twice. Arriving in the evening after a long day, we were welcomed like friends - including a surprise (and very appreciated) couple of glasses of sparkling wine and some nuts delivered to our room! The staff had taken the time to learn our names, and introduced themselves by name as well. They were helpful and patient in helping us get oriented to Amsterdam - an amazing, beautiful city! Our corner room had two huge windows. For those who complain about the noise of children playing in the school next door, well - they are children playing in the school next door! It's a wonderful sound. Embrace it. We had a very early departure to the airport, and the hotel also arranged the best taxi in Amsterdam - a beautiful, clean car and helpful, prompt driver. Overall, a great experience. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Allen_1961
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Amsterdam with our 3 teenage children and stayed at Hotel Fita. Our rooms were ready for us when we arrived from the airport in the morning. Everything was clean and functional. The proprietor gave us an orientation to Amsterdam that was extremely helpful during our stay. He offered to do our laundry and we accepted - it was returned to our room promptly and neatly folded! Breakfast was lovely, especially the pancakes. The hotel offered free Wi-Fi and had a computer available for guests' use. The location is perfect - a nice neighborhood in the museum area, close to a tram stop. We always like to stay in hotels with "character" and this one did not disappoint. In fact, we all felt like we were staying with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all regards”
Reviews.Author: linpaws
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel. We stayed for 5 days and it was everything I expected. Huge advantage having breakfast in the morning (pancakes were to die for!). I am not sure why some people in previous reviews complained about the smell of disinfectant. This did not bother us at all and in fact it was good to know that they had cleaned daily. Also some people had complained about being close to a school and screaming children. We did hear the children but it is certainly not as bad as was suggested in other reviews. The location was excellent. The tram stop is minutes away and all the important museums are within walking distance. I will certainly stay here again. The people who manage the hotel were extremely friendly and help you in anyway they can. Stay here and you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in museum district! Room was neat and comfortable, awesome breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaPT
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and tidy as others have attested to. Very comfortable bed. The personal service is great and the breakfast and laundry service make it just perfect. I wish all hotels could be like this one!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Jane2travel
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Fita; the new owners had experience with the family who'd owned it for 30 years and do a great job. Even if they were busy and not at the front desk, a phone call from your room reached them immediately. Breakfast is now served at 7:30 a.; delicious, with pancake, eggs, warm pastries and such, though the hot food was not ready until around 8:00 a., but plenty was ready at 7:30 and it was delicious. Everyone we worked with was so kind, gracious and knowledgeable. We had Room #14, a corner room on the same floor as the front desk. It was spacious, clean and comfortable, ceiling fan, no a/c; however, if you need to sleep during the day, you could be disturbed by the private primary school kids playing outside. The heavy comforters were too warm for me. They called cabs for us, the tram is one short block away as is the Van Gogh Museum, Chanel, Tiffany, the Rijks Museum--all so close. It is about a 45-60 min. walk to the Dam and train station area, or an easy tram ride. We highly recommend the Hotel Fita.

Reviews.Title: “warm hospitality”
Reviews.Author: backtobruce
Reviews.Content: Family run. Everyone helpful. Lovely big light airy room Few minutes walk to museums and Concertgebow.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, hospitality, cleanliness and service”
Reviews.Author: lindabw-b
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location was perfect for our needs. It is in the museum district, has public transportation within 2 short blocks, and has excellent restaurants in the neighborhood. It's a short tram ride to everything one would want to see. The family operating the hotel are excellent hosts. We received a wonderful orientation to the neighborhood, what to see and do in Amsterdam, and how to get around the city. In addition, whenever there was a question, there was helpful advise or directions. Breakfast, by the way, was as good as everything else at the hotel (be sure to eat the pancakes!). Our room was spacious, very clean, and comfortable. Free wi-fi and cable tv helped us keep in touch with news and whomever we needed to contact. A return trip to Amsterdam is not unimaginable and we will definitely want to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff and excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: world27over
Reviews.Content: The staff makes sure that they greet you by name and get to know you while you stay at the location. Unlike chains, this hotel treats each person individually and is always eager to help with directions, advice on restaurants, and helping to order tickets for special evenings. The breakfasts are delicious and have a variety of hot and cold, healthy and mouth watering items.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and warm hospitality”
Reviews.Author: benjzmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Fita one night pre-river cruise in mid-May. The hotel was located conveniently for us just two blocks from the cruise meeting point, which made it easy for us to walk over with our luggage. The new owners were hospitable (although very busy, so the front desk was often unmanned), the room was simple and very clean, the bathroom very roomy, and the hotel has a "lift" to accommodate suitcases, because the stairs up to the higher floors are very steep and narrow. Breakfast in the morning was plentiful and fresh. The hotel is one block from Museum Square, near a tram stop, and just a short walk from the streets that lead you into the center of all the action. I would definitely stay here again if in Amsterdam. Good luck to the new young owners -- they have a bright future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: Sarita53
Reviews.Content: This is a small homey hotel in a great location, removed from the bustle of the city but only a very short tram ride away from it. Great breakfast, but only from 8 a.m. on, so if you are out and about early, you will miss it. I never saw anyone at the front desk, so if I had a question, I had to hunt someone down. The single room was tiny, but I got used to it. My only complaint was the curtain was so thin and transparent and there is a bright light right outside, so the room never really got dark.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with teens”
Reviews.Author: goodhikers1986
Reviews.Content: What a location! I highly recommend this place. It's only a short stroll to the museums as well as a tram stop. The big factor for us was the proximity to the Leidseplein which is the "happening" place in Amsterdam. The owners and staff of Hotel Fita are fantastic. This was a spur of the moment trip for us so I only made reservations the day before our arrival. It was a very busy weekend in Amsterdam and Hotel Fita could only provide rooms for us for Friday and Sunday nights but they were able to find rooms for us right down the street at another hotel for Sat. night. We were happy to return to Hotel Fita for Sunday night due to the warmth of the staff and the breakfasts. We were served eggs and bacon as well as pancakes! We were traveling with 2 older teens so the proximity to the clubs at Leidseplein was a big plus for us. We did not worry about them walking back to the hotel late at night. The hotel is located in a lovely residential neighborhood with schools across the street. The rooms are nice. Even their small double room was plenty large and the bathroom was bigger than I expected. All in all great place!

Reviews.Title: “They really know personal service at Hotel Fita!”
Reviews.Author: Ruth0304
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on a rainy day, feeling tired. Within a few minutes, a knock on the door brought a refreshing glass of sparkling cider, cheese and crackers. That was all we needed to get our energy back. The staff volunteered to do our laundry FOR FREE (tips are good) and arranged car service to the airport. Hotel Fita is a small, family owned hotel. The rooms aren't fancy but the entire staff is so friendly that you instantly feel relaxed, at home, and ready to explore Amsterdam. The location is fabulous -- just a few minutes walk from the museums and Vondelpark and on a very quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely return....we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mbenton
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here! Roel, the owner, and his staff were very friendly, helpful, and accommodating! The location was perfect as it is in the museum district, a block from the Van Gogh and Rijks museums, close to the tram and bus pick ups, and near wonderful restaurants! The breakfast was delicious. Be sure to try the pancakes! We couldn't have asked for a better way to end our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: mccl2987
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed 3-nights in Amsterdam at the end of May. I'm so happy we selected to stay at Hotel Fita. The staff was warm and friendly, the room clean and comfortable and the breakfast was excellent! My biggest concern when booking was location, but it ended-up being perfect! We picked-up a 3-day tram pass and were able to pick-up the 2 or 5 tram right around the corner. Within minutes we could be anywhere in Amsterdam. I highly recommend Hotel Fita, it's a great value in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel would return”
Reviews.Author: leslieh33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 4 nights in May 2011 and were very happy. The owner manager is there all the time and very helpful. The breakfast is include with lots of healthy choices and good service. They will do your laundry for you free if you ask, which was very helpful to us.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: high_standards_4_me
Reviews.Content: Lived up to reviews on TA. Great location close to museums, park and tram lines. Very friendly, helpful staff and clean, comfortable rooms. The breakfast was great with a spread of pastries, cheeses, yogurt, cereal and fruit plus scrambled eggs, bacon and "must have" pancakes. While it does sit on a quiet side street, our only criticism of our room(#6) would be that is was street level with a school next door. There are rather loud, boisterous kindergarten age children playing at intervals from 8:30am to 4:30 pm on weekdays. ( Our home is by a school so this barely bothered us.) Extra bonuses were free WiFi and they also did our laundry for free (where can you get that?!).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Clarendon Hills
Reviews.Content: This hotel/b&b is just charming. Very close to tram stop. Easy to navigate to all parts of the city. (eg: walk to tram, hop on and off to any region in the city - super easy to switch trams. Walk thru the neighborhoods, hop back on, don't forget to swipe your ticket as you exit) The hotel is perfectly quiet by night, windows wide open. (I imagine this is NOT the case with canal side properties. This is a lovely neighborhood of private homes and small hotels, and happy children by day. The friendly service is well beyond the accolades reported. These folks are truly welcoming, speak wonderful English (as will many guests), provide home made signature Dutch pancakes for breakfast, in addition to complete breakfast with meat, eggs, yogurt, fruit, cheese, croissants, bread, beverages.... you'll skip lunch. Yes, the welcome beverage is most delightful. The spotless rooms, fresh, crisp linens and airy curtains give a very comfortable feel, in addition to the in-room safe, coffee maker, teapot, and clock radio, and hairdryer. You can pack lighter if you wish (don't forget your american washcloth if you want one) The re were no vacancies during our stay, so book early! I think they will continue to be a very desired hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We found it and it was great!”
Reviews.Author: Traveldawg2
Reviews.Content: We found the Fita in a review in a travel magazine. We booked and it was great. The people were helpful and the location was fantastic. You can easily walk to many museums nearby. The Van Gogh Museum was especially enjoyable. Bottom line...we will return! Thanks Hotel Fita! Bob and Betty Ricks, guests in May 2011

Reviews.Title: “T.A., You did it again!”
Reviews.Author: Seniortravelers14
Reviews.Content: Wonderful little hotel, one block from the Van Gogh. Really more of a B&B than hotel. Breakfast was great, people were great, room was great. One of the nicest hotel experiences we have had.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel--quiet, clean & with great staff”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaDane
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked away on a quiet street near the Van Gogh museum. The rooms are comfortable and clean, the staff is friendly, accommodating, and helpful, the breakfasts marvelous. Definitely worth every cent for the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita is an excellent family run hotel.”
Reviews.Author: shulesjoe
Reviews.Content: Roel, Martijn and Ria are the owner/operators of Hotel Fita in Amsterdam. We start our day with the most excellent breakfast. The hotel has about 15 rooms that are comfortable at the end of a day of visiting the sites of Amsterdam. Roel and Martijn can be found in the hotel during the course of the day. The main goal appears to be to find a way to make your stay more comfortable and rewarding.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: kluckingbear
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel Fita were very friendly and appeared genuinely concerned about helping to make our vacation in Amsterdam a success. They were very informed about the area, where to go, when to go and how to access events. The hotel itself was very clean and had modern conveniences, yet still maintained dutch charm. The stairs were a work out, but that's Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel met all our needs and more, and made us feel welcome.”
Reviews.Author: old-guy11
Reviews.Content: Even the restaurant recommendations proved excellent. The owners are new, and making a full-time effort to meet every guest's needs. The location is very close to the museums and public transportation, and only a short walk from the heart of the city, but the street was quiet even on the weekend. The room was clean and comfortable, and the plumbing was the best we found in Holland.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Great Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: FiveforTee
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita offers sparkling clean, huge rooms with attention to detail. I especially enjoyed the sense of humor displayed by the rubber duck on the tub! The brothers who run the hotel personify kindness and customer service. Located a couple of blocks from the Steidelijk Museum and a tram stop, and near the scenic and peaceful Vondelpark, the hotel offers a serene stay in a bustling city. Everything at this hotel is done with excellence, including the large buffet breakfast that includes their speciality pancakes (buttery and topped off with powdered sugar - delicious!).

Reviews.Title: “An absolute pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: artlover0346
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Fita was a high point of our recent European trip. The Hotel is located in a quiet residential area very close to the Museums we had come to Amsterdam to visit. It was also within easy walking distance to shops and restaurants and tram access. Our room was more spacious than we expected, certainly more so than our rooms in London and Paris. The hospitality of the owners and staff was top notch and they deserve high praise for their warmth and concern for their guests. Being able to purchase Museum tickets at the Hotel saved us precious time by avoiding line-ups. The dining room was very pleasant and the selection of food was excellent ; the pancakes are not to be missed! This was our first trip to Amsterdam...we loved the city and marvelled at all the bicycles and relaxed way people went about their business. Staying at the Hotel Fita was the icing on the cake of a visit that was too short.

Reviews.Title: “Run by the most caring and efficient family, cannot say anything but good!”
Reviews.Author: dinahoward
Reviews.Content: Stayed in may Band B like hotels and this was the best. Very clean, wonderful breakfast, always available to answer our many questions and went out of their way to accomidate our every need. Located in a very safe neighborhood with many great eating places within a 5 minute or less walk. 5 minutes to Van Gough and Rembrant Museums. Cheers to Ruel, Martin, and Mom for their hospitality. The Dianes.

Reviews.Title: “A reliable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bcaselaide
Reviews.Content: Two enthusiastic and friendly brothers have just taken over the management. Good location, nice premise, a strong emphasis on service is evident. Just a street away from the VanGogh Museum. My only suggestion for improvement is to have a small fridge in the room so that we could have real milk for the nice coffee provided.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located with the best hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: sfshopgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three nights with a friend of mine from the 5th of May through the 8th. The boys at Hotel Fita were SOOOO nice and hospitable. Roel and his brother (sorry! I forgot his name!) were so very accommodating and made us feel at home. It really feel like we were visiting family. I could not recommend staying here more. It was pretty easy to get to from the airport, we took the train then the tram. The hotel directions were clear. The room was very clean. We had a type A room, and it was very spacious with a big bathroom. I must warn you that the shower pressure is very strong! It caught me off guard and the hand held nozzle went flying off the holder. It provided for great laugh as I can only imagine what I sounded like from the other side of the wall. The breakfast that is included is yummy! Like other reviewers mentioned, the pancakes are delicious! This hotel is a block away from the Van Gogh museum. You can buy your tickets from Hotel Fita, which I suggest. We skipped the long lines and walked right in. We bought tickets on line for the Anne Frank House, but were able to go in a bit early. If you go late in the day, it's not that crowded. The tram is around the corner from the hotel, and on that line you can get to a lot of different parts of the city. Oh, and the shops across the plaza are all high end! We were not expecting to see Chanel, Cartier, Hermes, etc. Nice little window shopping treat. What I loved about the hotel was the hospitality, cleanliness and location. The only thing that I didn;t care for is it does smell like bacon. But the only reason why I didn't like it, is when I would smell it, it would make me want to eat it!

Reviews.Title: “quaint hotel in museum area”
Reviews.Author: allen5675
Reviews.Content: a gem of a small hotel in a nice are with great shopes near by. run by two brothers and there mom. they are very pleasant and very helpful. great breakfast, laundry and internet available. very clean and neat

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mamgam1
Reviews.Content: This tiny family-run hotel is the perfect place to stay in Amsterdam. Roel and his brother, Martin, are the friendly and helpful hosts here in the museum district, eager to get tickets or help in any way. Location is perfect for walking to Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum, public transportation is very close and easy to get to other places. Rooms (type A -I didn't see the others) are clean, quiet and spacious; the bathroom with shower was very large for European standards. Breakfast buffet was huge hot and delicious. I can't say enough about this hotel, and I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “New Owner - Same Great Service”
Reviews.Author: AustinCyclist
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at Hotel Fita and our first with the transitioning-in new owner, Raol. Rooms were impecabbly clean, breakfasts were quality (and included in the room rate) with wonderful pancakes (crepes). Raol and his family are very friendly and go out of their way to provide assistance and make your stay as comfortable as possible. This continues to be our #1 choice in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Gripplebrook
Reviews.Content: A clean and friendly family run hotel that gives you great value for money. The two brothers who (with a little help from their mum) run the hotel are only to pleased to provide help and assistance when asked. The room was massive by European standards with an ensuite which too was large. The location is right near the Van Gogh museum and within walking distance of the Rijksmuseum. The breakfast with your choice of home made scrambled eggs and bacon, cereal and more is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL...great location and super nice people”
Reviews.Author: matsirhc
Reviews.Content: I don't think we could have done much better in Amsterdam. The hotel is on a quiet street in Amsterdam, literally around the corner from the Van Gogh museum. It was convenient to get into the heart of the city. The room was beautiful and clean. They even brought us free sparkling cider upon arrival. I would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel out of our entire three country and six city trip!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug33048
Reviews.Content: We were amazed at the attention the hotel staff gave us. At all times we felt as if we had a personal travel guide with us! The staff would provide us with the answers to our travel questions before we even asked the travel questions! Before I go on any further I must tell you that the breakfast that was included in our room cost was the best breakfast of our entire three country, two week trip! If they ask you if you want pancakes with your breakfast you must say yes! The room was quiet and had a balcony with glass doors that would let the glorious morning and afternoon light shine in.The hotel had a perfect location was within a block of the Van Gogh Museum and the Reijtsmuseum. The hotel was immaculate and I would not stay anywhere else in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Always excells, excellent hosts”
Reviews.Author: cheshireguy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Fita on numerous visits, but had not been for some time. Still perfection..... super clean room, with tea/coffee and a NESPRESSO Coffee maker, well done. Good choice at breakfast, scrambled egg and bacon, and pancakes too. Owners know how to run a hotel and the young team are a delight, Roel was most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Cultural Visit”
Reviews.Author: GingerNut78
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Fita while on a University trip to Ansterdam, my students were staying in the nearby hostel, so Hitel Fita provided an excellent base between them and the museums which were the main focus of our trip. I would recommend the hotel to any type of traveller or family. The owners are lovely people and really cater for every need. I hope to stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Say 'yes' to the pancakes”
Reviews.Author: kbsmith23
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel Fita online and decided to stay there because of it's location (museum quarter) and the favorable reviews on trip advisor. It was everything I had hoped and more. The room was compact, but had everything I needed...from the Nespresso machine, the kettle and coffee/hot chocolate supplies to the comfortable bed and the best shower (biggest with really good water pressure) I had on this trip to Europe. The hotel was always very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was fabulous...and the pancakes!!! Just say 'yes'... The location was perfect for me, a stone's throw to the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum. I would definitely stay at Hotel Fita again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Louiseee_2
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly, near museums and designer shopping. A bit away from nightly entertainment but that makes for a quiet night's sleep. The staff speaks excellent English and were very helpful with early check-in, directions, and generally making sure we had everything we needed. Fairly basic rooms but good beds, good water pressure. It is a small facility so no lobby or lounge area but we didn't need that.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly family run, good service and excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Bransbyfolk
Reviews.Content: This hotel in the heart of the museum area is conveniently situated, near to tram services. It is family run, rooms clean, breakfast excellent. We would strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: AnneinTexas
Reviews.Content: Wonderful little gem of a hotel just blocks from a tram stop and several of the big museums. The owner and staff were very friendly and warm. Breakfast has gluten-free options and lots of others too. Very clean and quiet. I'll stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in a fairly quiet location but close to centre.”
Reviews.Author: snowpingu
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in a type F room. Our flight was late so I phoned to warn the hotel and was glad as I did as they helpfully told us the bus to get and this was the cheapest way to get there. The room was very clean and the bed large and comfortable. There was a coffee machine (the Dutch seem to do coffee more than tea!) , kettle and all the usual toiletries, towels etc you expect in a hotel. Also a small safe. There were plenty of TV channels including some in English. The staff were very friendly and helpful, available via telephone if there was noone around. There is free wi-fi and a computer available. The area itself is quiet for Amsterdam, being in the museum district. There was little noise at night. In the morning, there was a little traffic noise and general noise of people in the room next door. There is some sort of kindergarden next door - we heard the children on Saturday but Sunday was very quiet. It did not strike me as the kind of hotel you get hen/stag parties/large groups at. It's a place for couples and quieter small groups. Breakfast was fantastic - you must have the pancakes!! The centre of Amsterdam is in walking distance, or hop on one of the nearby trams or buses. The main station is a bit further, best reached by taxi or tram.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Hal47
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 4 nights at Hotel Fita at the end of March. It was our first visit to Amsterdam and we were made extremely welcome. The bus from the airport (4 euros) dropped us a short walk from the hotel and we checked in mid-morning. On the final day we left our cases in the hotel and picked them up mid-afternoon. The breakfasts were delicious, the room quiet and very comfortable, and the staff were most helpful. We had an excellent holiday and would certainly recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel--they took care of us and the room was great.”
Reviews.Author: Trillium3
Reviews.Content: This small, family-run hotel provides the kind of "luxury" we like. We arrived from Kenya sans baggage, dirty and jet lagged. Loes ushered us into a bright, clean room, washed our clothes, provided a converter plug since ours was in our missing luggage, and gave us directions to the bus, a near-by restaurant for rice table, and other local attractions. We wish we could have stayed for weeks and followed up on Loes' enthusiastic and encyclopedic knowledge of Amsterdam attractions. (Take the bus from Shiphol--you don't need the train.) Nothing in Amsterdam is cheap, but Hotel Fita is certainly a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Robotmaniac
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay here. The room was very clean and comfortable. Within walking distance to the museums and shopping. The hosts were very nice and accommodating. We thought the children playing at the school across the street was very cute. It fit in our budget and would definitely be our choice for a future stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: valentinatu
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is great. We stayed in a type T room for 3 nights. The room was very clean and spacious. The staff was friendly and helpful. And the breakfast! I could smell the bacon every morning. And the French crepes were so great. Also, the location was good. The museums and a tram stop were within walking distance. I would definitely stay there again when I'm in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ray_28
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the positive reviews it got on here. I stayed for 10 days in the summer of 2010. Mostly I think this is a good hotel. If you are looking to stay on a budget for a few nights and get a single room with a good rate then donâ€™t hesitate to book this place. The Good: Excellent location, in the Museum district next to Rijksmuseum and Vang Gogh Museum. Hotel street is quiet at night. The street in lined with trees and is pleasant to stroll on. The main high end shops are located nearby. So is Vondelpark which was a big plus for me personally as it is nice to go walk in the park or have drink in the afternoon. I booked a forward facing double room with balcony which was really spacious. The balcony made it extra special as in the summer it would let nice breeze flow through the room. Free internet and free international calls. Room was cleaned daily. People who worked at the hotel were real friendly and had many suggestions on what to do in Amsterdam or even outside of the city. Good breakfast with to-order pancakes that were delicious. One block away from tram stops with two lines that could take you right to city center in ten minutes. The Bad: Cleanliness was an issue for the single room that I had to take for one night. That room is located on the reception floor at the end of the hallway. I found lots of long strands of hair on the chair and bed and stains on the desk. That single room was really small and is suitable for a short stay on a budget. Another thing about cleanliness is the cleaning detergent they use which has strong acidic sell to it. I always had to close the bathroom door whenever I was in the room. The entire hotel smelled like bacon every morning as the cooking smells from the kitchen came into the rooms. This was a problem for me and it might be for others. There was not much closet space in the room. Housekeeping knocked on your door as early as 8:30 am to ask if they can clean the room. There is not â€˜Do not disturbâ€™ sign to hang outside your door. It does get noisy during the day as there is a school right in front of the hotel and the rooms donâ€™t block sound that well.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient with a wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: jackiefromboulder
Reviews.Content: We've found that what we remember as great hotels do not stand up to expectations upon a second stay. Not so with Hotel Fita. It was comfortable, clean and convenient (museums close and tram a block away) as well as staffed with wonderful people -- as we fondly remembered from our first stay. Our room was large by European standards (actually even American standards), quiet and very clean and had amenities, like wooden hangers, desk, chairs and table, and expresso machines as well as tea service. Hans and Loes are wonderfully accommodating and helpful, and their staff is attentive and friendly. Breakfast is good too!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: dreyfus9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visted The Netherlands in January 2011. We had many hotels to choose from but we were not familiar with Amsterdam. I have a terrible fear of "bed bugs" so I am always reading "Trip Advisor" to make sure the place I pick has a good "cleanliness" reputation. But, aside from the cleanliness, we did not want to stay in a hotel in an area that was unsafe or had too many young tourists who might be noisy or rowdy .... and we also did not want to pay a fortune to stay in a hotel just because it had an American name but we knew just as little about. Hotel Fita was the very best hotel we could have chosen. It was in the perfect location. It was lovely and charming. It is extremely clean (complete with a little rubber ducky sitting on the edge of our tub), the room was spacious and we had a great view. Breakfast is included in your room charge and it was delicious, every single day. Loes and Hans were welcoming and informative but we never felt that we did not have privacy. The neighborhood is quiet and yet only one block from "high end" shopping. The walk to any tourist attraction is perfectly accceptable, in fact we walked and toured on foot every day we were there. Hotel Fita is a wonderful place, I recommend it to any cautious traveler who is about to visit Amsterdam and if I ever return that is where I will book my stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and location, shame about the noise!”
Reviews.Author: LJMJ2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel this month and it was pretty good, fantastic location and lovely people. BUT it was extremely noisey!! I could here people stomping around in the room above extremely early in the morning, and there is school right outside which is very noisey. There are still no do not disturb signs and we were walked in on twice by the cleaners. On one occasion the owner even knocked on our door to ask why we were still in our room and did we not want it cleaned. It was very clean and comfortable, we just didn't getcalot of sleep

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great location, and delicious breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: PDXjackson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights that Hotel Fita in June 2010. The hotel is walking distance to the museums in a lovely area. The staff was gracious and helpful. The rooms were very clean! We enjoyed staying in the lower level with a window at the street level. Breakfast was delicious! Next time we travel through Amsterdam we will definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: calvinus
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights in Hotel Fita in December; it is, without question, the best Hotel I have stayed at in Amsterdam. I have been going to Amsterdam for the last 30 years! The hotel is easy to find, just take tram #5 or #2 from Central Station and get off at museumplein, or the stop after. Bus #197 from Schiphol stops at museumplein as well. Upon arrival at the hotel I was greeted by Hans, the owner. I was shown to my room; I used the elevator/lift as I have back problems, so the stairs would have been a problem for me. My room, a single with a balcony on the first floor was great, en-suite, nice and warm, Nespresso coffee maker, kettle if you want to have hot chocolate or tea. The bed was very comfortable, nice warm duvet, and the heating was on all night at a nice temperature. (It was December) The breakfast is, as like everyone has said on here, delicious! I opted for freshly squeezed orange juice and then scrambled eggs on toast, with bacon. A pot of coffee, as well as a pancake after. You have to taste the pancakes to believe them! The hotel Fita is very clean, and I mean VERY clean! If you find any dust or dirt, tell them at breakfast and by the time you get back from a day out, it will have gone! Something I must add is, I booked to stay there until 22nd December, Hans and his wife had arranged to go away for Xmas, they had to cancel 2 days of their trip so I could stay for 6 nights! How many hotel owners would do that? As this is an honest review, I must tell the good with the bad! There are no â€œdo not disturbâ€� signs to be put on the door, if you are out late like I was one night until 5am, housekeeping tried to get into my room. I had to get out of bed and say no! Iâ€™m sleeping! (I have emailed Hans about this and he said he will implement the do not disturb signs) My 2 friends who I persuaded to stay at the hotel also had the same problem! Thatâ€™s it, nothing bad, really! I have read reviews where they say the host, Hans is rude! He is not, he is a genuine guy! He likes to brighten up your day; some people take that the wrong way. He loves to have a laugh and a joke, my friends and I still laugh about something he said at breakfast one morning. Roel takes over from Hans when he is away; he makes better pancakes than Hans, and better scrambled eggs on toast! Thank you Roel! Sorry it is a long review, but I believe, if a hotel is good, SHOUT about it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, Great Hospitality, Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hyatt22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Fita in Mid- November 2010 for 3 nights. What a wonderful small hotel! I would even call it a B&B. We stayed in room type A, which was up one flight of stairs. The room had a small balcony, which wasnâ€™t of too much use in November, but we did hang some clothes out there to air out, which was convenient. The room was large, based on other European rooms we have stayed in, clean, and very comfortable. The bathroom was good size, although no real toiletries were provided, but that wasnâ€™t a problem we just popped into a drug store and got some shampoo/conditioner and some lotion. The shower was powerful and there was a hair dryer provided. The location was great, just behind the Van Gough Museum. We had a little trouble finding it initially, but that was our own â€“ tired head, jet lagged - fault. We did take the bus from the airport (BTW, we asked at the airport where to purchase the strippencard, and were told they were no longer used, so we just paid cash to the driver), which we found after a little bit of searching in the bus lane outside the airport. We walked everywhere, only used the tram once or twice. The Tram was really convenient, once we did decide to use it, but we like to walk and take in the general atmosphere. There is a Tram Stop just behind the hotel. We had great weather, but I suspect had there been rain we would have used the tram a lot more. Breakfast was great! We were the only ones in there two of the three mornings. We had eggs and bacon each morning, along with sweet rolls, fresh orange/strawberry juice, and of course the famous pancake. There is a school that seemed to be right next door and across the street. This didnâ€™t really cause a problem for us, as the kids were outside playing after 9 or so, when we were already up, but if you like afternoon naps, you may in for a bit of a letdown. There is no doubt that when we are back in Amsterdam, we will stay at Hotel Fita again. It was an outstanding experience. Wonderful Location, Great Hospitality, Lovely Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, hospitable and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Bep2010
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 8.45am after a 30 hour flight. Very central location; the tram from Centraal was the only public transport I took all week--everywhere I wanted to go was within 1/2 hour walk. My room was available straight away (with glass of juice and small bowl of nuts)--delightful! Stayed a week in a single room; beautifully comfortable. Loved watching the world go by (including the children on the way to school) from the lower than street level breakfast room. Thanks for a beautiful stay...

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: icaro_saggioro
Reviews.Content: Standards that met my expectations. Clean, Organized, well placed, quiet and friendly

Reviews.Title: “A very warm welcome and a really good breakfast awaits you at this comfortable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DorsetDaisy36
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Amsterdam with three friends, we stayed at the Fita for four nights. We are all artists so the location of hotel was perfect. We enjoyed every moment at the Fita, we were treated like royalty! Pancakes for breakfast as well as strawberrys, cheese, warm rolls, scrambled eggs and bacon, pastries, the coffee was perfect. Coffee maker in the rooms as well as kettle and tea! Ice machine and ice buckets provided in the rooms so the G&T in the evening was a must! Bed and bedding comfortable, nice and warm, lots of hot water for a shower or bath, we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Very recommendable”
Reviews.Author: Linnainen
Reviews.Content: Very good location in corner of most important museums and luxury shopping street. Easy to come by buss from airport and by tram from central railway station. Rooms was clean, surprising big and staff was very friendly and helpful. Fresh pancake in breakfast was great surprise. Good value for price.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience from start to finish!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Charly03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 days at the Hotel Fita and it was a wonderful experience from start to finish. We were served a complimentary drink and snacks in our clean, spacious room at arrival. The Hotel is centrally located on a quiet street and within walking distance from all the sights. The breakfasts were excellent and we loved Hans's pancakes. The staff were friendly and helpful and we plan to go back again sometime and we will definately stay at the Fita! Doug and Tracy Victoria, BC, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service, Best Breakfast, Easy to get to!”
Reviews.Author: workevaders
Reviews.Content: We recently spent one night at the Hotel Fita and then returned for two more nights. We stayed in their largest and their smallest room. The rooms were basic, but very clean. The bedding was excellent. The shower had some power and so did the hairdryer. This is not a 5 star hotel in looks but a Bed and Breakfast with an owner (Hans) and staff that are incredibly helpful. They even will do your laundry!! They stored our bags while we left Amsterdam for a few nights without any issues. There is an elevator so you are not lugging your luggage up 3 flights of stairs! We took the train from the airport to Central Station and then the tram (right out in front of the train station) almost to their door. One day we walked back to the train station with a bag and it was quite easy. It is one block from the most expensive shopping street in all of Amsterdam, the museums and Concert Hall are close by. Hans is an incredible source for restaurants, chocolate, cigars and all else. The breakfast is incredible! Free internet phone to the U.S. and free Wi Fi!!!! We give this B&B a 5!

Reviews.Title: “The ideal Hotel for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: forresjohn
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fita seems to be far away from the city centre but it is actually ideally situated on a very quiet tree lined street - 2 minutes from the Van Gogh Museum, 4 minutes from the Rijksmuseum and 3 minutes from a tram. The quite excellent "stop/go" bus service(1 euro per hour) on the Prinsengracht canal is 7 minutes walk away. Plenty of restaurants within 5-15 minutes walk. Compared with a noisy Dam Square Hotel (with noisy fun fair) it was perfect. The room was fine (number 10 ground floor), spacious and comfortable. One of the more expensive rooms (they all are in Amsterdam) and no toiletries except wall mounted ones. Nespresso coffee machine was a bonus. Staff were delightful, helpful and friendly. Breakfast was superb. We would certainly book again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family hotel near Van Gogh”
Reviews.Author: Markitoon
Reviews.Content: When the owner meets you at the door and cracks a few jokes you know you have come to the right hotel. Hans and Loes runs a warm and cosy hotel near the museum. Our room faced out to a quiet street, the bed was fine and it had a large bathroom. In the morning we had a super coffee and crepes breakfast so we could get a jump on the crowds at Van Gogh. We had a great stay if only for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: af2910
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Fita for six nights. Nice rooms, great water pressure, delicious breakfast, personable owner and staff. The location is right around the corner from the Van Gogh Museum, the Rijksmuseum, and VondelPark. It's also a 10-15 minute walk to central Amsterdam. Steep stairs to each floor, but luckily they have an elevator for you and your luggage (one person at a time with luggage). The breakfast is delicious. A new freshly squeezed juice every morning, a buffet including the best scrambled eggs ever, bacon, a variety of cheese, rolls, fresh fruit, granola, and oatmeal. The lovely staff will personally make you a fresh pot of coffee or tea. Best of all (besides the eggs) are their pancakes! Made fresh just for you. Yum! The owner, Hans, has a wonderful personality and is so friendly. Pick his brain for suggestions on where to go and places to eat! He is full of great ideas and will help you plan your routes on you city map. We actually wished we had a couple extra days so we could fit in all of his suggestions...so ask him early in your stay! We loved his sense of humor! The other staff are so friendly and helpful too! All together a wonderful and friendly stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Very Clean & Great Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: LoveWineandTravel
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Fita for 2 nights after a River Cruise thru Germany. Selected this Hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews.Hans, Rouel and other staff were very friendly and gracious to us during our short visit. Our breakfast was delicious(fresh scrambled eggs, bacon, fresh squeezed juice, fresh fruit and Han's wonderful pancake/crepe along with other assorted breakfast goodies) We were in a Deluxe Room on 2nd floor with a Queen bed with a balcony overlooking the street in front of the Hotel. Room was very clean, Nepresso machine available for our use as well as a tea kettle. There is only a small elevator for luggage and 1 person, otherwise you use the stairs to second floor which are steep to get to your room. Breakfasr Room downstairs on 1st floor. There is no front desk attendent available at all times but you can call via your room phone if you need assist. Close and convenient to museums, shopping etc. Main complaint was there were no face cloths/wash cloths in Bathroom. Only Bath and Hand towels. When I called to ask about them , I was told there were none. Much like a Bed and Breakfast type of stay, quiet and cozy with very personal and friendly service. Hope to return again, but will bring my own wash cloths :) Thanks to Hans and Staff !!!

Reviews.Title: “Almost too nice to recommend ....”
Reviews.Author: torsk
Reviews.Content: in fear of that its popularity make it difficult to find rooms for future visits. Cause future visits there will be. We found our "home" in Amsterdam. Quiet neighbourhood, great location, very friendly staff, nice room, good beds, great breakfast. What else? Free wifi, coffe and phone calls!

Reviews.Title: “accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Dene48
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Amsterdam and chose Hotel Fita based on the Trip Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed. The hotel is in a perfect location - close to the musuems, within walking distance of city centre and if we tired the tram is within one block of the hotel. The host was there to greet us, provided us with a map, pamphlets, made several suggestions as to restaurants close by, places to visit.... He has a great sense of humour!! The breakfast (included) was one of the best we've had Europe. Lots of variety including fresh fruit and juice, but best of all are the pancakes. The staff at breakfast were friendly, took the time to chat with us and again were very helpful. The hotel also has a small elevator which comes in very handy for those who are on the top floor and are tired from all the walking. Amsterdam is very much a walking city. Our room was large, lots of light , great bathroom and had a small balcony. It was very quiet @ night time which we appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “What a great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mno22077
Reviews.Content: Always a risk a small hotel - but this was superb. Only 26 guests but wonderful hosts and great staff. B & B included. Free internet - printer too! Free International telephone calls, luggage elevator, clean rooms and dining area. Handy to tram, just outside ring of canals. Too good to miss!

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant and unfriendly owner - will never stay again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: devarajcr
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 nights 10th to 15th October 2010, sagging bed, less / no heating, but the most unexpected thing on the day of check out I came after a meeting by 12.15pm just 15 min late than normal checkout time of hotel world wide, to my surprise I found my breafcase and suitcase near the lift out side my room !!! and there is a note in the room don't open it, it has given to some one.!! All other items including my camera in a bin , It is like kicking out of the room,!! The the owner came to me and told me that the checkout time was 11am and since it is already 12.15pm just 1 hour 15 min past the check out time he took every thing out , and he says that it since I have not told him about late check out by just 1 hour the throw every thing out in the corrodoor. In my 28 years of travel all over the world I never experiemced like this and in my life I will not go to hotel fita again. I never met such an unfriendly hotel owner any where in the world. I think all the positive comments on their hotel is wrote by them only or their friends and not by real people, hope trip adviser will do some chek on this. So don't stay with this hotel, not even for one night, such a bad attitude and service.

Reviews.Title: “Old. Ugly. Cold. Scarce breakfast. Arrogant owners.”
Reviews.Author: wander5r
Reviews.Content: Basically, that`s it: 1. Small rooms, worn-out furniture. The mattress was old and soft like a hammock, so I did not sleep well and got pains in my back in the morning. 2. Also, the hotel is quite noisy: during the night, you can hear people in the room upstairs and downstairs using bathroom. In front of the hotel there was a loud construction work that started before 8 a.m. Also, there is a primary school right in the next building. 3. The window is old and single-glazed, hence the room is damn cold in the night, at least while the heating is off. 4. The breakfast is quite poor. For example, as a drink they only offer juice mixed with yoghurt (and tea/coffee). 6. The maid insists on entering to clean the room when she pleases, in my case as early as 10 a.m. 7. The old lady that checked me in was quite unfriendly. I guess, she is the owner. Her husband is very arrogant as well. Youâ€™d better not try complaining to them about anything!!! I regret to have stayed at this hotel, which happened mainly because of overwhelming positive reviews. Apparently TripAdvisor has a strong North American bias, which leads to overrating many hotels in Europe â€“ especially those that perhaps look â€œexoticâ€�/ â€œgenuinely Europeanâ€� to this kind of public who end up evaluating their own rose-tinted-glasses imagination of what Europe â€œshould look likeâ€�, rather than the true quality of the accommodation offered.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel Run By Charming Couple”
Reviews.Author: Califaloha
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed with Hans & Loes in their quaint hotel. Very, very clean with top-notch service. As in many of the "family" hotels in Amsterdam and elsewhere in Europe, there are stairs at the front entrance. Hans had us wheel our luggage around to the side entrance and wisked our luggage up to our room via the elevator, so there was no heavy lifting for us. Love the breakfasts and free wi-fi as well. Hans cheerfully arranged to have a private taxi come for us when we were ready to leave for our cruise in Rotterdam. Yes, we took a taxi instead of the train to Rotterdam. A very pleasant ride with a very nice gentleman in his clean automobile that was big enough to handle all of our luggage for a 24 day cruise. It was worth the $120 Euro we had to pay. Thanks Hans & Loes for another delightful stay.

Reviews.Title: “A very special little hotel that added to the exhilaration of our trip!”
Reviews.Author: Bluemax942
Reviews.Content: This wonderful little hotel run by Hans, Lois and Roule provided us with everything we had hoped for: perfect location, attention to our every need, large beautiful room with a balcony, superb breakfasts topped off with Hans' incredible pancakes. If you are looking for a smaller, charming hotel that has your comfort in mind, I recommend Hotel Fita wholeheartedly. Harry Max

Reviews.Title: “Family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: brooklynprof
Reviews.Content: I will echo the sentiment that your feeling about the hotel will depend strongly on what you're looking for. One reviewer said it may not be the place for you if you want "bells & whistles"; indeed I would argue that you might miss some of the standard hotel features. First off, yes, this is a wonderfully personal hotel and you definitely feel at home with the owners. Hans is a wisecracking guy with a big booming voice and is a delight. HIs wife and the rest of the family/staff are also quite friendly and happy to do what they can to make you happy. They serve up quite a breakfast every day as well. I am a light eater so I didn't partake, but they will apparently cook you eggs and pancakes to order and they also give you a fresh glass of pressed orange juice. I also liked the location in the Museumplein. Close to what you want and not what you don't, if you don't. And they do your laundry for you for free, same day! Wow. At the same time, a few things took away from the experience. For me, one thing was that there isn't anyone stationed at the front desk. You have a key to the hotel to come and go as you wish, but the problem is that unlike other hotels, even small boutique ones, you have no one there to whom to say "hey, do you know x, y or z?" Like if you want quick directions to something or want to request something for your room. You can reach them by calling on the phone from your room, but it's kind of a pain to have to go back inside and make a phone call instead of having someone there. Also, my room was a little too utilitarian for my taste. I don't mind a small room at all (see my review for base2stay) but it's not as nice if the furnishings/design are not especially cozy. The bathroom too was a little institutional with wall mounted soap push dispensers and disposable packaged washcloths. My room was also too chilly for me, as it's heated by radiators like you would find in your apartment. I'm used to being able to crank the heat if I'm cold in a hotel. All in all I my stay was fine but I guess I am not as big a fan as the other reviewers since it's #3 in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, friendly, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Norbiton
Reviews.Content: Believe the good reviews, this place really does have all the qualities described. I can kind of see what some of the more luke-warm descriptions mean as there is a bit of wear and tear about the place, but only of a very minor kind. Our room (the one with a balcony) was lovely, the beds exceptionally comfortable, a huge bathtub as well as a shower which was an unexpected bonus. The breakfasts are truly wonderful, not only the rightly-praised pancakes but the selection of fruit and nuts to go with cereal and yoghurt and the best scrambled eggs I've had in any hotel. The location gives easy access to the canals as well as the museums and getting to the old centre is a reasonable stroll or a quick tram ride. The owners also very kindly pointed out that the 197 bus to the airport was only 4 euros compared with the 14 we'd been about to pay for the hotel shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita: warm hospitality and delicious breakfasts in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: annemelnyk
Reviews.Content: quiet tree-lined street traditional Amsterdam-style house turned hotel. Staff very helpful and welcoming. Four-day stay relaxing. Food & conversation great!

Reviews.Title: “Average, but definitely overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Sinjubju
Reviews.Content: Good things about the hotel: - close to museums, quiet area - free international calls (including Asia) and internet & wifi, with good connection - free laundry - generally nice (welcome drink was available for us as well) - type A room has Nespresso in it with 4 free capsules to use. Bad things about the hotel: - not really central in terms of location, need to take the tram for 20 minutes to reach the core area (i.e. Dam square, centraal station) - paid extra 30 euros for an extra bed but wasn't arranged when we arrived - free laundry was provided on the first day. The host told us to just leave our clothes in the laundry basket and leave the basket in the room. They did the laundry for the first day, but didn't do it for the 2nd time. The clothes were just left in the basket untouched. - international call to certain countries didn't work from the room's telephone. I had to ask for another telephone from the staff to do that. It took a long time. - They were kind enough to offer museum tickets at the hotel to avoid queuing for tickets at the museum. But they didn't tell us at all that they will charge extra fee for that and added the fee to the bill without mentioning it (I only discovered that long after I paid the bill) - while the hotel emphasises it is very clean and hygienic, stains on laundry basket, coffee mugs, toilets are often discovered. Overall, the room is alright. However, charging 200 euros for 3 people per night is way above what it is worth. I would be much better off living in a professional hotel (e.g. Marriott which charges around the same price for 2 double bed per night!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff. Clean rooms. Great amenities. I'd stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: outdoorz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a friend for 4 nights in September 2010. Picked it based on reviews on Trip Advisor. Room 12, right next to front desk, which was okay because the front desk isnâ€™t manned 24/7 so it wasnâ€™t a noise issue. However, there is a kindergarten right next door to this hotel and their playground was right underneath our window. So, if you want to sleep past 745am, you may want a different room or definitely bring earplugs. Also, there was a streetlight right outside our window which shined brightly all night, so sleeping blinders were needed. In spite of that, we loved this hotel. Room was large by European standards and very clean. Bathroom was perfect and also very clean. The breakfast was fantastic! Eggs, bacon, fruit, pastries, yogurt with lots of toppings, and of course the hot pancakes are incredible!! The staff at this hotel was amazing and the owner Hans is absolutely hysterical. Consider yourself lucky if you are able to have a fun conversation with him. Free wifi, free calls to the USA, free laundryâ€¦what more could you ask for?! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but hotel needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: trevian8
Reviews.Content: I chose the Hotel Fita after spending lots of time on the internet, but I was disappointed in the quality of the rooms and value. For almost $200 a night, I thought the furniture shouldn't have been so worn and the closet space so tiny. Granted, the bathroom was large, but the towels were thin and weren't replaced on our 2 night stay. Breakfast was included, and it was okay, but nothing to rave about. The best thing about the hotel is its location which is very close to the Rijksmuseum, Concertgebouw, and several restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita is the place you want to be”
Reviews.Author: Randy_Hauer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in AMS many times over the last 20 years on a mix of biz + pleasure and this is the most pleasant experience in all that time. I was greeted by Hans the proprieter who could not have been more charming or helpful. It had been 3 years since I was in AMS and he pointed a new "hip" neighborhood that had EXCELLENT restaurants (Simpel, + Julia being his top recomendations and he was SPOT on). The room was more than I expected (so read "not over sold on their web site"), very comfortable, squeaky clean and quiet (this is the beautiful Jan Lken Straat). The only mystery is why Fita is #5 on the top hotel list on TA...it deserves to be taken higher, may it never change. / Randy the Cdn

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice staff ! Room can be better !”
Reviews.Author: Carenlosi
Reviews.Content: After reading all the top reviews about Hotel Fita, we decided to give this hotel a short stay (only 2 nights). And i have to say we quite like this place. Although there are things need to change if they want to improve competition. - The reception's check-in process is super quick - Breakfast included are nice. Please try their homemade pancake, best i ever had before. - The hotel is located in the famous Museum District. You can walk to any musemum from here. So very convenient ! However things are not so great : - Everything about the room or bathroom are seems to be old or in plastic. Even they have tried very hard to keep the best service (they do have good service). For example, old dried up soap in the shower's soap dish or plastic cup in bathroom or no trashcan in the bathroom. I can not deny the fact that the staff are very nice persons. But if you look for some good facilities to make the best comfortable then the owner might need to improve thost things in the room. Other than that, i think we still think this is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, great location, very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: aztennis
Reviews.Content: Take a trip to Amsterdamn and stay at this hotel, you won't be sorry. Incredible location. Best part of town in our opinion. You're steps from the museums and parks. The family runs a clean, very hospitable operation. They make you feel very welcomed in their comfy well appointed rooms. We'll stay there again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: KeithChicago
Reviews.Content: We picked the hotel in large part due to the reviews on this site and were not disappointed. The staff, from the owners down to the maids, was friendly and helpful. The location, in the Museum District, is excellent. Just a short walk from the Leidseplein, and all the bars and restaurants there. The tram stops a block away and, as the name would suggest, the Van Gough Museum, the Stedelijk Museum and the Rijkmuseum are all nearby. The room, as well as the rest of the facilities, was clean and obviously well cared for. The breakfast in the morning was very good. I highly recommend the pancakes. When we return to this lovely city, and we will return, this is the place we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place located in a fantastic city as we loved every minute of the stay.”
Reviews.Author: marcspiewak
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right across the street from the Van Gogh Museum and down the street from the Richtmuseum. The tram and the buses have stops right there. It is a short walk (on the other side of the Richtmuseum) from Leidsplein (a major square). If you want restaurants, museums, coffeeshops, etc. this is a great location. If you get too inebriated to figure your way around afterwards, just remember that you want to be across from the Van Gogh Museum. The hotel is very nice and intimate. I believe there are only 15 rooms. Very clean place, the proprietor is great, the breakfast (included) is great. We had eight unbelievable days and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant and Disrespectful Host and Hostess”
Reviews.Author: SheRa001
Reviews.Content: The initial look and feel of the hotel was mediocre, but still acceptable, however what tipped the scale was the host and hostess. The arrogance and rudeness of the couple was completely unbecoming of a host and hostess of such an establishment. My friends and I were appalled at the manner in which we were spoken to and treated when we had an emergency situation one night and required some basic tools from the owner. They were downright rude and disrespectful to us and didn't care to even understand the magnitude or urgency of the problem. This attitude miraculously transformed the next day at breakfast when the couple was chipper and merry and didn't even offer an apology or acknowledge the situation. On a second note, breakfast was really poor and not worth the rate. You're much better off grabbing something at an outside cafe. All in all this place leaves a bad aftertaste and has the potential to ruin your stay, even in a beautiful city like Amsterdam. So if you're looking for bi-polar drama and comedy within the twilight zone, knock yourself out BUT if youâ€™re a foreigner, looking for any helpful hints, friendly faces or absolutely any degree of hospitality, do yourself a favour and give this place a miss!

Reviews.Title: “Weird unhelpful hosts”
Reviews.Author: QueenVuyo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not bad, but could definitely use a facelift. The rooms are incredibly tiny and stuffy. With no windows, a noisy fan and thin walls, it was difficult to get a restful sleep. The reception from the hostess was ice cold, to put it mildly. The temperature dropped even further when we needed help, with the host turning from charming Dr Jerkyll to ugly Mr Hyde, shouting at us like he was posessed by demons from drinking too much Amsterdam special coffee, reminding us that his is not a 5 star establishment, a fact we could not have missed from the cheap plastic spoons and hardened coffee in the rooms to the artificial, sandy tasting juice at breakfast! I would never recommend this hotel to anyone, ever!

Reviews.Title: “What a gem in a beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: jminyard
Reviews.Content: We began our 35th wedding anniversary trip in Amsterdam. We got off to a great start with the Hotel Fita. Outstanding small hotel in a very quiet side street but only 1/2 block to the tram and the Van Gogh museum. The hotel is spotless and our room was very comfortable. The hotel staff all go out their way to make you feel welcome, we arrived after an all night flight and were allowed to check in that morning.
