The complimentary breakfast each morning is presided over by Hans who will not let you sit there without interacting with him - what a pleasant stay in a great hotel in a wonderful city. Would not hesitate to recommend the Fita to anyone. It is an outstanding value!

Reviews.Title: “Feel at home with a nice dutch family”
Reviews.Author: GTHammer
Reviews.Content: Great service (especially free wash and fold) Large spotless room - loved the coffee table and armchairs set in the bay window. Perfect location for Van Gogh and Rijks museums - tickets provided so you can avoid the long lines. Great breakfast where you will actually chat with Hans the owner and gain local knowledge. Double bed was 2 singles pushed together.

Reviews.Title: “Large clean room with great bathroom. Convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: jackiefromboulder
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised when we were shown our room. For the price, it's one of the nicest rooms -- large with great amenities, good breakfast, and quiet -- that we've had in any European city and is located in a convenient locale, too The staff was very helpful and pleasant. A great find in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful owners make this quiet, clean hotel a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: AllyVancouver
Reviews.Content: Our room and bathroom were very clean, and the beds (we had twins) were comfortable. We liked the fact that this is a nonsmoking hotel. We especially liked the friendly help we got from the owners and their daughter. They got us advance tickets to the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum so that we didn't have to wait in a long queue (we were just a block away from the Van Gogh Museum and two or three blocks from the Rijkssmuseum). They showed us how to get places, and they even did laundry for free. (They provided an iron so that we could iron our clothes.) The breakfasts were excellent, especially the pancakes, which are like crepes.

Reviews.Title: “Stay there and you wont regret it”
Reviews.Author: exotic_10
Reviews.Content: After reading all the wonderful reviews about Hotel Fita, we decided to stay there. And we absolutely loved it. The hotel is located in the famous Museum District with both Van Gogh and the Rij museums nearby, only a short walk. The trams are only a block away and take you to any destination. The breakfast was wonderful. We especially loved the home made pancakes. Computer use is free. The staff is very warm and welcoming. The owner has a great sense of humor. Overall stay in this hotel and you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “UPDATED....in the 70's”
Reviews.Author: Lauralikesthebeach
Reviews.Content: While the reception, breakfast and free computer use was wonderful, I'm afraid we can't say the same about the room. They seem to pride themselves on the fact that they are updated and clean but I think they need to take a hard look at themselves. The bathroom had public restroom type soap dispensers and this bizarre huge contraption to get a plastic cup. There was old dried up soap in the shower's soap dish. There were little bugs on the bathroom floor and really, would it be too much to get a trashcan in the bathroom? A good place to start would be to vacuum the steps entering the hotel...first impressions. Totally underwhelmed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, really helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: VivGeddes
Reviews.Content: The owners and staff were charming and couldn't have been more helpful. On arrival we were told among other useful information that the hotel held a stock of tickets to both the Van Goch and Rijksmuseum (both round the corner) so that their guests could avoid queuing .... and didn't we feel smug when we sauntered straight past at least an hours' queue for each at 10.30 am! Our room was clean and modern, complete with Nespresso machine (but sadly no George Clooney). I would have liked some way of having a night-cap in the room, perhaps a mini-bar.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want and more!”
Reviews.Author: artanddoc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Fita for four nights in early August. We based our choice on reviews from Trip Advisor members. What a find! Pauline and her sidekick (father) Hans were the most accommodating hoteliers we have ever run across. We arrived at 8:30 a.m., earlier than we anticipated. Our room was ready in 10 minutes, Hans put out a dozen red roses, champagne and snacks for our honeymoon welcome! What a way to start our vacation! The room and bath were very large, comfortable bed and all the amenities you could wish for. Nespresso machine, teapot, iron and board, free wi-fi and use of computers, free LD calls to U.S., tickets available to the Van Gogh and Rijks museums, all questions answered with patience and smiles. They even did our laundry! Last, but not least was the breakfast. Eggs, bacon, fresh fruit, granola, yogurt, fresh squeezed juice, croissants and pastries, delicious cheeses with breads and those fabulous Dutch pancakes. We truly didn't need to eat again until dinner! Hans is a hoot and Pauline is patient and kind. We will return to Amsterdam and would not think to stay any where else.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while visiting such a great City”
Reviews.Author: MarkkOBrown
Reviews.Content: Based largely upon Tripadvisor comments from others we chose the Hotel Fita during recent trip to Amesterdam. We were not disappointed. Great location, wonderful staff (they even did a load of laundry for us). Very helpful. Owner joined us for breakfast one morning and he's wonderfully helpful - plotted out day trip for us. However, he told us he had plans to sell hotel so let's hope new owners maintain same level of service and attention. Get the A room with balconey - lots of fresh air. If you wonder whether Amsterdam is worth the trip by all means GO. It far exceeeded our expectations - amazing City. More canals than Venice and everyone was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like family at Hotel Fita”
Reviews.Author: GardeniaGirl_51
Reviews.Content: My first nights in Europe were spent in Hotel Fita. I bused over from the airport and it was easy to find the hotel and a short walk. I don't think there could have been a better location to stay to be close to Van Gogh Museum (1 block) and Rijksmuseum (about 2 blocks), a supermarket and canal buses and tour buses within short walking distance. This is sort of a boutique area with a long street of high-end shopping also only a block away. Although close to everything, it was a quiet area and a quiet hotel. I was graciously welcomed and made to feel at home very quickly. My room was small, but had high ceilings and large doors to the outside, so it felt larger. There was a Nespresso machine in the room which was great, and an overhead fan over the bed was a treat during the recent heatwave. Very clean, comfortable and efficient room and bathroom. I was traveling solo, and felt very safe and secure with a card key needed for entry into the main hotel and my room behind 2 other locked doors. Internet access was easy and had an appointed, quiet area (never waited). The best part was meeting Hans, the owner, who made fabulous scrambled eggs each morning to accompany the rest of a nice breakfast buffet. He even greeted me with a song! He and his wife and team really care about their guests. It was a great hotel for women traveling solo. The size of the my room was more than outweighed by every other aspect of my visit. I would highly recommend this hotel for your Amsterdam experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: arpCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Great location and wonderful breakfast but it's the Fita team (particularly Hans and Loes) that make Hotel Fita such a wonderful place. We felt like we were staying in their home - they are all most welcoming and very helpful. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Amsterdam. Thanks Hans and Loes!

Reviews.Title: “We stayed in Hotel Fita from 5-9 July. We...”
Reviews.Author: SylviaCM
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Fita from 5-9 July. We had a fabulous time! It was my first time back in Holland in many years. I came back with my family to show them my birthplace and introduce them to extended family. Staying at Hotel Fita was like staying with family, like in the days when I stayed with Oom's and Tante's. The breakfast was tasty, I enjoyed the pannenkoeken!!! We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to other people! Thanks, Hans & Loes. Sylvia, Marcos & Paolo

Reviews.Title: “a cheerful, comfortable and thoroughly agreeable stay”
Reviews.Author: CholseyMassive
Reviews.Content: Great location, comfortable surroundings, good breakfasts and the timing of a stand up comedian from our host. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Our hostess made our stay wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bmalcolm1
Reviews.Content: We felt very well taken care of. We received an extensive restaurant and museum briefing upon check-in. Our laundry was immediately taken care of. This hotel made us want to return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: LL517
Reviews.Content: Great location, near the museums and tram. Had a wonderful breakfast. The owners and staff were friendly and helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home...”
Reviews.Author: gaa48
Reviews.Content: Great little, intimate hotel in the museum district but close enough to all the action. We would recommend this hotel and hope to stay there again. Free laundry and long distance international phone calls! Thank you to Hans, Loes and the Fita team.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita is worth going back to.”
Reviews.Author: Hobbes2007
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 7 Canadian adults occupying 4 rooms. Hotel is on the corner of a quiet neighborhood in Museum Quarter. Five-minute walk to Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh museum, and tram line. Next block has row of high-end boutiques. Hans and Loes de Rapper are hands-on owners/managers (31 years in business). Hotel is cozy and very clean and well-maintained. Breakfast buffet is included, and uncharacteristically generous --- fruits, cereal, milk/juices, cheeses, bread, jams, scrambled eggs, bacon/sausages, plus Hans' delightful, folded pancakes freshly cooked when you want it. Our large bedroom faced the street --- small grade school across (kids may be noisy during break time, but who stays in the hotel during the day?). Ceiling fan, safe, LCD TV with cable, generous closet space, comfortable queen bed, Nespresso machine. Bathroom is exceptionally clean and spacious; not luxurious but well-appointed. Hair dryer, soap dispenser, toilet tissue dispenser all conveniently attached to walls. Room efficiently cleaned by Fita team daily. Small 3-person elevator. Ice machine and computer/printer in basement outside the breakfast room. Free WiFi. For the short summer period, it would be great if the rooms had A/C, especially if you want to sleep in with windows closed. Otherwise, it's comfortably cool in the evenings. Main door entry is by card key, and room access is by traditional key. Front desk is not manned, but staff immediately available by hotel phone.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: VeniceAngelChris
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for four nights and loved the hotel and the people there. The ceiling fan in my room kept me cool and was very welcome during a really hot spell of weather. Hans makes fab pancakes at breakfast and was very funny. Loes and Saskia really made me feel welcome and gave me lots of information about the city. I had told them that one of my cats was sick and they were kind enough to enquire after her every day because they know how worried I was. Their kindness added to the enjoyment of my stay. The location simply couldn't be better if you want to hit the museums but there are lots of trams around to get to other parts of the city quickly. The Albert Heijn supermarket is a couple of minutes walk away and is open from 8am till 10pm every day - very useful for refreshments especially the bakery section. If you're staying in this part of town take the Number 197 red bus from the front of Schiphol airport and it will drop you off within a hundred yards or so of the hotel. I will definitely return to the hotel when I go back to Amsterdam. A warm welcome and a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hosts - great breakfasts.”
Reviews.Author: floralsydney
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is a pretty building located on a corner a stones throw from a busy road and a short walk to the Reijks Museum and Vondel Park. We were welcomed warmly by Loes the owner and shown to our room located on the reception level which is about 6 steps up from the street. Our room 14, category C was fine, lovely high windows, light and bright and simply furnished with 2 single beds (as requested),side tables and reading lamps for each bed, 2 armchairs and coffee table and a small wardrobe with a safe. A flatscreen TV was set up on the wall facing the bed. This room had plenty of space to store our rather large luggage which is not always the case. To our surprise, the bathroom was very spacious with a large vanity which allowed plenty of room to store toiletries etc, a toilet, shower over the bath and a hairdryer. A dispenser in the bath held soap/shampoo. No hair conditioner was provided. The towels and bathmat provided were on the small side and a little thin, but everything was spotlessly clean which we had read about in other Trip Advisor comments. Our hosts provided a free laundry service which they took care of, but no ironing facilities were provided. One nice touch was the Nespresso coffee machine and 4 complimentary coffee sachets. We don't know if that was our allocation for the 4 days we were there, but no more were provided. Breakfasts were very good. Each day, tiny sausages or bacon, scrambled eggs, cheese, fresh rolls, danish pastries and croissants, fresh fruit, fruit salad and cereals were available, plus tea and coffee and fresh juice. Hans (Loes' very genial other half) took orders for little sweet crepes which were to die for. We ate well and most days didn't need lunch. One aspect of the hotel worried us though. The location was across from a school and another school was beside us. The children used the streets as their playground and were there up till 6 pm. Probably after school care for working parents. We must say though, that the windows were double glazed and were quite effective and the location was very quiet at night, so it really wasn't an issue as we were out and about each day. Curtains in that particular room were not block-out so a lot of light came in. All and all, we would recommend the hotel for its location, very helpful hosts and the breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Clean Fun”
Reviews.Author: PacificDove
Reviews.Content: Those three words best describe our three night stay at the small, family owned and run, Hotel Fita in Amsterdam. Owners Hans and Loes de Rapper, are really wonderful people and they make the stay a very special experience. From the moment we checked in, Hans was joking with us and we knew that we were going to enjoy our stay. He helped us to our corner "Double type T" room and within minutes brought us a welcome snack with two glasses of bubbly. Our room was just as shown on their website. It was fairly plain, but very adequate and extremely clean (as was the whole hotel). Typical of many European Hotels, the "double" bed was made up of two twins pushed together. Even so, it was very comfortable. The bathroom was modern and even featured a rubber ducky for the bathtub (another sign of their good nature). The buffet breakfast is also wonderful. Hans has perfected the humble scrambled egg by adding just enough cream and butter. Add crisp bacon or sausage, an assortment of cheese, pastries, cereal, fresh fruit, coffee and tea, and it's all you could want or ask for. We were running a little late one morning and Hans cheerfully cooked up a plate of his special eggs and bacon just for me. Also, they offer tasty pancakes (more like crepes) to order. The hotel's location in the Museum District is superb, just two short blocks from the Van Gogh Museum. Loes even has museum tickets on hand to save you from standing in line. Excellent restaurants and canal cruise hubs are nearby as is the tram stop. City Center is just five or six stops away. If you are looking for a small, clean, fun Amsterdam hotel in a tree-lined residential setting and perfect location in the Museum District, it would be hard to beat Hotel Fita.

Reviews.Title: “Hope to stay again”
Reviews.Author: pdubdub
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent location for a quick tour of Amsterdam. Very close to the museum district and city tram system. Hosts Hans and Loes were very helpful and hard working. Breakfast was delicious. Coffee was a bit week for us as we like very strong coffee. Service was very good. Rooms comfortable. Weekdays could be a bit noisy during the daytime in some rooms as there is a kindergarten school next door. We will stay there again when next in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: EdisonSpina
Reviews.Content: Great personnel, kindness, location and price. Cleanness and helpful staff. Very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best for the price”
Reviews.Author: MAJPJC
Reviews.Content: In May, 2010, we began a 14 day trip of the Netherlands with a 4 night stay at Hotel Fita...We arrived after an overnight trip from Canada and were delighted with the welcome and the location. For a 3 star hotel, we found the accomodation excellent and above what we might have expected. The owners were congenial, efficient and attentive to any requests that we had. When we returned to Amsterdam after an excursion to Belgium, we stayed at a '4star hotel' a few blocks from Hotel Fita, and were very sorry that we had not returned to Hotel Fita. the value was incomparable

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, location problems, owners need customer relations training”
Reviews.Author: KRS1946
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Fita based on Trip Advisor research, and the accommodations were quite satisfactory (NB: typically European small room by USA standards). The location was between a daycare center and an elementary school--not conducive to daytime recovery from travel fatigue! We found the owners less than congenial to the point that we wondered what had brought them into the hotel business! This is why: 1) Mrs. was tartly critical of the fact that we had gone to sleep as soon as we arrived since "you should feel very rested after just coming from a long cruise!" 2) Mrs. was sarcastic and accusatory about finding that I was helping myself to two rolls and packets of honey that were lying on the table in the unattended breakfast room after service had ended the morning after our arrival. 3) Mr. grudgingly, but without other irritability to do him justice, helped me find a location we wanted to visit, complaining that his wife ought to have done so the day before. 4) Mr. very irritably provided my friend who had just arrived at 10PM at night from 4 weeks in Turkey, with our restaurant location that I had given him for her benefit, and refused her request to make the local phone call to alert us so we could come to help her find the place . He had the temerity to tell her she was sloppy and disorganized for not having use of a cell phone to contact us herself. I provide this excess of details to give a valid and reliable account of their weaknesses as innkeepers. They were not accommodating for these small personal needs, and they expressed themselves in an unnecessarily rude and critical manner. We will not patronize them again, despite the nice room, good breakfast and pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: drJap
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of museums and shops and eating places, yet you can get a quiet, good night's sleep. I'm definitely choosing this hotel next time I'm in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good food, good friends”
Reviews.Author: riddett
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fita is a lovely very quiet hotel in the Museum District with easy access to all tourist attractions and restaurants. The hosts are very helpful and friendly. The breakfast is excellent and the rooms are very clean. My one caveat: if you are a solo traveller planning to spend a few days you might find the single room too small. Go for the next size up and you will be very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Have fun, eat well and stay centrally at Hotel Fita.”
Reviews.Author: kathyleeoceanside
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for six nights at Hotel Fita, and had a very enjoyable and personal stay. Hans de Rapper will keep you laughting with his dry humor and Loes de Rapper will provide you gentle service. The breakfasts were grand, and the room very spacious, well stocked and clean. We were able to walk to many museums, restaurants and other attractions due to the hotel's central location. Lee & Kathy Albertoni San Diego, California

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: Ziba1945
Reviews.Content: What attracted us to Hotel Fita was the price in relation to the promised services, value and location. We were not disappointed at all. The hotel, while compact and minimalist, was exactly what we wanted: a restful place in the museum district that was not exorbitantly expensive. The room was comfortable, clean and quiet. The breakfast, included in the cost, was more than enough to get us fueled up for an exhausting day of museum gazing, walking and shopping. And, of course, the delightful character of the owners, Hans and Loes, made the stay even more memorable. Just be aware that Hans has a devilish sense of humor and doesn't suffer fools gladly. He's a dear person who is very helpful; just don't be intimidated by his sometimes gruff manner. They both made every effort to help us have a perfect vacation. We wish they hadn't been so busy running the hotel so we could have gotten to know them better. The only improvement in the hotel would be to have a good, small writing desk in the rooms -- a small criticism for an otherwise delightful hotel. Back in North Carolina, where the temperature's in the 90s, we really miss our little jewel in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: BMacTravelerNY
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita has a good location in southwest amsterdam with easy access to museums and the tram lines. Friendly staff, clean, and overall very nice.

Reviews.Title: “The most friendly and kind hospitality I`ve ever enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: Jono777
Reviews.Content: My stay was just one night and day after a hectic business trip. Hans and Loes not only got me to my room quickly but made me feel at home in a hospitable, yet non-intrusive way. The room as spacious, convenient and clean - everything you`d need right at hand. They went out of their way to find solutions to the few issues that popped up - I needed to find some obscure toy for my son, which they sourced. I returned late after drinks with some friends. I needed museum tickets. All handled in a friendly, yet fast and efficient manner. Last but not least, Hans makes a mean pancake for breakfast in between a few cracks from his dry sense of humour. The home you wish you had.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveler655
Reviews.Content: This is a well-kept, very clean small hotel in a charming neighborhood. It's literally one block from the Van Gogh Museum, and another block or two to the Rijksmuseum. The hosts are very helpful - they arranged my very early morning shuttle to the airport - and are interesting to talk to. The breakfast is included - the quality and variety were great - and there is free use of the computer downstairs. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in strategically located part of Amsterdam for museum lovers.”
Reviews.Author: travelrider
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is ideally suited for people who love the great museums of Amsterdam. And it has very good connections to the Central Station - both by bus and tram. It has all the hallmarks of a good boutique hotel. The couple who run the place have even taken care to provide for museum tickets to guests to beat the long lines. Although the single room I stayed in was small, yet it was by no means uncomfortable - sufficient for a solo traveller. Just as the other reviewers have stated, the breakfast was wholesome and delicious. I also liked the gesture of a welcome drink and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Good, as expected from TA reviews”
Reviews.Author: WalkersWA
Reviews.Content: Initially thought that it might be too far out, but was close to musuems, plenty of eateries nearby and close to canal cruises, so was a good location. Hotel was as per other TA reviews - very friendly and helpful hosts. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Small Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Fairfax_Travelers
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Fita based on previous Trip Advisor comments and Rick Steve's recomendations. We were very pleased with the hotel and the attentiveness of the owners. We arrived early and the owners made every effort to get us in our room as soon as possible. We arrived on "Queens's Day 30 April and departed on 2 May. The rooms were immaculate and comfortable. The included breakfast was outstanding. The hotel is located very near the Van Gogh and Rembrandt museums and the owners can sell you tickets so you don't have to wait in line. The Anne Frank House is a must and timed tickets should be ordered online. That way you can bypass the line waiting to get in. Amsterdam has a lot to offer and the Hotel Fita owners are very accomodatring in providing advice and directions. The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood and you can walk to about anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Service - The Hotel for Your Trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Natcap
Reviews.Content: First choice of a small hotel for a stay in Amsterdam. Ideally located for museums, concerts and shopping. Reasonable rates including a very good breakfast with healthy choices. Senior discounts offered. Extremely clean and well kept. Free laundry service as advertised - clothes clean and folded in your room by the end of the day. Fita is a family run hotel where old world service to guests is exhibited every step of the way. You are made to feel very welcome and are provided with all sorts of money and time saving tips to enhance your visit to the city. We acted on various suggestions made by our hosts as to lesser known museums, local restaurants and classical music concerts and were well pleased in all cases. Excellent value. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Look No Further! Hotel Fita is Where You Should Stay in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: tracykarin
Reviews.Content: I must say, I have stayed at many 4-Star hotels and they do not even come close to what Hotel Fita offers! A friendly atmosphere, very clean rooms, internet access included at no additional cost and the best breakfast that I have ever had at a hotel! Hotel Fita is within 4-minute walk to the Van Gogh and the Rijksmuseum. The room we had was very spacious with an iron, Nespresso coffe maker, a flat screen TV and a safe. My phone calls to British Airways because my flight was cancelled due to the cabin crew strike was free of charge. Thanks Hans and Loes for providing us with a very comfortable and pleasurable stay! Tracy and Ralph!

Reviews.Title: “Five star experience in a three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Twoprofs
Reviews.Content: We think that previous reviewers have over-rated the hotel because of the excellent service provided by the owners and their staff. The hotel is OK, but it's nothing special. Our room was a bit shabby, in need of painting. Linens were only OK, with a lumpy pillow and thin towels. The carpet was loose and stained in places, and the floor creaked mercilessly along one area. While these areas were admittedly minor, they were too numerous to give the hotel a five star rating. The breakfast was excellent. The staff was incredibly accommodating and helpful. The location was superb for visiting museums and walking into the historical areas. We would not hesitate to recommend the Fita because of its many assets, but a five start hotel it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service”
Reviews.Author: nangunia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Fita from the 6th to the 9th April this year. The staff were very friendly, breakfast was great, room and bathroom were clean. The free laundry service and internet service was a big bonus. The only thing after reading the reviews about the owners we were sad to find out upon arrival they were away visiting their daughter. Oh well maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnotherHiker
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the morning after a long airplane flight, and were given the choice of two rooms, one which was clean and ready, the other just vacated. The other room had a small balcony that overlooked a playground and we thought it was worth the wait. We changed clothes and (at the owner's suggestion) we took a canal ride from a boat about a block from the hotel. Then back for a much-needed nap. The Van Gogh museum is around the block and the hotel will sell you tickets, avoiding a long line. The owners and staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms immaculate, and the location exactly what we wanted for Amsterdam. It was easy to get there using the trolley, next to parks, canals and museums. Even though it was in the middle of a large city, the immediate neighborhood felt residential - during the day we could hear the happy sounds of children playing and at night it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL TICKS ALL THE BOXES”
Reviews.Author: woofHampshire
Reviews.Content: Lovely warm welcome from Hans on arrival at 21.30 with welcome drink. This hotel is in a convenient location just 10 mins walk to the Museums in a quiet side street. Breakfast was excellent with good choice and delicious pancakes. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and this is the hotel we would come back to again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding and Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: OntarioSunsetter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an enjoyable three days at Hotel Fita in late April. Everyone associated with the hotel were friendly and very helpful. Loes and Hans were excellent hosts and provided many helpful tips for sightseeing. All of the positives in previous reviews were met. The best recommendation would be "We will stay again at Hotel Fita when we return to Holland". Vele bedanken, Loes & Hans

Reviews.Title: “All the Comforts of Home . . .”
Reviews.Author: harleygirrrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Fita for one evening this past week. The plan was to stay longer, but a family emergency called me home. Hans, Loes, and the Fita team were exceptional in a difficult time. My main contact was with Loes (pronounced 'luce'), who was so kind and understanding. She reassured me that they would do everything they could to help me, and to make my brief stay a good one . . . and, I'm pleased to report, it was. I chose this hotel because of the great reviews I read here on Trip Advisor. The place is really clean and well-kept, and right near Museumplein. My single room was small, but very comfortable (the weather was cold and rainy when I arrived . . . the hospitality and the room were warm). There is a phone in the room with free calling to anywhere, which in my case was a godsend. The computer with internet connection, which is downstairs by the breakfast room, was very convenient and modern. But the best thing beyond everything I've mentioned so far was the pancake and fruit smoothie served in addition to the fabulous breakfast. Both were so incredibly tasty, most especially the pancake (really, almost as thin as a crepe). Perhaps it was a special recipe that made each of them so good, but it very well could have been that they were served by wonderful, caring individuals. You won't go wrong by staying at Hotel Fita. When I go back to Amsterdam, I will definitely stay there again, hopefully for a longer stay this time . . .

Reviews.Title: “Pristine, Quiet and Comfortable Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: puckshoot
Reviews.Content: A friend and I planned a three-night stay at Hotel Fita, which turned into eight nights due to the volcano in Iceland. If you have to be stranded anywhere, this is the place to be. First, the hotel is immaculate, and the beds are super comfortable. Hans, Loes and their team are very professional, handling any request with ease--from directions and a map to help you navigate the city, to restaurant recommendations and taxi reservations to the airport. The hotel is located in a quiet residential neighborhood, a block away from many upscale shops, and a few minutes' walk to the VanGogh and Rijks museums. Just up the street, there's a tram station that delivers you to many locations throughout the city. Amsterdam is a great city to explore by walking. What we liked most about the hotel's location: we were less than a 10 minute walk to the beginning of the city's canal rings, yet returned each evening to the quiet, comfortable accommodations of our hotel, away from the tourist hustle and bustle. Breakfast was served in a lovely room and provided a great start to the day. You'll enjoy fresh coffee, fruit, cheeses, eggs, sausage, yogurt and the most delicious pancakes, while chatting with other hotel guests and swapping restaurant and sightseeing suggestions. For a fun, entertaining evening out, dine at Pasta E Basta. The food is delicious, and you'll be treated to servers who, as students at a local music school, take the microphone and perform songs in between serving the patrons. You get a great meal and great entertainment all in one place! We recommend taking a canal cruise, too, as you'll see parts of the city that you wouldn't necessarily see by foot. A note of caution: watch out for the people on bikes. The city is filled with bike pathes, and some of the bikers can be pretty aggressive.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming...fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: droberts67
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were recent guests at Hotel Fita ( originally booked for 4 days but then were extended another week due to ash..)and we felt compelled to post a review - our stay was wonderful...the rooms were roomy and immaculately clean, the beds comfortable and the bathrooms were large enough to accomodate two. The wonderful area around the hotel is filled with museums, amazing shops and the Vondelpark - rent a bicycle and do a few laps.. perfectly lovely way to spend the afternoon , and quite calming to people watch when you have had a stressful day filled with flight cancellations. Honestly , we cannot say enough about our stay here. Hans was wonderfully kind to us during our extended stay and found room for us to stay extra days. We had travelled to London and Paris as well on this trip but Hotel Fita made Amsterdam our favorite place - we will definitely return and have spread the word about this fabulous gem in the Museum district.

Reviews.Title: “great people great place”
Reviews.Author: robfromoz
Reviews.Content: my stay at the hotel fita was great, very freindly people with great sense of humor made me feel at home for a quiet stay in amsterdam i recomend it highly close to everything museums transport ex

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Kind”
Reviews.Author: BearTavern
Reviews.Content: We recently booked four nights at the Hotel Fita that unexpectedly resulted in becoming ten nights due to the explosion of volcano Eyjafjallajokull on Thursday April 14th two days before our departure. Hans and Loes, along with the entire staff of the Hotel Fita treated us and the other "stranded" guests kindly. Everyone was able to extend their stay. The free Internet and Wi-Fi, along with the free telephone (local and long distance) helped keep everyone connected. The hotel is in an excellent location for the museums, trams and restaurants. The rooms are clean, comfortable and well maintained. We had room number six the least expensive and it was perfectly adequate--comfortable bed, good size bathroom (great water pressure), TV and a couple of chairs. The room has a wardrobe cabinet. My wife and I have been traveling to Europe for fifteen years, we pack light and are prepared to wash clothes out in the sink and hang them to dry. So, having the free laundry was really nice. We placed our clothes in the laundry basket gave them to Hans, and when we stopped back after lunch the clothes were in the room. The breakfast was very enjoyable. We ate in a comfortable room, were served coffee or tea, fresh squeezed juice and pancakes every morning. The buffet included eggs, meat, cheese, fresh fruit, breads, Hans' homemade jam, granola, yogurt and cereal. During breakfast Hans was always available to answer questions, give advice or just chat. It was also an opportunity to talk with the other guest and share suggestions about things to do or restaurants to go to. It is a family run business whose owners make their guests feel like family. If your only reason for travel is to check things off your list then maybe it doesn't matter where you stay. But, if you travel in order to meet new people and experience other cultures, then where you stay is part of your visit. The people at the Hotel Fita made our stay in Amsterdam a visit. They are wonderful hosts who sincerely care about their guests. Note about Eyjafjallajokull: The time during the eruption of Eyjafjallajokull was stressful. Planes were grounded across Europe and no one knew when the eruption was going to end and when we could get back home. In spite of the inconvenience and anxiety that accompanied this event, two blessings came out of it. First, though over a million people were affected no one was hurt. Second, we had the good fortune to spend those days at the Hotel Fita with Hans and Loes, the hotel staff and the other guests whom we met. I'm thankful everyone returned home safe and maybe in five years we'll have a reunion.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location near beautiful Vondel Park and Museums”
Reviews.Author: Mom-and-daughter88
Reviews.Content: My husband traveled to Amsterdam on business, and I accompanied him. Because of the vocano erruption and the closing of the airport (Schippol) we had an extended "vacation" in lovely Amsterdam. The hotel was very nice, comfortable and in a wonderful location. We walked all over the city, and rented bikes on three separate occasions. We were very well treated and respected by the friendly staff, and would stay there again. (price was 159 Euros per night, queen bed and private bath.)

Reviews.Title: “Great value - location, service and cost”
Reviews.Author: rachaelc
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel in the beginning of spring so many places were booked to capactiy from travlers coming to see the flowers bloom. Service was great. I booked in advance via email. Everything was easy and the response time was less than 24 hours. Upon arrival, I was taken to my room where they completed my registration. I was givena glass of champagne and warm cashews. They asked my about sightseeing activities and provided me tickets to the museums I wanted to go to in the city. The ticket costs were added to my hotel bill without any surchage. A wonderful service! I was able to bypass the wait lines at the museums which were 20 minutes at one and 1 hour at the other. They provided me with a city map and provided information about other city events. The hotel is located in a really nice neighborhood with a 2 minute walk to the nearest tram. Very quiet residential neighborhood at night so it was easy to get sleep. The people at the hotel are wonderful. During breakfast they were giving travel information to a couple who was taking a day trip to Harlem. They provided them with train times and useful information so they would not get lost. This was going on while they were preparing and serving breakfast. They didn't miss a beat. I left early for the airport and was able to pay the evening before I left. They helped me to navigate to a bus to get to the aiport cheaply (4 euros). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel, Friendly Services”
Reviews.Author: HaniHoney
Reviews.Content: All I can say is the services received from Hotel Fita team were the best ever service experience of my holidays in Amsterdam. The staff were really friendly and helpful. Clean and spacious room. Breakfast were superb. The best thing is, they understand and respect the various culture and religious believed of their customers. Personally, I can't find any negative points about the hotel or the staff. You should experience it yourself!. -Honey & CT.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: StupidMop
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and everything was great. Rooms were modern and updated, with a very spacious bathroom with GREAT water pressure. Hans was a riot every morning at breakfast, always around to talk to and joke with. The rest of the staff were friendly and helpful. My sister and I both had our laundry done - dropped it off in the morning and by the evening when we returned to the room it was neatly folded in the basket for us. The location can't be beat, it's quiet but it's also right near 2 tram stops and the museums and about a nice 10-15 minute stroll to Leidseplein. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: atms
Reviews.Content: I have never experienced such a wonderful stay like this. The hotel staffs are very kind. The hotel lies in the museum area of Amsterdam. It is very convenient to visit these museums and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, in a great place”
Reviews.Author: george_lazenby
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. We spent Easter in Amsterdam at the Hotel Fita, and we were really glad we did. The hotel is smart and clean, in a quiet street very close to the museums, but a short tram ride from the rest of the city. Our room was big and bright, overlooking a side street even quieter than the quiet street which the hotel sits on. It had a big bathroom, a good quality coffee maker, and a reasonable bed. The breakfast is splendid, with the pancakes and freshly-squeezed juices as mentioned elsewhere, as well as good coffee, excellent cheese and vanilla-flecked yoghurt. All of the staff are great. Some reviewers have described problems with the owner, Hans and he is a bit eccentric. We witnessed a hilarious encounter between him and a rather ponderous guest who clearly wanted to ask him something, but was taking forever to do it during a busy breakfast session. Put it this way - Hans made it clear that he wanted him to get to the point. But we found him charming and helpful, and besides, if you want bland and robotic service, stay at a big international chain hotel. This is a good quality, individual hotel. I liked it (and Hans) a lot, and when we return to Amsterdam, we'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, pleasant, good location”
Reviews.Author: SillyTrippers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great option as it is well located in the museum district, which is peaceful, feels safe, and has great shopping. The rooms aren't special but they are clean and spacious, although you have to put up with two singles rather than a double. Breakfast is included and nice. All the major sights are within a short walk along the canals. You can get a 2 or a 5 tram direct from centraal station in 10 mins - just jump off outside the rijksmuseum or van gogh museum. Amsterdam is great, buy online tickets to major sights to save trouble and hours of queueing. The hotel provides free Internet and printing for this which is very useful. We recommend the Amsterdam jewel dinner cruise and whiling away time in the american hotel cafe, which is surprisingly cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gringomadrid
Reviews.Content: An excellent choice for Amsterdam - agree with all the other positive comments on this board. Very friendly owners, excellent breakfast, and just around the corner from the Van Gogh museum and trams to the city centre. The only reason it doesn't get five stars is price - but this may just be Amsterdam prices (it seems to be in line with similar hotels in Amsterdam). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay and the best staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: MoscowVicky
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Amsterdam's Hotel Fita March 22-26 and have only positive things to say. First of all, the owners and staff of this hotel are the best ever! They will make your stay very comfortable and joyful. You'd quickly adopt and find yourself among friends, because hotel's staff pay attention exclusively to you. You won't be ignored, that's for sure! Location is very good too: Hotel Fita is located at the museum area where Van Gogh museum is almost around the corner! Tram station is also very near, but we quicly figured out how to reach city's center and walked there several times per day. Everything is within walking distance. Oh, and you'd never forget home-made (with love!) pancakes which they serve every morning during breakfast. I can't really think about any negative things, because narrow starecase and small elevators are usual for buildings in Amsterdam's center. So Hotel Fita is a diffinite recommendation and a great place to enjoy beautiful city of Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice breakfast, clean rooms and friendly owners.”
Reviews.Author: tcrees
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here for 2 nights at the end of March and loved it. The hotel was in a nice quiet location but within a 5 minute of the Bars and restaurants. We were greeted by the owner on arrival with a smile and a few laughs. We were then showed our room and given a complimentary drink and some nuts. The room was a good size, clean and the beds comfortable. We are both vegetarian and there was a good selection for us at breakfast with the freshly cooked pancakes a real treat. I would happily stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in the museum district of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LGPG
Reviews.Content: This smaller hotel is clean and quiet and lovingly run by the owners, Hans and Loes. Walking distance from the Van Gough Museum, Reichsmuseum and Vondelpark in a scenic part of Amsterdam. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, complete with a delicious breakfast and free laundry service (which we appreciated after a few weeks in Africa) and highly recommend this little gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita was comfortable and accomodating.”
Reviews.Author: Guineapig51
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the early morning flight from Accra en route to Seattle, for a one day stay. The hotel surprised us with a room ready for immediate occupation. One can also purchase tickets for the nearby Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum at the hotel, and the breakfasts are delicious. I would judge Hotel Fita to be a comfortable location for sightseeing in Amsterdam, and certainly would be willing to stay there in the future, hopefully for a longer period than we were able this time around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for museums + Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tennis_tourist
Reviews.Content: For anyone visiting the musuems the location is great, the Van Gogh museum is literally around the corner and the Rijksmuseum at the end of the road. To get into the centre take the 2 or 5 tram stopping outside the Van Gogh. No problems with noise, seems a quiet area. If you want to lose some money the casino is also just past the end of the road, to the left of the Rijksmuseum. Be prepared to pay 5 euros to get in though :( The breakfast was good, with scrambled eggs and bacon also available along with the usual pastries, cereal and fruit. Tea/Coffee and OJ are also served. My room was big enough, the shower was nice and hot and the bed comfy. Loads of tv channels available including plenty of english channels. There is a pc downstairs that is free to use, so you can check in online and print out your boarding pass which saves time at the airport. Best of all was the warm and extensive welcome I received from the proprietor, who walked me to my room and went through the nearby attractions and explained the best ways to get around. If you are visiting Amsterdam and want some peace and quiet and a nice place to stay at a reasonable price, this place gets my vote.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: alouise06
Reviews.Content: I was visiting friends in Amsterdam so picked this hotel based on previous recommendations and location and I wasn't disappointed. Walking distance to the centre but located in a quiet street. Owners Hans and Loes were most welcoming and ready to help with anything. Will stay here next time I go to Amsterdam - plan to actually see the Van Gogh museum...

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Florida417
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Hotel Fita for 2 nights in February and were quite pleased. Hotel Fita is located within walking distance to most sights. Wi-Fi and (delicious) breakfast are included.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for museum-going and city exploration”
Reviews.Author: landscapelover
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect spot for museum-goers and city-lovers who want a quieter spot away from the central downtown crowds. It is an easy 25 minute walk from the central train station or a 10 minute tram ride (2.60 euros payable on the tram) right next to the Van Gogh museum, and around the corner from the Rijkmuseum and the Concertgebouw music hall. A bustling nearby upscale shopping street becomes very quiet in the evening. You can walk along quiet canals or wallk to busy nighttime centers in just a few minutes. Our room was on the first floor and was very simply furnished, with a great bathroom with large tub and shower. The included breakfast was great, with the pancake being a sweet, delicious crepe. All the staff - seemingly part of one family - were friendly and helpful. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is a little gem in a great location offering comfortable, clean accomodation and great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Aussie088
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent 3 nights at Fita, chosen largely on others' reviews on Tripadvisor, and we weren't disappointed. It is brilliantly located near the Rijksmuseum and van Gogh museum, 2 minutes from the tramline, and offering easy access to pretty much anywhere around Amsterdam. And it is quiet!! The hotel room (twin) was spacious (by European capital city standards), scrupulously clean and the hotel provides the necessary amenities including free internet access. Our hosts were attentive, helpful in providing maps and suggestions for seeing Amsterdam, and they put on a hearty breakfast. I doubt that one could find better value for money in Amsterdam. We couldn't be happier with our choice. D & B Spagnolo Perth, Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “Classic and Great!”
Reviews.Author: Berlin833
Reviews.Content: Great Hotal on a great location, itÂ´s located really central and in an rich neighborhood . The rooms are clean and classic. The classic atmosphere is so nice and a crew crew! A great site I used for my trip to Amsterdam: www.timeinamsterdam.com

Reviews.Title: “I felt completely taken care of.”
Reviews.Author: soapsage
Reviews.Content: First, I loved having a Nespresso machine in my room, so much so that I bought one when I got home. Once I was awake and came out of my spacious room, I was met by either Loes, the thoughtful and precious woman of the house, or Hans, the boisterous and clever conversationalist. I was challenged to ride a bike to the university each day and have the best stories to tell as a result. Loes took care of all the details of what concerts to see and walks to take. Hans and I talked psychology and bodywork each morning over perfect pancakes. It was great to be off the square but close enough to walk to. Very quiet yet perfectly located.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome in a cold Amsterdam winter”
Reviews.Author: TMT_10
Reviews.Content: A great place, very welcoming. Owners very helpful and friendly. Great breakfast, wonderful location at a very reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Fine little hotel, no smoking, excellent breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Jimmmmy
Reviews.Content: I just lucked into this place for a one-nighter to make flight connection. Now I'm planning to come back in April with my son. It was simply charming, and the owners and staff are wonderful, friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: jnjsq2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Fita at the beginning and end of a three week trip to Europe. What a wonderful place -- large exceedingly clean rooms, great breakfast (ever try cheese with jam? Sounds odd but tastes great!) and wonderful staff. The best part are the owners -- Hans got "annoyed" when my cane hit the floor in the breakfast room and promised on our second visit he would have a solution. True to his word, he had a holder for the cane that let it rest on the edge of the table rather than on the floor. But many thanks to his wife for actually going to the store and purchasing it for me! And the location is perfect -- half a block from the Van Gogh Museum; half block the other way to the Rodeo Drive of Amsterdam and two blocks from the Rijks Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Location. Service. Value.”
Reviews.Author: russianinterrupted
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here one night, but were thoroughly impressed with the courteous, helpful, and efficient service. Hans is the most gracious host and the location is perfect, if you want to be within walking distance to most sights.

Reviews.Title: “A top flight hotel with B&B charm in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Nitpicker_9
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and spacious and we were quite impressed with the fact that a full breakfast (really yummy!) and WIFI internet service were included as part of the room rate. The Rijk and Van Gogh Museums are literally next door and it is a short stroll to the splendid canal district. What made our stay at the Hotel FITA particularly memorable was the personality and charm of the staff. Hans and his team went beyond the call of the duty in helping us get around and he was the "tour de force" in facilitating breakfast conversation that was animated and lively. What separates a good hotel from a special one that goes beyond ambience and provides character ? Simply put, it's the people behind the desk who don't hide behind the desk. You won't find a better group than the "FITA" people.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: redd27
Reviews.Content: Looking for a gun hotel to finish our 5 week holiday so booked the Fita and the reviews suggested this is an outstanding hotel . Was around 160 Euros a night which was on the exe side for us. Disappointed in the room (small) and breakfast (ran out one morning). The staff were friendly and it is in a good location next to trams and the museum district - however overall was overated for the price

Reviews.Title: “SOLID WELL-LOCATED VALUE”
Reviews.Author: C_Dictor
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita was chosen for its non-smoking policy and its good museum-area location. Turned out its breakfast was quite good and service was excellent. Left my beloved cap there on my last day in Europe and the hotel mailed it to me no charge! The proprietor is quite friendly and clever and his wife very kind; we recommend this hotel to all interested in a quieter location, large but basic room, not far from trams and museums.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tio-man
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is perfect for a short stay in Amsterdam. It's located in a nice and quiet street next to the Museumplein and fancy PC Hoofstraat. We were very charmed by the spontanious friendlyness of the owner and it's staff. They make you feel very welcome. The room and bathroom were spatious but a bit outdated. Breakfast was OK. The homemade pancakes are very good. We probably will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Home away frm Home”
Reviews.Author: gg10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fita Hotel in October 2009. It was certainly a very relaxing experience. The staff, in particular, Hans and Loes de Rapper are very friendly, and very accommodating and willing to answer all of our questions. Immediately they made us feel at home. The room is modern, clean, cozy and homey and the bed is comfortable and relaxing This is a place to be if you want to relax and enjoy your stay. The Fita Hotel is an Excellent location and immediately adjacent to the nice shopping area restaurants and the canal tour boat . It is centrally located to 2 fabulous museums: Rijk and Van Gogh and short distance frm the heart of the city and other museums. We canâ€™t wait to stay here at the Fita Hotel again

Reviews.Title: “hotel is like a bed and breakfast on steroids”
Reviews.Author: marbev
Reviews.Content: Hans and loes were excellent hosts. the hotel is near everything and the rooms are large , clean and more than we expected. when in Amsterdam in the future we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, intimate, place to stay”
Reviews.Author: triplite
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double size room and it was more than adequate. It had a very large window overlooking the side street - which was for pedestrians (and playing children) only. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and we took advantage of their on-site tickets for the Van Gough and Rijks museums. The location is only a block of two from these museums. The breakfasts were very satisfactory and service was quite personal. They arranged a cab for our departure which was large enough to also accommodate friends at another hotel, and all for a very good price. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality, room and location”
Reviews.Author: travelingbarb2-2
Reviews.Content: This is just a wonderful hotel, thanks to the marvelous hospitality of the owners, Hans and Loes de Rapper. They obviously are committed to providing the best in hospitality and accommodations. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum and the Concertgebouw. Our room, type A, is the largest type of room. It was very bright and clean. The bed was comfortable, the free WiFi was excellent, and a nice desk and occasional chairs were provided. A real treat was the Nespresso machine and coffee provided. The bathroom was spacious and modern and clean. The breakfast room was charming. Hans was usually there to personally prepare eggs, bacon and pancakes if you wanted them. The orange juice was made fresh each day. A nice selection of yogurt, cereals, cheese and bread items were also available. The hotel can provide you with tickets to the museums and add them to your bill, and the staff is always available to answer any questions about sightseeing, transportation, etc. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Please note that there are schools located in front of and behind the hotel. During school hours, the noise from the children in the play yard is constant and quite loud, should this be a consideration for you.

Reviews.Title: “I can recommend this hotel to everyone”
Reviews.Author: horvule
Reviews.Content: Very nice small hotel in very good location. Cleanness, very good services. And the most important - owners Loes and Hans are really nice people who are interested in their guests and try to help them everytime. If you want to have a feeling you are welcomed in Amsterdam, hotel Fita is the best place for you!

Reviews.Title: “I'm so grateful that my travel agent recommended them!!”
Reviews.Author: organplayr
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 wonderful days here at the end of our River Cruise from Budapest. Loes and Hans immediately made us feel not only at home but special. The place is spotless, the breakfasts plentiful and delicious, rooms comfortable and sightseeing advice knowledgeable and always available. The hotel is within easy walking distance from all major tourist sites in a quiet residential area. We felt totally safe even returning on foot late at night. When we return to Amsterdam this will be the only hotel we would consider.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great hosts, fantastic pancakes!!”
Reviews.Author: TetleyJeff
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 36 on the 2nd floor at Hotel Fita for 3 nights in October 2009. The room was fairly small but was very clean and well maintained. On arrival our hostess Loes brought wine and cashew nuts to our room as a welcome. Itâ€™s the little touches such as this that set some places apart from the also rans. The room had a small plasma satellite TV and an espresso machine. The bathroom was a good size and well appointed. The breakfast was excellent with a good choice of pastries, cheeses and possibly the best pancakes youâ€™ll ever taste! The hotel is in a great location just around the corner from the Van Gogh Museum and a high end shopping street with designer label boutiques such as Gucci, Cartier, Hugo Boss, Tommy Hilfiger, etc. It is about a 10 minute walk to the main shopping precincts of the city and a 5 minute walk from the canal boats. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Fita and would definitely stay there again. We would recommend it to couples of all ages and families.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Great Service & Very Clean”
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with my girlfriend and another couple. The hotel is located in the musuem district and only 5 min, by tram, to the centre of the city. The rooms are spotless, amazing breakfast and hosts are very welcoming. Glass of champagne & snack upon arrival!! Free internent - Couldn't find a fault.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Helgie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita was excellent. The owners and staff greeted us warmly and were very helpful. The service was impeccable and the breakfast in the morning was fantastic. The hotel is at a great location. The most memorable thing was the hospitality from the owners. Simply the very best!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in town”
Reviews.Author: Virginianfolks
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 2 nights at the Hotel Fita at the end of September 2009. First of all, you really canâ€™t beat the location: it is extremely close to both the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum, a 10-minute walk to good restaurants near the Concert Hall, and a 10-15 minute walk to Dam Square. Lively Leidesplein is but a 5-minute walk. But on top of this, you will find that all of the staff are very helpful, the rooms are immaculate and the breakfast excellent. We recommend this hotel very highly to anybody. Virginia travelers

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hosts, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: trudzie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Fita for one week in September. It was fabulous! Large room. nice bath, ironing board, expresso in room and free laundry service and access to internet! Hans and Loes and the whole staff were more than attentive to our needs. They beds and sheets were comfortable and fresh. Room and bath spotless. The breakfasts were great, fresh eggs, cheeses, breads, pastries and best of all a freshly cooked pancake (crepe). Fresh orange juice and coffee were delicious. The hotel is close to the museums and a 10 minute walk to Leidseplein, a great spot for hanging out. Also close to the tram to get around the city. I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, convenience, and warm hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Annaram
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I spent 7 nights at Hotel Fita and will definately choose it again on our next visit to Amsterdam. Hans and Loes are wonderfully warm and helpful hosts and Hans has a sense of humor that was a nice bonus to our stay. Hans also speaks 6 languages, something I found extremely impressive. Our room was very large by European standards, as was the bathroom. The room was immaculately cleaned every day. For breakfast there was a wide array of things - eggs, bacon or sausage, pastries, rolls, cheeses, fruit, cereal and crepes (they call them pancakes but to an American it would be a crepe). The location was wonderful - quiet but an easy walk to major attractions and to trams. The staff at the hotel are all as warm and friendly as Hans and Loes and all are happy to help you with things like directions, tickets to museums and the Anne Frank house, etc. And, the hotel offers free phone calls to the US and will do your laundry for you...something that I really appreciated as I was coming off a safari in Tanzania and had a bag of horribly dusty clothing when I arrived in Amsterdam. There was absolutely nothing negative in my experience with Hotel Fita. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly, helpful, restful, and clean place to spend sometime.”
Reviews.Author: ENJOYEDTHEJOURNEY
Reviews.Content: It was a real pleasure being a guest at the Fita Hotel. Hans and his staff did a wonderful job in making us feel welcome, and providing us with a spacious, well appointed, quiet, and very clean room. Included in our stay was the breakfast which was absolutely delicious. Any questions, directions or help we needed, was given in a most helpful and friendly way. One could sense a real concern for our well-being, and making sure we had the best time possible while in Amsterdam. Wouldn't hesitate to go back or recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Bicycle and Traveller Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AustinCyclist
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Amsterdam with our touring bikes in cases as well as 2 other suitcases. Loes and Hans had no problem storing our bikes while we were there in a locked area with outside access. They also happily allowed us to store our bike cases and suitcases there while we were off touring for a couple of weeks. Both Loes, Hans and the other staff are very friendly and eager to share their knowledge of Amsterdam and the Netherlands. Their breakfasts are also wonderful and a cut above the usual free breakfasts that you get at small inns in Amsterdam. My husband loved the pancakes!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Friendly Tourist Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: dwbrouwer
Reviews.Content: I have made many trips to Amsterdam over the years and I have truly found one of the best hotel values in that great city. The Hotel Fita is located near the Museumplein and Leidseplein which makes it one of the best tourist hotels that I could ask for. The staff was extremely friendly, knowledgable, and flexible with all of our needs. From the reservation process over the phone to arranging for transportation for us to storing our luggage, Hans and the FITA staff were very attentive and helpful. Wireless Internet and included breakfast were the icing on the cake. My room was large by Europe standards and very clean. We were extremely happy with this hotel and would definitely make it towards to the top of the list to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lucked out with Hotel Fita”
Reviews.Author: MLEPA
Reviews.Content: My young adult daughter and I stayed at Hotel Fita for 4 nights in early September. I found the hotel to be lovely - excellent location, clean rooms, nice breakfast, great Nespresso machines in the rooms - but most of all, extremely helpful owners and staff. In addition to the helpfulness described by others (including Hans' recommendation to us for the weekend excursion to the island of Texel), Loes kindly located a room for me at the airport for the night before my early departure - not easy to do given the large convention just arriving in town. It is no wonder that some guests we met there make a point to spend a few days in Amsterdam and at Hotel Fita whenever they come to Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bob8828
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at the Hotel Fita, and had a very good experience. Among the plusses: very clean rooms; warm staff, and very warm and friendly owners; excellent breakfast (eggs, sausage or bacon, juice, crepe pancakes); quiet neighborhood, but close to the tram, and 5 minute walk to the art museums and countless restaurants; free wi-fi and a community computer; and free laundry. We found the entire experience a wonderful value and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated hotel and arrogant owner”
Reviews.Author: sal403
Reviews.Content: My biggest disappointment in this hotel was the arrogant owner. My family and I stayed at the hotel for a couple of days prior to embarking on a bike and barge trip. We had been in Holland for a week prior and really needed to do some laundry before getting on the boat. The desk clerk advised us that they had a "free" laundry service and all we had to do was put our clothes in the basket and leave it at the laundry area in the morning. She stated that the laundry would be done while we were out touring the town and would be in our room upon our return at the end of the day. We were overjoyed that we would be free to tour around and not have to spend our time in a laundromat. We arrive home to find a basket full of clothes that had all been dyed purple!!! When I called the desk to ask what happened, the owner was insistent that it was our fault for not separating the laundry. I assured him that had we been told to separate it, we surely would have. As well, if it needed to be separated, why did they go ahead and throw it all in together - it was obvious that there were brightly coloured items as well as whites. So why didn't they return the dirty laundry to our room and advise us that it needed to be separated before they could wash it. Many of the items were not salvageable and we had to throw them away. I estimate that we lost at least $150 worth of clothing. I felt strongly that the hotel should take responsibility for the loss and asked the owner if he would consider giving us a reduction on the room rate so that we could purchase replacements for the remainder of our trip. He flat out refused to take any responsiblity for the screw up and pretty much told me that I shouldn't complain because the same thing could have happened at a laundromat. I was furious that he wouldn't even consider a rate reduction - in my opinion it's the LEAST he could have done since it was a member of his staff that screwed up by not telling us to separate the laundry. I eventually walked away from his berating and arrogant attitude and told him my Trip Advisor review would reflect exactly how poor his customer service is. So - no good review from me. Trust me - there are plenty of other places in the same area that are well priced and you won't have to put up with an arrogant and rude owner who doesn't think it's his responsibiity to make a situation right when one of his staff screws up

Reviews.Title: “Very over rated...expensive rooms and very tired decor but in good location”
Reviews.Author: tembokubwa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on the basis of the very positive write up in Trip Advisor...and were very disappointed. I cannot understand how it got such good reviews. On the positive side it is well located and the owners are friendly...however the rooms are not that great; things were quite tatty and tired; breakfast was disapointing and felt very 1970's; and it was very expensive compared to other equally well located places. I cannot understand how it gets such good reviews - have stayed in many other places recommended by Trip Advisor and generally agree with the reviews or can at least understand them...I just hope this is an exception!

Reviews.Title: “Desperately Overrated”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravUK
Reviews.Content: I agree with an earlier review on Overrating. And the other TripAdvisor members have, for the first time, let me down. I observe that many of the positive reviews are from North Americans who, maybe, are seduced by the small-world charm and are unaware of how appalling the value is. Firstly, this is nothing more than an old-style UK "Guest House" or Bed & Breakfast as a previous reviewer said. It is clean, friendly (ish - see below), but the rooms just have that old guest-house feel to them... (and I'm not anti-guest house... the operative word is "old"). The rooms were distinctly average, even within the category of a guest house. There was a nice nexpresso coffee machine, but with NOWHERE to plug it in (I found a plug in the wardrobe - good job I hadn't hung up any clothes). Clean but basic. Breakfast was fine. The pancake was a pancake (crepe)... and with all that icing sugar it could have tasted like any other crepe... I don't see what the fuss is about. Yes, breakfast was fine, but hardly anything special. Service. Well... the staff who checked us in and at breakfast were just perfect and welcoming. But I'm not really sure about the owners. Everyone says they are helpful, but they didn't seem that interested in me... especially the "wife." I think she enjoys talking to her North American guests and being praised for being quaint... but a distinct snobbishness. And as for the "husband" - he didn't seem at all interested in introducing himself. The location is Wonderful. But that's it. And for the price of â‚¬150, certainly NOT worth it at ALL. I would happily pay â‚¬75 and give it four stars... (but only as a guest-house). So, if you're expecting a "Trip Advisor" wonderful gem... trust me... you will be disappointed. (I am a frequent business traveller... there is nothing snobbish or chain-oriented about me... just disappointed).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: n_plack
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is a wonderful small hotel located near the cultural heart of Amsterdam. The owners are very welcoming and are happy to provide you with helpful information and suggestions for making the most of your time in Amsterdam. The rooms are very clean and the breakfast is high-quality. Overall, a fantastic place - it has certainly become 'our' hotel in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Classy Clean & Quiet in Best Location with Helpful Personable Owners”
Reviews.Author: PeterBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our two day stay at the Hotel Fita, at the end of a 3 week trip to Amsterdam, Bruges, Normandy, and Paris. The facilities were excellent and the location was perfect. But what was exceptional was the helpfulness and friendliness of the owners and staff. We found that they took an active interest every morning and afternoon, in what their guests planned to do that day and how it worked out. They suggested additional activities and ways to save both time and money. They told us about bus #197 which took us with our luggage from the stop 3 blocks away directly to Schiphol airport for only 3 Euros each! Parking for only 6 Euros/day that included 2-way tram tickets for all passengers in the car! (Our first hotel in Amsterdam had offered parking for 25 Euros a day.) On Sunday when we worried that many shops were closed, the owners suggested renting bikes to pedal the canals, since it was much easier with fewer commuters. The Fita is located one block from the Van Gogh museum, with great tram and bus connections, and easy walks to the parts of Amsterdam you most want to see. When I visited Amsterdam 35 years ago, the action was at Dam Square, and the only draw for the south side was a day at the museums. But Dam Square is no longer the center of interest in Amsterdam. You need only one day for Jordaan and the Anne Frank house. The shops, restaurants, canals, and people watching are far more interesting around Museumplein, Munttor, and Leidesplein. We had the least expensive room, and it was located at street level, but there was no noise as pedestrians were few, and there was no truck or car traffic on these small streets in a quiet residential neighborhood. And it was the largest room with the largest bathroom for our whole trip. When you have to repack for the flight home, it is nice to have enough space. On the 24 day trip we stayed at seven 2 and 3 star hotels. Three had tiny rooms, three were noisy, two were seedy, two had careless housekeeping, and most had staff that was barely communicative. At the Fita, not only was the room and hotel exceptionally clean, but the owners take special pride in assuring that it is kept clean and in perfect order. We discovered that the owners once worked for a Sheraton hotel, and opened this hotel some 13 years ago almost as a hobby. They had found the big hotels were too impersonal and they wanted to provide similar top level accommodations but with some personal connections with their guests. Breakfast was top quality with fresh fruit, pancakes, bacon and eggs, and the usual European cereal, cheese, bread, and pastry. They gave us suggestions for local restaurants beyond the typical touristy steak and fries menu. And many extras like free laundry, phone and internet service, a discount for seniors, a welcome drink, an elevator, shampoo and extra towels, alarm clock, prepurchase museum tickets, etc, etc. These made this hotel worth the small difference we paid over the other hotels on this trip. Next trip I will gladly pay the 20 Euros more, and make it up with the savings in parking and bus fees, better food and peace of mind that we got from this very pleasant hotel with its owners and staff that truly want to make your visit hassle free and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Little quiet & relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: Dana2000
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time, the hotel's location is excellent - close to the center of the town, in a very quiet area. Also, very nice are the people running it, that prepare every morning the breakfast - that is more than enough to stat up your day ! The only disadvantage was the small room, but since we were out in the city all day , it really didn't bother us that much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lgblkbass
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days, and received wonderful service and a great breakfast (included) every day, from a very friendly staff. And a another plus is that it is located only a block from a tram stop.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely charming !”
Reviews.Author: Pepper49
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Fita for 2 nights in June, 2009 before a Rhine River cruise. Great location close to public transportation, restaurants, and museums. Tiny, clean, quiet after nearby school closes. Friendly and helpful staff. Lovely breakfast. Included free internet access, phone call to USA, and they even did our laundry ! Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location; great staff & spotlessly clean'”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaPCalgary
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading other reviews on this site & we were definitely not disappointed. The two hotel staff who assisted us were Queenie & Pauline - they went out of their way to make sure we had recommendations for dinner & other sites - the best part was being able to purchase tickets from the hotel for the Van Gogh Museum (one block away) & the Rijksmuseum (one block away) at no addional cost - this saved us from standing in the long line-ups for people purchasing their tickets.
