We used the compimentary hotel guest computer to order tickets for the Anne Frank Museum - a real plus because they only have a limited number of tickets per day: Loved the scrumptious breakfast included in the price of the room. Our room on the second floor was very comfortable; bathroom new & very spacious - loved the expresso machine in the room - lovely touch: A wonderful quiet location near Vondel Park:

Reviews.Title: “Beware single beds masquerading as a double”
Reviews.Author: ManhattanVoyager
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Fita tired from our travels, only to find that the room we had been assigned had two twin beds pushed together for our "double". At the price we were being charged, this seemed outrageous, especially when it was not noted in our confirmation. The front desk was unsympathetic and we checked out, moving to Hotel Piet Hein, which was a block or so away. If like me, you need a true double bed (back problems, discomfort from slipping between the beds) then be sure to make certain they will give you one, or don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent location for Museum District and other Amsterdam attractions”
Reviews.Author: clonman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Fita with our 11 year old son for 4 nights in July 09. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff were particularly helpful and this made a huge difference to us on our first visit to Amsterdam. The hotel is located in a residential area around the corner from the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum. We were able to purchase tickets for the museums and the canal cruise at the hotel, so we did not have to queue, which is a huge advantage. The hotel is easily located using Tram no.2 or no. 5 from the Central Station. Just get off at the Museumplein stop and it's a two minute walk from there. The Hotel is spotlessly clean, the rooms were spacious and quiet, ideal for a good night's sleep. Breakfast is excellent, pancakes, bacon, egg and lots of pastries. The renowned Vondel Park is just a few minutes walk from the Hotel, a wonderful place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Looking forward to staying at Hotel Fita again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice owners, clean hotel, AND free laundry!”
Reviews.Author: BilliardTravel
Reviews.Content: Loes is quite helpful, Hans tries hard to be the irascible curmudgeon, and they succeed in hosting a very nice hotel in a very nice location. Yes, the hotel is a bit South of most of the sights but for the museums and the Concertgeboew, but in reality between the trams and walking (as Amsterdam is pretty compact) you can get anywhere you want to go in 15 minutes or less. The hotel is very clean, the breakfasts are good, and with the owners on site you get great service. This wasn't the cheapest hotel on our trip, nor the fanciest, but it was one of our favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, very clean, great pancakes!”
Reviews.Author: buenofood
Reviews.Content: Staff was great and very friendly. Breakfast pancakes were yummy. The room was very clean. Free use of computer internet downstairs and convenient tickets for museums available to avoid the lines. Also very close to trams #2 and 5 as well as the Rijks and Van Gogh. Would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: AllyKr
Reviews.Content: Comfy bed, clean and modern bathroom and excellent breakfast. As a bad back sufferer, I am always concerned about hotel beds and had absolutely no problems at this hotel. Location was very convenient to the tram line as well. I would highly recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: SandieCaff
Reviews.Content: This time was a return visit to the Fita and it was not a disappointment. We mentioned that we wanted to go outside the city on bikes and Loes drew a map for us and we cycled through the National Park to the beach. It was a fabulous day. Nothing is too much trouble for the owners of this spotless hotel to help with

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Momasita
Reviews.Content: Loved this small, family run hotel right around the corner from the Museums (VanGogh) and also within walking distance of fabulous bakery, canal, shops (highend-reminded me of Rodeo Drive...) and restaurants. Wonderful, freshly cooked breakfast each morning served by owner who sometimes sings (albeit, he needs lessons!). Very friendly, clean and quaint older hotel. Reasonably priced for the area, especially considering the wonderful breakfast and they even did all of our laundry-FOR FREE! Not a fancy, 4 star hotel, but for the money, location, service and perks, absolutely the best. Not far from public transportation and grocery store right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: IpswichDude
Reviews.Content: Attractive, comfortable, easy to get to, with wonderful hosts, this hotel is in a great location and has an unusually good breakfast. I really recommend it. Also, I left my computer on the tram and the owners did everything they could to help me retrieve it (which I was able to do!). I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: blubelle234
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a brillant location. Staff really helpful and the rooms are of good size and clean. The breakfast they provide is lovely. Would really recommend this hotel and I hope to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: HenrikDenmark
Reviews.Content: We were 12 familymembers, ranging from the age of 18 to 70, who visited Amsterdam for 3 nights in the end of june. I was responsible for finding us a hotel, and I have to say, my family praised me all 3 days :-) It was simply perfect for us. What a nice hotel. Quietly situated in the museumarea,yet still not far from everything. Clean and nice rooms with comfortable beds. And especially friendly and helpful people managing the hotel. I cannot recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable, friendly and personable staff.”
Reviews.Author: gobuddy
Reviews.Content: Great location. Best location in city for museums, tram line, supermarket, and Vondelpark. Staff was very personable with owner on premises full-time. Very helpful having museum tickets available and advising on other sights, as well as transportation. Our over-all experience was very positive. Many travelers have concerns over safety. We found that Amsterdam is safe or safer than any city we have visited, including most in the U.S. Hotel Fita is very secure. We have no reservation in returning to or recommending Hotel Fita to others. Hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita treats their guests like family--very special family.”
Reviews.Author: CajunLadyHouston_TX
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita definitely exceeded our expectations. It is a small family run hotel and owners Hans and Loes de Rapper make everyone feel welcome and special. The hotel is reasonably priced by European standards. It is very close to the museums and is within walking distance of restaurants and the tram line. The place is spotless and our room had all the amenities of a more expensive hotel. There is a small elevator. Breakfast was first class, with fresh squeezed orange juice, best scrambled eggs and bacon we've had, crunchy pastries and croissants and home made raspberry and apricot sauces to go on those made to order crepes. We would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anyone we know.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and value & the bonus of Hans & Loes”
Reviews.Author: blh1956
Reviews.Content: Found Hotel Fita via Tripadvisor. Location and value would have rated 5 stars on it's own. The addition of a high quality breakfast with Hans's ultra-delicious pancakes takes it to a 5+. Any local information that Hans or Loes do not have/share is not worth knowing. Hans will tell exactly what the real deal is, whether you want to know or not.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Prime Location with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: LarryK56
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned a trip while our children were away this summer. My wife is in the airline industry, and I am in sales and have travelled for my work over the years so we have some experience with regard to hotels and their accommodations. Like many we used trip advisor to provide some guidance on hotels in Amsterdam for our 5 night stay. Hotel Fita turned out to be a wonderful hotel. The hotel is located on a residential street but close to the major museums, the best shopping in Amsterdam and Vondelpark, so the location is great. The hotel is nice and cozy, neither too large or too small. We had a larger room and it was well appointed. The room was very clean, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was nice size. The bathtub was larger than your usual tubs and the water was nice and hot. The owners go out of their way to make sure that you are comfortable. Loes and Hans provided us with information on restaurants, the renting of bicycles and attractions. The staff is also very nice. Last but not least, Loes and Hans pride themselves not only on the cleanliness of their hotel but also their breakfast. We looked forward to their buffet every morning. This included eggs, bacon, pancakes, fresh rolls, crossaints, pastries and cheese, and let me not forget the freshly squeezed orange juice and great coffee. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Amsterdam who wants to be in a well cared for hotel with comfortable and clean rooms, a great location, attentive owners and staff, and a great breakfast to start their day.

Reviews.Title: “After traveling thousands of miles, it was so nice to be welcomed as old friends.”
Reviews.Author: jjmcgSanBruno_CA
Reviews.Content: We came to Hotel Fita after a two week cruise which ended in Amsterdam and enjoyed our stay there very much. The location, rooms, breakfast, and overall ambience of the hotel suited us perfectly. We could only stay two nights, so the fact that the hotel was near the main museums was ideal. With the Van Gogh museum just down the street, we were able to come back to the hotel with our gift shop purchases before going on to the Rijksmuseum, just a block away. Plus, we bought our tickets at the hotel, so that eliminated some standing in lines. The breakfast was very generous and varied from one day to the next. Be sure to have one of the pancakes - yummy! To get away from the touristy areas, we took a long walk through Vondel Park, which is just a couple of blocks away. It was great to see families out on their bikes enjoying the beautiful scenery. The hotel is also close to the concert hall and some interesting restaurants - ask the innkeepers for directions. If we return to Amsterdam, we will definitely stay at Hotel Fita. It was nice to feel that you'd arrived at a distant shore and found old friends welcoming you and striving to ensure that you have the most pleasant time in their city.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as we expected it to be”
Reviews.Author: CecilHorus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Fita for 3 nights last May at room No. 24 and although we paid for the Double room type A for 165 euros/per night) which was quite spacious and comfortable, we were disappointed to be woken up earlier than desired by the light that came through the curtains, which were made in light colours and material. There was no shampoo only liquid soap. The room had only one garbish bin and the bathroom did not have one at all. The shower's hot water was either too hot or too cold so we decided to take baths in the evenings. We were really looking forward to the breakfast with squeezed orange juice and pancakes but it was really not that great. The owner had told us that breakfast was from 8 am to 10 am, but one morning the kitchen lady told us that the breakfast was only served till 9h30! On weekdays you can be woken up by the kids from the school right in front of the hotel at around 8h30 but then they went in at 9h00. Otherwise the location is very good near Van Gough Museum and Leidseplein. The owner of the hotel was quite nice but his wife was kind of moody. One time we had rented bikes we went back to the hotel to ask them for the name of the street where the 7 bridges were located but the owner's wife kept on talking to a couple even though she knew I was there waiting for their conversation to end and when finally she seemed to have ended her conversation and I asked her if she could tell me where the ..... she interrupted me and told me with an angry face that I had to wait for my turn because she had not finished talking to the couple yet. The next day she could not even face me. Next time we go to Amsterdam we'll go to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nancyL
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the at Hotel Fita and were very pleased. Every element met or exceeded our expectations. The location is great, the owners and staff were quite helpful and the breakfast was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Fita - exceeded our expecatations!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl26Atlanta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our recent honeymoon. We were beyond impressed. When we arrived there had been a little confusion about our reservation. The staff person (the delightful Queenie Phillips) we dealt with immediately remedied the situation and was very sweet. She upgraded us to a lovely suite (for the same price, of course), which was quite roomy and had a great balcony. Despite the fact that we had arrived very early in the day (around 10:00am), we were taken up to the sweet and given champagne to welcome us. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was large and very nice. Breakfast provided several options and was included. The location of the hotel was perfect for us - literally around the corner from the Van Gogh museum, a very short walk to the lovely Vondelpark (great for running, walking, a picnic, etc). The hotel is on a small side street. It's across from a school yard, so there are plenty of kids making noise and playing during the day, but it's very quiet in the evenings, and the kids never bothered us a bit. We will definitely stay here on our next trip to beautiful Amsterdam. If you can, get room 22 - that's the suite we stayed in. If you can afford it, it's terrific!

Reviews.Title: “a truly welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: solotraveler24
Reviews.Content: I was so fortunate that I chose the Hotel Fita as my first place to stay in Amsterdam. I immediately felt so welcome and cared for by the incredibly kind and friendly staff. My room was a single room with a small bed, but it was perfectly comfortable. I especially liked the metal "venetian blind" window covering that shut out the noise and light of the busy city and allowed me to sleep like a baby, even after jet lag. The breakfast was a highlight, especially the pancake(s) made to order. The breakfast room encourages conversation, which is great for a solo traveler. A small dog named Bella welcomed everyone. If you want a clean, safe, welcoming home away from home, start your trip at the Hotel Fita. The staff will answer all your questions patiently and help you get tickets to local museums, etc. They really care about making their guests happy!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Fita could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: mspearl13
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, Hans and Loes bent over backwards to make us feel welcome. The hotel is conveniently located to the tram line, museums and is clean, quiet and very comfortable. Loes gave us fantastic directions and the restaurants she recommended were wonderful. What can I say about Hans? He iscv friendly, funny and a fabulous cook! His Dutch pancakes were to die for! The free long distance back to the states was a real bonus as we were able to check-in with family back home. The laundry service was terrific too. We hope to return to Amsterdam some day - if only to stay at the Hotel Fita again. We have absolutely no reservations about recommending this hotel to friends, family and anyone who will listen!

Reviews.Title: “Location. Comfort. Hospitality. Amsterdam. What more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: bjberkeley
Reviews.Content: There's a reason the Fita is ranked No. 6 out of 375 hotels in Amsterdam. Lots of reasons, actually, all of which are laid out in the reviews below and which I don't need to belabor here. Briefly: The location is ideal. The room was clean and comfortable. And the staff was welcoming, accommodating, and generally a pleasure to deal with. Hans was born to be a hotelier. He obviously wants you to enjoy your stay, both at his hotel and in his city, and goes out of his way to make sure you do -- beginning with breakfast, which is equal parts entertaining and delicious. (Informative, too, should you have questions about getting around town.) We did, in fact, have a fantastic time in Amsterdam, and having the Fita as a base of operations definitely contributed to that. Our only regret is that we were only there for two nights. We can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and convenient--with Yummy Breakfast-Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: juneravellobride
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 day stay in Amsterdam and our stay at Hotel Fita. The room was actually very spacious for European rooms--and looked just like the pics on the web. The location was 5 minute walk to the Van Gogh and Reichs-and right around corner from the Vondelpark too. They make you feel at home--and as everyone said are quite helpful. We were greeted in our room with glasses of Prosecco and a bowl of nuts! The breakfast with the homemade crepe(pancake) and eggs/bacon, plenty of croissant/pastry with their delicious homeade jams, coffee, fresh squeezed OJ etc. Great to have the free international/national phone calls-for a quick call home. Also-the free computer right outside breakfasts room was easy to check e-mails--we booked our Van Gogh tickets and printed them right there. If we are able to get back to AMS again--we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: mentormama
Reviews.Content: We contracted Hotel Fita for our short stay in Amsterdam because they were located near the two museums on our "must see" list. We asked if we could arrive early and keep our luggage with them. We caught an early train and arrived at 10 am. We were greeted and told that our room was on the priority list and would be ready in 10 minutes. They gave us orange juice and directions to a coffee shop. We were checked in and at the Van Gogh museum by 10:30! They also gave us a user-friendly map with the hotel clearly marked. We found all the buildings and restaurants we needed, and we used the map to find our way back to the hotel. As Americans who love our coffee, the bottomless cup at the made-to-order breakfast with buffet was well worth it. Hans made my husband the Dutch pancake (really a crepe) for breakfast both days. He even made me fresh bacon and eggs one morning. We took their suggestion and rode the hop on-hop off Canal Boat (they offer a 5 euro discount). We used this transportation to see Amsterdam architecture, all the museums on our list, and to get to the Central Train station the next day. A great suggestion! Hans and Leus are wonderful and friendly. They take care of you as if you are a visiting relative. I highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: Psiliman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Fita for two nights before our Rhine River Cruise. It was the perfect place to recover from jet lag and the location was ideal for exploring the city. We found the room comfortable, quiet, and very clean, and the owners and staff were generous with logistical help and advice. We took advantage of purchasing museum tickets at the desk and avoided lines. The included breakfast was a great plus. I would certainly not hesitate to stay at the Fita again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - best location”
Reviews.Author: Braintreeboy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is 1/2 block from both the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum in a quiet residential area. They sell tickets (no mark-up) for both museums to save you standing in line. They are also very close to the tram lines, and, in fact, it's not even that long a walk all the way to Centraal Station which is as far as you can go in Amsterdam without walking into the sea. The people bent over backwards to make sure we had a good time. They have free internet access (no need to lug a computer) with printer and will also do your laundry free (within reason). The rooms were excellent as was the daily breakfast (don't turn down pancakes when they are offered). I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “only good things to say about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: irishjohnod
Reviews.Content: Ive just returned from a three night stay at hotel at hotel fita,ive only good things to say about this place .The location is just minutes from the museums,,less than 5 minutes walk from leidseplein and the canals. Its on a quiet street,and for me ,after spending all day out walking,,a good nights sleep is very important to me.I had three excellent nights sleep here.My single room was at the back ,,a good size ,,study table,,comfortable bed,,large window giving it an airy feel.,the room was warm and power shower was excellent.the breakfast was tasty and filling,,,it set me up for the days walking/strolling,Hans making sure that everything was just right as he supervises breakfast.It reconfirms in my mind that family run hotels are the best!Hans ,Loes and the girls make a great team.The fact that there are about 15 or so rooms gives it a family feeling to it.I was very pleased with my choice of hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Secluded Spot in the Big City”
Reviews.Author: duo77
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is a gem. Neighborhood setting with the sounds of nature and of children playing yet convenient to all local transportation. Loes and Hans will make your stay special.

Reviews.Title: “Super Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KBsofNJ
Reviews.Content: We visited Amsterdam for the first time in April 2009 and spent five days in this delightful hotel. It is within easy walking distance of the Rijksmuseum, the van Gogh, and the Concertgebouwe. It is a very short walk from the trams from the Centraal Station. Hans and Loes have been running this place for 30 years and pretty much have it down to a science. Hans swears that he's going to retire, but I don't think Loes really believes it. I certainly hope that they don't: it would be a loss. I'd recommend the Fita to anyone. And, by the way, when you go to their excellent breakfast spread, be sure to sample some of Hans' delicious "Dutch-style flapjacks"! (He calls them pancakes, but they're really crepes).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: AnneElder
Reviews.Content: Located one block from the Van Gogh Museum, it is convenient to shops and attractions. The owners are very proud of their hotel, and they should be. The service was outstanding, the rooms were clean, laundry was free, breakfast was delicious and free, the phone calls were free--what more can I say? The owners were helpful in telling us about restaurants and sights.

Reviews.Title: “Would return in a second”
Reviews.Author: NordicNordic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fita on April 7th 2009 en route to a river cruise. It was an excellent way to start our trip: friendly staff, great rooms, an introduction to Amsterdam architecture, and superb location a block from the Museumplein. Our only regret was leaving. At the enjoyable breakfast, we discovered that their clientelle often had a history of returning to the hotel and we can see why. Highly recommended, but please don't fill it when we hope to return :).

Reviews.Title: “Your Home Away from Home in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Annie797
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a charming, quiet, extremely clean, friendly, and conveniently located hotel in Amsterdam, then The Hotel Fita is for you! Loes and Hans, the owners, were delightful, helpful and welcoming. The hotel is located near several tram stops and around the corner from the Van Gogh and Rijskmuseum. Our room was spacious and included a terrace and surprisingly spacious bathroom (rubber ducky included). Breakfasts were included and were delicious, especially the pancakes prepared by Hans. I highly recommend this wonderful hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: absteen4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Fita on a friendâ€™s recommendation. We were in Amsterdam for a few days before getting on a cruise ship and wanted to sty someplace that was close to the museums, this hotel was prefect! The owners could not have been more gracious. During our stay one of the gentlemen had to go to the hospital, in fact he had to cancel the cruise due to unexpected health problems but Hans was there to help with those arrangements as well We will be going back to Amsterdam next year (2010) and are planning on stating at the Hotel Fita.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita Perfect”
Reviews.Author: dunbar28
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Europe, we chose the Hotel Fita due to the reviews on Trip Advisor. The location is lovely quite at night, close to tram, Van Gogh, Rijkmuseum, very easy to walk places, and very safe. The room was clean and beds comfortable, we had a large bathroom. The owners Hans & Loes treat you like longtime friends, very helpful with directions, advise on restaurants, where to buy tram tickets. They offer to do laundry upon arrival, phone calls to the states were no charge. The breakfast Hans serves was wonderful, we always remember the pancakes with humor! We hope to return someday soon. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious, helpful owners made our stay the best ever.”
Reviews.Author: sandyj40
Reviews.Content: Located just steps from the van Gogh and Rijks museums, the hotel offers a great location and easy transportation to other parts of the city and surrounding towns. Loes and Hans, the owneres, are truly interested in making your visit to this interesting city the best possible experience. When you visit a city where you don't know the language and are unsure of how to get around, these two great people key in on what you want to see and do and suggest sites and modes of transportation to save you time and money. Hans makes breakfast delightful with his wit and dry humor and Loes is gracious, charming, and helpful with her inciteful suggestions. We (two women over 50 from the U.S.) stayed a week and had the best experience we could have hoped for. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely family run hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: qprcassidy
Reviews.Content: My family and I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We were made very welcome from the moment we arrived with freshly squeezed orange juice and sparkling wine. The staff were very friendly and breakfast time was very relaxed with Hans keeping everyone amused in between serving delicious pancakes. The hotel was around the corner from the Van Gogh museum and not too far from the main shopping area. We were able to fast-track entry into both the museums and Anne Frank's House because the hotel had Wi-Fi access with printer, allowing us to print tickets off in advance. The children loved their spacious room and enjoyed the general atmosphere of the hotel. We look forward to staying at this hotel again and would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay and hated to leave!”
Reviews.Author: mimidots
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute jewel. It is located on a quiet residential street very close to the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum but the tram stop is so close you can be in the center of Amsterdam within minutes. From the moment you walk in until the time you check out you feel like you have stayed with warm, caring and delightful friends. Hans and Loes make you feel at home and are the epitome of the welcoming hosts. The rooms are so clean you could eat off the floor. The beds are firm with crisp, clean sheets and comfortable pillows. The TV is a flat screen, there is an expresso machine to make delicious coffee and the bathroom has the best water pressure I have ever experienced. Did I mention how clean it was! The breakfast was very filling with eggs, bacon, rolls, crossiants, yougart, cereal, coffee, tea, fresh fruit, pancakes and various other things. You won't leave hungry if you take advantage of that breakfast. Hans and Loes are a font of information and will tell you anything you need to know. The rest of the hotel staff is extremely friendly and just as welcoming. There is free international and local calls, free internet and they will do your laundry for you. However you will still have to fold...but, hey who cares! There is a very small elevator that is barely big enough for one person and luggage but my son and I managed with our two bags. If you are feeling fit you can always go up the typical dutch staircase, winding and narrow. We went down but usually went up by the elevator. The area around the hotel is incredibly safe and quiet. There is a school across the street and when the kids come out for recess there can be quite a bit of yelling but even though our room overlooked this area we hardly heard the kids. They have very good windows that block out sound. But you shouldn't even be in your room when the kids are playing. You should be out exploring Amsterdam! All in all, my son and I had a delightful stay and would highly recommend this place to anyone going there. In fact a friend is leaving on Monday and will be staying there on my recommendation. When I return to Amsterdam (and yes I will be going back) the Hotel Fita is where I will be!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--good small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Booker55
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is ideal if you want a smallish no-nonsense place with plenty of friendly service--in a great location. Innkeeper Hans is great fun and makes you feel right at home. Breakfasts were very good and the staff adjusted their serving times for us when we had to catch an early flight our last morning there. Our room was adequate and pleasant with a large bathroom-- though not luxurious. But who wants to pay for luxurious? I hightly recommend Hotel Fita.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly the way I prefer a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nielsen42
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Fita in April 2009 for 10 nights. It was the second time we stayed there, and if ever going back to Amsterdam we will book at Hotel Fita again. The hotel is located perfectly in a quiet street near museums, concerthall and public transportation, but actually in walking distance from the central part of Amsterdam. It's a family run hotel and the staff is very helpfull with advise and suggestions. Karen and Joergen from denmark

Reviews.Title: “Feels like staying with friends...”
Reviews.Author: AlineLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: From the second you arrive in this incredibly well located hotel, Hans and Loes make you feel at home. We were traveling with a teenage son and were given two rooms together that were ideal--small (which is normal for Europe), but with comfortable beds, an espresso machine in the room, and large windows. Within minutes of checking in, Hans brought in a tray of champagne and nuts and helped us figure out the city, the transportation, and the highlights. We were within 2 blocks of the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijks Museum, and sites along the canals were an easy 20 minute walk. The trollies and a big square with every concievable type of restaurant are 5 minutes away. The street parallel to the hotel has incredible high end shopping, and around the corner, an incredible bakery and coffee place. Hans and Loes provided wonderful breakfasts of eggs, bacon, croissants, fruit, yogurt, cereal, and always pancakes-made-to-order, plus fresh made pots of coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice. A computer and printer are available at all time for no charge, and we were happy to find out that we could call out daughter in Paris for free---and they gave us free laundry service (you do the folding!). I can't say enough how hard they work to make Hotel Fita a spotless, friendly, jewel of a small hotel---We would take this over any anonymous 5 star hotel any day, and will plan to stay their on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Little Hotel in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: dolceandsandy
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel Fita. It was a perfect location. It was close to everything, including the museums,. Leidseplain, trams and restaurants. Hans and Loes are onsite all the time to assist with your needs. Yes, the single room was the smallest hotel room I've ever seen in my life, but it was spotlessly clean, had a nice tv and included FREE phone calls which I've never heard of before. We were greeted with a glass of the most amazing sparkling wine (Hans, I forgot to ask you the name of it) and nuts upon our arrival. And if Hans asks if you want a pancake, say yes. You won't regret it. Breakfasts were hearty and delicious. You can smell the cooking from your room. My only comments (not complaints - just suggestions) is that the amenities in the bathroom are somewhat utilitarian. They provide shampoo and body gel (in one) so if you like little bottles of good smelling stuff, you'll need to bring your own. But this is minor. They even did my laundry and delivered it free to my room. You gotta love a hotel like that. Very friendly, warm and clean. And as for those nasty children at the school, you shouldn't be in your room while they are outside playing. YOU should be outside playing in Amsterdam!!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Stay in Europe. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: TnnsBrvs
Reviews.Content: In two trips to Europe in the past year and a dozen hotels, Hotel Fita was the best. Hans and Loes (the owners) and the rest of the staff are absolutely fantastic and unbelievably welcome. The location is great, just a block from the Van Gogh museum, and easily within walking distance to Leidseplein and really anywhere else in the city. If you're interested in more than just a room to stay in, but a great environment as well, then you should stay here. Everything from check in to breakfast was filled with friendly conversation. Hans and Loes truly care about their guests and it shows. If/when I return to Amsterdam, there is no doubt in my mind that I would stay at Hotel Fita again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with walking distance from everything”
Reviews.Author: Mikhail_L
Reviews.Content: we've stayed in this hotel with my wife and son back in 2006 and loved it. Couldn't be any better located and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “So nice, we've stayed there twice....”
Reviews.Author: CandBWashington
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Fita for 10 days in March of 2008, and enjoyed both the hotel and Amsterdam so much that we decided to spend another 11 days there this March. As far as I can recall, it's the first time we've ever returned to the same city and the same hotel in such a short period of time. The location on a relatively quiet street near Museumplein is perfect. The rooms are very comfortable and exceptionally clean. The owners, Hans and Loes de Rapper, are friendly and welcoming. Internet, telephone and laundry service are all provided free of charge. The buffet-style breakfast is excellent (or so my husband tells me -- I'm not much of a breakfast person), and the new espresso makers in the rooms are a great addition since our stay at Hotel Fita last year. Hotel Fita is a lovely little hotel in a beautiful city. We just returned home and we're already looking forward to our next stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Fita!”
Reviews.Author: md9802
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Fita to everyone. I stayed there for a night in October while on vacation. I knew I would be arriving at the hotel at 10A, a few hours before regular check-in time. Much to my surprise, my room was ready for me when I arrived. Loes graciously welcomed me into the hotel. The single room was small but clean. It had everything I needed. My room was on the first floor but there was an elevator as noted but many other reviews. Since I was leaving early the next morning, Loes even took my laundry (free!) when I checked in so that it would be ready later the same day. Loes was extremely helpful with directions, pointing out the relevant buses/trams and good restaurants in the area. The hotel is located on a quiet street, just around the corner from the Museumplein. It's also within walking distance of Vondelpark and the nightlife of Leidseplein. There is a free computer with internet access and a printer - great for printing out your boarding pass before heading to the airport. There is also free wireless available in the rooms. Breakfast was hearty and filling - yogurt, eggs, croissants, and fruit. Even stroopwafels! Local calls and even calls to the US are free, which was fantastic. Both Hans and Loes were warm, welcoming hosts that made me feel at home. I would readily stay at Fita again on my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: WmCT
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews describe the property well. It's in a good location for the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum....just a stone's throw away. Very nice people who run it - very friendly and helpful. Room was small, but that's typical for Europe, but clean and very cozy. Flat screen TV and wireless - very important for me. The bath room had it's own radiator and so was always very toasty warm. The ONLY possible negative could be that the hotel is located very near a day-care, so often you could hear screaming children during the day. It didn't really bother me, but I just thought I'd mention it. Breakfast was good - typical European, and they offered to custom cook eggs if I wanted. Just an all-around good place with a good price. I paid 100 Euro, and that's cheap for Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: merlinandme
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is beautifully located around the corner from the Van Gogh Museum. There is also a nearby tram stop. The location is perfect because it allows easy access to all of Amsterdam, but sits on a quiet street. The hotel offers a nutritious full breakfast that can fuel you for a great start to a busy day in Amsterdam. The rooms are perfectly clean with sufficient storage and closets. The staff are helpful, with everyone understanding English. I would stay here again if I returned to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Gilmann
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching Amsterdam hotels before my trip and chose Hotel Fita due to other reviews, and thought I'd add a bit. It's incredibly close to Museumplein, so if you plan to visit the Rijksmuseum or Van Gogh, it's hard to get closer. It's a 5 minute walk to restaurants, or a 15-20 minute walk to the center of town (and being Amsterdam, it's a fun walk). Hotel is clean, paint is fresh. Beds are small but comfortable. Rooms are as stated (when you reserve, you choose the room size); ours was roomy enough for two leisure/business travellers carrying multiple large suitcases. Free wireless internet. We were welcomed with champagne by the owner, it was a nice touch after a long travel day. Above the norm: the hotel has a lift, and as I've stayed at B&B's in Amsterdam that don't I can assure this was a big, big plus. The breakfast was excellent: freshly brewed coffee, scrambled eggs & crisp bacon, freshly squeezed orange juice, pastries, cheeses, etc. Very nice breakfast area. Booked through Hoteliers.com. Booking process is not a highlight, it took a couple of emails and calls to get it done, but it worked in the end. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home !”
Reviews.Author: bunga08
Reviews.Content: Hallo ! I am Sian Tjan from Jakarta Indonesia. Since years my husband and me have been regular guests at Hotel Fita located in the centre of Amsterdam , Jan Luyken Straat, just across the van Gogh and Rijksmuseum and a few steps away from Leidse Plein and the Vondelpark. The public transportation is around the corner.This is a very nice family hotel, with a very good breakfast., internet facilities and people are treated as friends. We really feel like home away from home. We can warmly recommend you this nice small hotel in a typical old Dutch building with personal touch . Sian and K,Seng Tjan Jakarta, Indonesia.

Reviews.Title: “Cheerful welcome and a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: jmb06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Fita for one night on a weekend trip to Amsterdam to see "Boom Chicago". I had read some favorable reviews online and found that the hotel was very close to the Leidseplein where the theatre is located. The young woman who checked us in was friendly and cheerful. She immediately announced that we were getting an upgrade to the largest (A) type room in the hotel. (It was probably because the hotel was not full, but we thought it was a very nice gesture!) After we settled in our room, she appeared with 2 glasses of champagne. A very nice start to our weekend in Amsterdam. The room was very clean, nicely decorated, with a large spotless bathroom. When we returned to the hotel that night, our room key card opened the front door to the lobby. Breakfast was quite nice, but not as elaborate and extensive as what had been described in other reviews. It was fine, though, again with pleasant service. I have already recommended the Hotel Fita to a friend, and we will definitely return the next time we take trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: RickCalgary
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, friendly owners. The breakfast was great in the morning, more varied and larger than many other options. I was running the Half-Marathon and found the location near enough to the Stadium to walk, but also near enough to the central sights to also walk downtown as well . . . . . so I did a lot of walking in addition to running the race. Nevertheless, some key tram lines also seemed to be within a few blocks, as were places like Concertbouw, Van Gogh and Leidesplein. Voendelpark is also within a few blocks. The room was as I pictured it, with a large, clean bathroom. The owners were willing to be accomodating when I said I might have to leave early for family reasons and then was able to stay. I appreciated the flexibility as I'd been in Africa and out of touch of some things, so was in a bit of a flux the first few days. Free international calls were an unexpected surprise and the internet access helped me stay in touch with my staff back in Canada. Pleasant stay all around and I appreciated the service and consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: jo8181
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have ever written a review for ANYTHING online so trust me when I say that you will be thoroughly impressed with your stay at Hotel Fita. I stumbled upon this hotel while searching for a comfortable, quaint and reasonably priced place to stay during my trip to Amsterdam. The hotel profile online fit the bill and my experience there confirmed all that I had hoped it would be. The rooms were immaculate, the staff were lovely and there were so many little things that made the stay so pleasant. They had free wireless, a printer and laundry service. All of these things are so appreciated, especially in the event you need to check something quickly online but don't want to pay several Euro in order to do so. The breakfast also was spectacular. I would have been perfectly pleased with a basic breakfast, but they always had a hot dish prepared, fresh breads, cheese, yogurt, cereal and of course juice and coffee to start the day off just right. There are dozens of other amenities that while straightforward were much appreciated during my stay. I highly, HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a lovely place to stay that is within walking distance to so many local treasures and hot spots. I will never stay anywhere but here during my future visits to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect spot away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: CBC46
Reviews.Content: M and C from San Mateo, CA We just returned from a 5-night stay at the Hotel Fita in Amsterdam. The location, near the Van Gogh Museum (quiet, safe, on public transportation), the helpful owners and hotel staff, the breakfast buffet with fresh squeezed orange juice and all the other perks (free international calls, free internet, free laundry service, small but serviceable elevator) made this a perfect choice. If you choose a smaller room, Hans will store your luggage. We would stay here again and will recommend it to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay. Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Lochdubh_Travelers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Fita for three nights. As many have said, the hotel is in an excellent location and many sights are within walking distance. Our room was on the ground floor and was very spacious. We found our room clean and tidy and the owners very hospitable. We thought Hans had a very good breakfast, although the oranges do run out if you're the last down in the morning. We found both Hans and Loes very friendly and easy to talk to. Hans makes it a point to talk to everyone when they come for breakfast. Loes suggested some very nice restaurants in the area and we enjoyed talking with her and her daughter. Unlike other posts here, we found Loes very friendly and a real treat to talk to! The only negative we experienced was with the maid service. We put the 'Do Not Disturb' sign on the door (we don't like having maids come in our room for short stays) and found that when we came back, the maid had been in and made up the room. We thought that maybe we had forgotten to put the placard up, but the following day she again came into the room. We asked her not to clean our room, but she didn't seem to understand. It was our last night, so we didn't bother saying anything to Hans. We would stay here again, and would recommend this to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita not fitting at all”
Reviews.Author: livingfine
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in our stay at this hotel. After reading the reviews a few months ago I booked us there for only two nights. This is the only time Trip Advisor was wrong. I think the review before that last hit it right. The WIFE has a real attitude when you question her about anything.. I was told by travel agent we had a room with balconey. NOT. and she insisted that we did not and if we didn't like it too bad. Hans the husband said from now on they will chanrge an extra 10 euro for those rooms. Folks we paid 185 euros per night and I almost cry when we were shown rooms near Central Station.. Hotel Victoria would of charged us only 145 euros.. Since we were there on Sunday and Monday..I think that these people are so full of themselves.. You get that idea once you talk to them..It's a take it or leave it attitude..I thought the breakfast was okay but the rooms leave alot to be desired.Dirty and old old old. Paper mitts for face cloths and soap dispensers on the wall. My husband's boss cancel her two rooms in the allowed time but the wife still charge her one night.We loved Amsterdam. We will come back but not here..

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Owners have FITS at Hotel Fita”
Reviews.Author: madmadeleine
Reviews.Content: I had a problem at this hotel. The husband and wife team that run this hotel seem like nice people, but try to complain, and they go on the attack, and they are vicious and relentless. Be warned. I expect to be harassed because I am posting this review. The following is a true account of what happened to me. After kicking us out two days in a row to clean our room, the maid had yet to remove the dirty glassware or clean the room properly. The mirror in the bathroom had tooth flossing specks on it, not from us. There was mildew on the grout in the bathtub. The glass topped coffee table had grease on both sides of the glass and the rug and not been vacuumed. The windows on the french doors were dirty on both sides--these windows were easily accessible, and oddly, the other windows in the window seat area, which were harder to get at, were clean. The room was actually very nice, one of the best in the hotel. And with 10 minutes and some windex and bleach, all would have been fine. However, when I tried to explain this to Hans, one of the owners of the hotel, he went ballistic. I was not aware that complaining was not permitted in their hotel. While we were alone in my room, this intimidating man became irate. He yelled at me for being too demanding! I told him maybe he was unaware that the maid wasn't taking care of all the details when cleaning even though she made such a point of kicking us out of our room for her to clean it. The first day we were there. We were so jet lagged we went back to bed and were fast asleep when the maid walked in on us! We had put the "do not disturb" sign on the door, but she said it had fallen on the floor. She didn't even knock! She insisted that she had to clean the room immediately and gave us 10 minutes to dress and get out. We were too groggy to stand up for ourselves, or to complain about such treatment. The next day, my husband had left to work at the trade show but I was still in the room when she came in and wanted to clean it. So I grabbed my stuff and got out. When I got back I noticed she made the bed and changed the towels. I went downstairs to get some ice and since the ice bucket that had been in our room was not clean, I went into the kitchen and washed it in the sink with some dish soap. I was approached by one of the other employees who asked what I was doing. I told her that the ice bucket had not been clean and I wanted to wash it before putting ice in it. I told her things in our room were not as clean as I would have hoped they would be. A few minutes later, Hans came up with windex and bleach. He said something about that he had told the maid to bleach the mildew in the tub, and he went in to do that. I took the windex and started to do the bathroom mirror and he went ballistic. I pointed out the toothpaste spray on the mirror and said that it had been there since we arrived, and suggested that he might have a problem with his maid not doing her job properly. And we didn't appreciate her walking in on us or kicking us out of our room when we had obviously been asleep! Hans started shouting at me about how unreasonably picky I was being and that everything can't be perfect in a room. He then ran his hand over the top of the armoire and it came down covered with dust! I had no idea what his point was, I wasn't even complaining about the dust, but it was comic how he was raging defensively about how clean the room was and it was actually even dirtier than I had noticed. About a half hour later I was having trouble using the wireless internet, so I went downstairs to try the set-up they have for the guests that don't have laptops, and I saw some windex and a towel next to the computer. So I borrowed these items and took the opportunity to clean the stuff that had been bothering me. I replaced the items when I was done. I sent an email to Loes, who was my initial contact when I booked my stay. She is the wife of Hans and from what I can tell, a co-owner. I told her "This is not acceptable behavior. I would like someone to apologize to me in a civil manner and I expect polite treatment and good service for the remainder of my stay." Then she called to shout at me and tell me how happy she is with all of her staff. And since I did not like my room, I could move out immediately! Now she was being spiteful. With the one of the biggest trade shows of the year in town, there was no way I was going to be able to find anything, and I was not the one that was unable to control my temper. I told her I would see what I could do. And I told her that since I had had a chance to clean the room, it was satisfactory. But that only made her angrier. She came to my door and pounded on it! I told her I was not going to open the door or participate in a shouting match. I told her if she could find a comparable room at another hotel, I would move. She tried, but couldn't come up with anything. So I was stuck wondering everytime I went out whether my stuff was safe in a place where they were so rude and wanted to get me out so badly. And worrying every time I came in that I would see Hans or Loes and they would yell at me again. They got to save some money, because we did not go down to breakfast. We ate out rather than risk any confrontation. That's okay. Hans rules over the breakfast room and our first morning we must have come down later than he wished, even though it was still within the allotted breakfast time. So there was no fresh squeezed orange juice for us! I went online to trip advisor and sorted by one star reviews. I found multiple complaints about them bullying their customers! Guess I should have done more research... To prevent more confrontations, I sent her an email telling her that since she and Hans could not seem to control their tempers, that the only way I would communicate with them was by email. And that they both owed me an apology. There was no apology, and though we had scheduled more days after the trade show, we got out of there as soon as we could. One more little annoyance. We paid extra to get the largest room size because it featured a double bed that was a real double bed, not two singles stuck together. But the bed was topped by two small (probably single size) duvet-like things instead of one that fit the bed. The overlap was pretty small, so In the middle of the night, they would slip around on the bed and create a gap right where we were trying to sleep together. They topped it with a thin chenille bedspread that was the right size, so things looked okay on the surface. It's a shame. It is a nice hotel with a lot of great perks. But the inability of the management to control their negative emotions makes it intolerable. Amsterdam has lots of wonderful places to stay. This is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Final stop on our Major European Citiies Tour”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_Colin
Reviews.Content: I had booked this after seeing very favourable rooms on Trip Advisor and after ensuring that it had a lift. The hotel is well situated near to the Van Gaertestraat tram stop on the number 2 and number 5 tram lines, which is also slap bang in the heart of the Museum district with Rijks and Van Gogh almost on the door step. We had booked two single rooms and these were on a par with our two rooms in Paris in terms of size, but featured a nice LCD TV with BBC1 and BBC2 and a number of other english speaking channels. For the first time during our 6 city tour, we found tea and coffee making facilities, much to Mum's delight. The shower rooms were fine and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast was served in the bottomfloor which had windows at the front that looked out on the street and the room was prettily arranged with fresh flowers on each table. Breakfast was buffet style, but by this stage I was looking forward to my own breakfast facilities back at home. We paid â‚¬105 per room per night for each single room, which included breakfast, and enjoyed some interesting conversations with our host. There was also a free intenet computer on the bottom floor, with an uncomfortable chair (like the Mecure) probably to stop people hogging the terminal. The main drawback to this hotel from my point of view is the unmanned reception desk, and I did hear some American guests make a similar comment when trying to book a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fita!”
Reviews.Author: happytrails94
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Fita 5 nights and had an excellent stay. Our room was spacious and immaculate. It had the feel of a bed and breakfast, warm and friendly. The owners were helpful and available with useful information about their fine city. It is a great location for the art museums and the tram is literally right down the street!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: OzTraveller76
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel in a very convenient location - close to museums and trams, but down a side street so nice and quiet. We found it very comfortable and clean, and would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fita”
Reviews.Author: CCinLouisiana
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is a nice, small hotel in a great location. It is near the Rembrandt museum and Rijksmuseum, near tram and bus stops, and in a residential area so visitors may get a glimpse of how Amsterdam residents live, commute to work on bicycles and bring their children to school. Entrance to the hotel is restricted, which makes one feel safe. The room was lovely. I had a balcony overlooking a school playground. The bathroom was large, with a shower and bathtub (and rubber duck!) You can buy tickets to the Rembrandt Museum and Rijksmuseum through the hotel. The breakfast was good. The breakfast room was set up so that visitors could easily converse and make acquaintances. It was a lovely place, a great location. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Handy to everything”
Reviews.Author: Magere1_2
Reviews.Content: Arrived early AM from Asia and were welcomed by the owner. Room was not ready for some hours so he gave us some suggestions as to where we should visit. Upon return were shown to room - large and very comfortable. Very good bed and pillows (always improtant for me). Room wand the hotel were always spotless. Staff very friendly. Breakfast good. Hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: splash2612
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel for a 2 day stay for visiting the museums of Amsterdam. Our room was fresh and clean and the breakfasts were excellent. We had 2 days prior to catching a cruise to Ireland and Norway so needless to say had a great deal of luggage. Our room was large enough to accommodate the luggage with room to spare. The staff was very helpful and arranged for our transportation to the cruise port. Our hats off to Hans & Loes de Rapper for managing such a well run hotel in the heart of Amsterdam's museum district. Ted & Cissy Twining

Reviews.Title: “loved the location”
Reviews.Author: fivefingersopen
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita's delightfully located on a quiet residential street right behind the high-end shopping street (Chanel ....) The room's a little tight but the bathroom's big! Our room was right next to a playground for a childcare centre so you can imagine how noisy it gets during the day with screaming kids playing right by your window... We were ready to head out most of the time so that didn't bother us.. Free internet access and calls were the best! It was easy for us to arrange meetups with another couple in Amsterdam. We made use of the free laundry service and they were prompt in delivering my bf's shirts after I explained that he had no clean shirts left. Some parts of the clothes arrived damp but it dried soon after hanging it up for a while. The Nespreso machine was a nice touch,as well as the drinks and chocolates as a welcome treat! There's a safebox which I really appreciated. I was expecting the breakfast to be of a lower standard after staying in B&Bs for most parts of my Europe tour; Hotel Fita was a pleasant surprise. The staff's pleasant and they've helped us in booking our airport shuttle. Just make sure that you have your breakfast within the stipulated time. We were slightly late and had to make do with grabbing some leftovers to eat in our room. Overall, a pleasant stay with thoughtful ammenities... =)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modest accommodations”
Reviews.Author: 54austin
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is a clean, modest, little hotel in a great location. On a quiet residential street, it's a short block away from both the Van Gogh Museum and Amsterdam's Fifth Avenue. It's far enough away from the riff-raff of the old city center that you don't feel like you're trapped in tourist hell, but near enough (and Amsterdam's so compact, anyway), that it's all easily accessible by foot. It's also close to Amsterdam's largest park and several supermarkets, which makes for an easy economical picnic. The rooms are clean, but these are very much standard 3-star standards. There are some nice touches, such as a free use of an espresso maker in the room, cable TV, hot breakfast, internet, and a welcome glass of champagne and nuts. Staff are also generally friendly and helpful. But if you look around for specials at some of the other 4/5-star hotels in town, you could probably find a room at the same rate. It's this place's reliability, location and cleanliness keep it a consistent favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel find!”
Reviews.Author: CBCRNA
Reviews.Content: This exceptionally clean, quiet and friendly hotel allows free phone calls and internet access. Very hot powerful showers and wonderful beds and linens. GREAT breakfast included with fresh squeezed OJ and fabulous coffee. Very friendly and helpful staff. Short walk to museums and great shopping. Short walk to tram that takes you anywhere in Amsterdam. This is a wonderful place in a grreat neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and forgiving”
Reviews.Author: RVS798
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation to spend four nights at the Hotel Fita, but our flight from Istanbul was delayed, then canceled -- so I had to call at the last minute and tell the hotel we'd be arriving the next day and would be spending only three nights. Although they would have had every right, under their written policy, to charge us for the first night, they didn't -- which tells you all you need to know about the friendliness and hospitality of this delightful boutique hotel. We splurged for the largest room (165 Euros) and believe me it was worth it! After years of suffering postage stamp-sized hotel rooms in Europe, this was a real treat -- and being less than a block away from the Van Gogh Museum on a lovely, quiet, residential street was an added bonus. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little place”
Reviews.Author: get2ss
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Fita for 3 nights in mid-August. The hotel is small and family run. The guests are well cared for. Right from check-in to the day we left, we never felt away from home. The small touches such as the welcome Champagne, free laundry and free telephone calls (international) made us feel really welcome. Hans was helpful with his travel tips. Breakfast was excellent with a good range and variety, and, comes with explanations of cheese from Hans ;) Being vegetarians, we still had a contented meal. Hotel staff were always smiling and very nice. Everyone on the hotel knew English and we didn't have any communication problems. If you stay here, you can also buy tickets for the Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuesuem. This really saved us time as we saw very long queues at the museums. It's just a block away from Van Gogh and a 5 minute walk to Rijksmuseum and tram stops. It was well worth the price we paid. We'll certainly look forward to staying here next time.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Sandydeepbay
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Fita at the end of our three week trip through France and Amsterdam. My husband, myself and my mother-in-law thought this was the most elegant hotel we had stayed in during our trip. Hans met us and showed us our rooms, where he left with us glasses of bubbly and a bowl of cashews. Our two rooms were on the same floor and we felt secure enough that during the times we were at the hotel, we could leave our doors open and walk down to my in-laws room to check on her. Our double room was very large, airy and immaculate. Our bathroom had amenities which we had never seen before in a hotel. PS. We loved the rubber duck! Our breakfasts were delicious and varied. And we appreciated the freshly squeezed orange juice every morning. We also appreciated the free computer next to the breakfast room to email our kids. Hotel Fita was located in a quiet, leafy neighbourhood. Very central to walk to the museums, restaurants and designer shops to admire the evening gowns. Unfortunately, my husband contracted a bug, and Hans brought him a tray of tea, honey and a lime. A very lovely gesture. Our time in Amsterdam was much to short. We would love to come back again to visit this beautiful city and country and we will definitely return to the Hotel Fita. Thank you Hans and Loes.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, nice, and SMALL”
Reviews.Author: TexasWorker
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel just behind the high-end shops. One of the other reviews alluded to thin walls, but the single rooms on the first floor have concrete walls that made the room extra quiet. Be ready though, the single room is about 3 meters by 4 meters (9 x 12 feet), smaller than my college dorm. Breakfast was decent, not terrific. The location was perfect for me -- walking distance to Leidsplein and 100 meters from the 2 and 5 tram stop. All of the staff were very helpful, even at 23:00! I'd stay there again, but they don't have availability...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, friendly”
Reviews.Author: Abangel74
Reviews.Content: I agree with all of the positive reviews I read prior to booking my stay there. The hotel has a small, homey, and clean feel to it. It is out of the way of the really busy, noisy streets, yet is very close to everything you'd want to do. The espresso machine in the room got a lot of use as we couldn't wake up in time for br'fast for the first 2 days - jet lag! I also liked that although the hotel is small, you feel a sense of privacy (my husband and I tend not to stay at B&Bs because of the non-private feeling), and we never heard a peep from any of the other rooms in the hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent deal on hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: alself
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is ideally situated for seeing the Van Gogh and Rijks museums - just a few steps away from each. It is also located within walking distance of many restaurants and other tourist shops. The rooms are nicely appointed with free wireless internet and free international calls to the US - an excellent perk for business travelers. The owners are very welcoming, offering a glass of champagne and cashews upon check-in as well as a wealth of advice of what to see and do while in town and how best to get there. They also arranged an early breakfast for me due to early departure. Lastly, the Airport Connexion hotel shuttle stops at Hotel Fita and provides excellent economy for travelers looking to get to the hotel without paying a premium taxi service. I couldn't have asked for more and plan to make Hotel Fita a regular stop on future trips through Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, and customer service too!”
Reviews.Author: SactoCA2Rovers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Fita in April 2008 and certainly will plan to do so again for any travels to Amsterdam. It's location within literally steps of the Van Gogh and Rijks Museums, the Concertgebouw, prestigiuous shopping lane, and a neighborhood grocery was absolutely ideal. The immediate area has a "neighborhood" feel, yet the tourist restaurant area of Amsterdam was also within easy walking distance. Hans and Loes and all of the staff are very helpful and considerate. The rooms were attractive and comfortable and the in-room expresso machine added a special treat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: loulie44
Reviews.Content: My husband, 9-year-old son and I stayed at the Hotel Fita for four nights last week and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is on a quiet street that is centrally located. (It's right around the corner from the Van Gogh museum and Rijksmuseum, and a five minute walk to the Leidesplein, where we spent much time sitting on the terraces of various cafes.) We stayed in Room 32, which is one of the largest rooms and easily accommodated the extra bed they brought in for my son. The room has the added bonus of a balcony, where my husband and I enjoyed an evening glass of wine after my son fell asleep. The breakfast included in the room rate is tasty and included freshly baked croissants, raisin brioches, and chocolate croissants; bread and cheese; eggs and bacon; cereal; various fruits and orange juice; and freshly brewed coffee. The staff was pleasant and helpful, and the hotel is impeccably clean. My husband is a native of Amsterdam, and remarked that the hotel was the ideal combination of being in a peaceful location that is central to the sites. We give the hotel our highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the Museum District”
Reviews.Author: Lady_Alka
Reviews.Content: Great little boutique hotel in the Museum district of Amsterdam. It's easy to get around the city on foot, via tram, or via canal boat. Hans (a character) and his crew run a fun place. Our room and bath were plain, comfortable, and very clean. The breakfast (included) was abundant and delicious. The hotel is located next to a noisy schoolyard, so if you are looking for an afternoon nap, this might not be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: liznkate
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently had a three day stay in Amsterdam and the Hotel Fita was our base. She and I both loved our room and couldn't wait to get back to it for a mid-day break. This we could easily do since it was so conveniently located. Since Amsterdam can be a kind of crazy place, we both found comfort in the fact that a school/playground was right next door and that the front door to the hotel was always locked. The hotel is on a nice neighborhood street, too. She and I both recommend the hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome is guaranteed”
Reviews.Author: Wadswick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very convenient location and has easy access to most parts of the city. The owners are very hospitable and keen to please, as well as being fun! They will give you guidance of attractions and how to get to them. The rooms are comfortable and with the hotel being in a quiet location sleep is undisturbed. Above all, and most importantly, everything is clean. Breakfast is a treat with everything fresh and varied.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: canin
Reviews.Content: very peaceful atmosphere , hotel located in a residential quarter , restful decoration of the cosy bedrooms , excellent documentation about amsterdam , proximity of Arts Museum ( Rijksmuseum , Van Gogh Museum ) , many tramway lines to go everywhere , close to boat stops

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent”
Reviews.Author: Tatania77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really loved this hotel. It was clean and it smelled clean, too. The location was very good and the staff were very helpful. The room we stayed in was spacious (not just by Amsterdam standards) and had a nice big bathroom, lovely big windows and a balcony. The view wasn't anything special, but the street is quiet at night, so if you value a good night's sleep more than an exciting view, this hotel is certainly a good choice. One of the best things is their buffet breakfast served in a pretty little room. We found ourselves rather looking forward to all those scrambled eggs, bacon, toast, pastries of all kinds, fruit salad... makes me hungry to be writing about it now! The only shortcoming was our bed which was two twin beds put together, but that is a common feature of most hotels in Amsterdam. Otherwise the bed was quite comfortable. We certainly felt very lucky to have chosen this hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay Anywhere Else While in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: KLMORD
Reviews.Content: I can't wait to return to the Hotel Fita. Large/Clean Rooms, free breakfast, WiFi, and calls including to US. Within walking distance to Rijks, Van Gogh, and tram lines that will take you to Centraal Station & Dam Square. Hans is an awesome host!.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the reviews say”
Reviews.Author: Genings
Reviews.Content: We won't repeat the details in the previous reviews, but will just say that they are all true: this is a wonderful little hotel, absolutely spotlessly clean. Fine breakfast buffet. The location is spectacular, and the nearby #2 and 5 streetcars will take you everywhere (7-8 minute ride to within 4 blocks of the Anne Frank House, for example); we never waited more than 5 minutes for one. The Van Gogh museum is 75 yards away, and the Concertgebouw three blocks. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. One earlier review carped about the small elevator: yes, it's not large, but two people plus some luggage fit easily, and most hotels don't have an elevator at all. Among the other amenities: free laundry service. Just an outstanding value, all around.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ma2008BR
Reviews.Content: THE BIGGEST AND MOST INCREDIBLE SURPRISE OF AMSTERDAM TRIP!!!!!!!!!! We tryed to book another hotel but it was full and there we were to Fita Hotel... a little disappointed cause the other one was full. THANK GOD THE OTHER ONE WAS FULL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We felt COMPLETLY at home!!!! So warm people!!!!! We were received by Suzanne, a so sweet girl who took us right after arriving and with an incredible smile began helping us with a map and ALL informations about where to go, how to go, what we couldnÂ´t miss... it was a so cute reception and made us feel EXTREMALLY welcome. It was like if we were the first guests of the hotel! We felt so specil!!!! We stayed there for just 3 days, it was our first time there, so all this was so important! "She must be the ownerÂ´s daughter" - we thought! Then we went up to our EXTREMALLY CLEAN, WELL ORGANIZED, COMFORTABLE BEDROOM. The same with bathroom.... WONDERFUL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! IÂ´m used to use my plastic sandals to take shower when IÂ´m away.... NOT NECESSARY THERE AT ALL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Bathroom is incredibly clean! You fell it! You smeel it!!!!!! PERFECT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! After some minutes, there was Suzanne again with champagne to receive us!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! COME ON!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I told her!!!! "Suzanne, we are already SO IMPRESSED!!! You donÂ´t need to do ANYTHING else! This is our favorite hotel" (I was traveling for around 40 days around Europe and for sure this hotel was THE BEST!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!). Then she explained us that we had free phone calls, free coffee in the bedroom (with a Nespresso Coffee machine), free hot chocolate (with that thing that boils water), free internet, free laundry and breakfast included (well, this was the only thing I already knew). SOOOO SWEET GIRL!!!! She MUST be the ownerÂ´s daughter!!!!! For sure!!!! In the other day, after a wonderful night, A WON-DER-FUL breakfast!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! ItÂ´s not those "included breakfast" that includes just coffee, milk, some butter and bread! NOOOOOOOOOO! We had fruit salad, natural juice, lots of fruits, different cheeses, special coffee, lots of different breads, and some other things more related to an american breakfast that we brasilians are not used. And the girl who was there...... SO SWEET! Smiling all the time, so helpful, so cute, so warm.... she must be SuzanneÂ´s sister (we thought! )!! Also the ownerÂ´s daughter! They are so nice to be just employes!!!! Am I speaking too much??? ItÂ´s cause I got REALLY IMPRESSED with everything! In the last day we met Hans, the REAL owner!!! And then we discovered WHY everybody is so nice!!! It was holiday and he was taking care about the breakfast!!!! INCREDIBLE PERSON!!!!!!!!!!!! So good humored! So nice! Asking us about how were being our days there, what we have visited... like if we were friends visiting his country and staying at his home! I donÂ´t like to recomend things to people because something that worked to me can not work to you, but THIS HOTEL I DO RECOMEND! I SIGN ABOVE! ItÂ´s a 3 star hotel with a 5 stay treatment!!!! YOUÂ´LL FEEL AT HOME THERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! TRUST ME! Ah! Forgot to say that the location is incredible, the street is so beautiful, calm and agreable, just 1 square from the museums and you can go walking without any problem for EVERYWHERE!!!!! After the whole day walking and visiting this SO NICE PLACE that Amsterdam is, we were really happy to go back to hotel! Like if we could go back home to rest and keep enjoying the city again in the next day! GO THERE AND YOUÂ´LL UNDERSTAND WHAT IÂ´M TALKING ABOUT! Thank you Hans! Thank you girls! AH! SEE YOU SOON!!!!!! CAUSE IÂ´LL BE BACK TO AMSTERDAM AND TO YOUR HOTEL FOR SUUUUUUURE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Mariana SÃ£o Paulo / Brazil PS.: Think noone of the girls were Hans daughter. They were just SO NICE AND WARM people, working with their hearts!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita - One of Amsterdam's Best Kept Secrets!”
Reviews.Author: Patmel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fita is a small, friendly, family owned and run hotel. It is situated in a small residential road 50 yards from the Van Gogh Museum and tram stops and 100 yards from the Rijksmuseum. Vondel Park, the Leidesplein and the Concertgebrou are all within a few minutes walking distance. Booking over the hotel's website was quick and easy followed by a short 'phone call to Loes (the owner) to finalise a few points. We arrived at the hotel before the official booking-in time but were pleased to find out that our room was cleaned and ready. The room was bright and very, very clean and the large bathroom was spotless and with the radiator turned on - always a bonus for me! The room had several extras such as a room safe, coffee maker, ceiling fan and a welcome glass of wine each. Loes and her team were all very knowledgeable and helpful about places of interest, museums, travel arrangements etc. Nothing was too much trouble. Another point, as the owners actually live at the hotel, we felt particularly safe. We stayed at the Fita ten years ago and will certainly stop there again - but this time we won't leave it ten year!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wzb3
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few days in this hotel and were pleased with the staff and accomodations so much that when we returned from Vienna we confirmed our reservation to stay the remainder of our time in Amsterdam. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for comfort and a great location near the Van Gogh and Rembrandt museums. I can't say enough for the excellent public transportation system in this charming city. Thank you, Mr. and Mrs. de Rapper for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely family owned hotel”
Reviews.Author: hang
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Fita for 3 nights. The room had 2 twin sized beds. The room itself was quite large, equal to US standards. The bathroom was also very large. The entire hotel was spotless. The breakfast was simple, but, tasty and ample. The staff, particularly the owners, were always very helpful. I will not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: sanjuanisland
