Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. I was very happy with my stay and definately would stay again. It was clean with a nice breakfast. The hotel keepers were very knowledgeable with information. A reasonably priced nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelsome1
Reviews.Content: In April 2008, I spent four nights at Hotel Fita. I made reservations there based on the reviews I had read. I was not disappointed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very good and was a wonderful way to start each day. As others mentioned, the rooms were relatively small, very clean and functional, but very sufficient for my purposes. I arrived after an overnight flight about 10 a.m. with the expectation that I would be able to leave my bags there since check-in wasn't until 3. My room was available so they let me check in right away and I was very thankful that they did as it allowed me to take a short nap and relax. I would be hard pressed to find a downside to this hotel, but the only one would be that they are located right next to a small playground that can get a little noisy during school hours. Thank you Hotel Fita for providing such excellent service and thank you to TripAdvisor for letting me know you exist!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dipti29
Reviews.Content: My husband, 10 yr old son and I stayed here for two nights and found it to be an excellent location to explore Amsterdam. Half a block from the Van Gogh museum. We were able to buy our museum tickets here too - which got us quickly into the museum and past a block long line of people trying to buy tickets there. Beds were comfortable. Big bathroom with bathtub and rubber ducky. Breakfast, included, was very good with lots of variety: fruits, cheeses, eggs, pastries, good coffee and teas. Owners are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KittyvB
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in Hotel Fita for a business trip last week and have nothing but praise for this clean, friendly, quiet hotel. Staff - absolutely wonderful, very friendly, spoke excellent English, helpful with directions. Room - stayed in no.32, which was a double with a balcony overlooking the street. Very clean, simple decor, all amenities you could want, free international calls from the telephone Location - excellent, very close to a main tram line, near to lots of attractions, although everywhere in Amsterdam is pretty much in walking distance! Price - a little expensive, but April is peak tourist season and Amsterdam is an expensive city at the best of times. Friendly staff and location more than make up for this. All this, including lovely breakfast and free internet - would definitely recommend and hope to return on another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but put in perspective”
Reviews.Author: DCLW
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights some weeks back after reading rave reviews rich with detail. Agree wholeheartedly. But as just one reader noted: please put into perspective. Unless Amsterdam rooms are completely out of sync with other European cities, we thought â‚¬150 was a lot, even with "amenities" like rubber ducks. Keep in mind, rooms are very fresh, but have the feel and charm of a (clean/new) character-less highway motel, complete with plastic soap dispensers, cups, etc. It's not the kind of room you settle into for a cozy weekend - it's very functional, period.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita is as Expected”
Reviews.Author: TexasTripper34
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Fita for 2 nights in March 2008. While brief, it was a great stay. Our room was a very good size, clean, and well kept. The hotel staff spoke great English, and was very receptive. The stairs are steep, but there is a lift for heavy baggage. Also, the hotel provided us museum tickets at regular price so that we could skip the line. The hotel is located directly behind a tram stop which makes it easy to get to/from central Amsterdam...less than 5 minutes. Breakfast is served daily from 7 - 8:30, which for us on vacation, was a little too early, so we didn't eat. We would stay at Hotel Fita again without hesitation. I found most of the reviews to be very accurate, and if you are looking for a quiet hotel in Amsterdam at a good value, this should be considered.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Lorreen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Fita four times in the last 2 years and I am coming back there again this May. I love the location, the breakfast, the staff - especially the owners - and the little extras like the rubber duckies. I recommend the Hotel Fita to all of my friends that are going to Amsterdam. The rooms are so clean - it is a real treat to stay here. Lorreen from Canada

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Amber89
Reviews.Content: Our expectations have been surpassed. We were received with the most friendly welcome of the hotel owners including a welcome drink and were also otherwise impeccably served. The rooms were very clean with a warm atmosphere. The free use of internet and telephone was an unexpected and pleasant surprise. There was a rich choice at the breakfast buffet and the fresh pressed orange juice gave us the boost for the day. Furthermore the hotel is located at a fantastic spot, just next to the van Gogh and the Rijks Museum, and downtown Amsterdam is in short walking distance. We herewith thank the staff for their kind attention and would love to once again return to the Hotel Fita.

Reviews.Title: “Fita is a uniformly wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BryanWSU
Reviews.Content: The owners and staff are friendly and helpful without being intrusive. The property is immaculate, comfortable and perfectly situated near Museum Plein and Vondel Park. Breakfasts are amazingly diverse and well prepared. And the large, well laid-out rooms have extremely comfortable beds and great, roomy baths. All this and free internet and long-distance telephone calls too!

Reviews.Title: “Loved amsterdam fantastic hotel and staff vey good b/fast”
Reviews.Author: allzzz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on one of the best roads in amsterdam ,great for the van goth gallery and museums. with very friendly staff and management.the building is beautiful outside, and very comfortable inside,our bedroom was lovely ,with a very smart bathroom with lots of piping hot water. Our stay was near perfect and we wuold not only love to return to amsterdam soon but would definately stay at the Fita welldone Hans and Loes ALAN & TONI MURRELL LONDON

Reviews.Title: “A really nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: antiquehound
Reviews.Content: We selected the Hotel Fita based on recommendations from Tripadvisor. We just returned from a four night stay in Amsterdam. The hotel was easy to find and centrally located. We were given a warm welcome and our room was very clean and quiet. The room was large by european standards and the bathroom was also large. We had all the hot water and strong water preasure along with a large soaking bathtub. Breakfast was very nice with a good assortment to choose from. Try the scrambled eggs! The free international telephone call service was flawless and we also had access to a computer for the internet. We had all of the museums close by and even enjoyed an evening at the symphony which was a short walk from the hotel. The trolly stoped at all the city center but we walked the entire city from the hotel. It's a really nice place to stay and would recommend the Hotel Fita! We will stay there on our next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Fita!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChrissieKent
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my family for a short break to amsterdam when we arrived to the hotel we got a lovely welcome from the staff , i found they were very helpful with hints of things that we could do around the city from renting bicyles to pre-booking our museum tickets.. Room was cosy and had everything we needed. The breakfasts were basic but tasty and a good start of the day. I would definitely come back and stay in Hotel Fita and i would recommend it. Its a great location for central amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Hotel Fita”
Reviews.Author: Drakken
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Amsterdam for a conference, and didn't like the prospects of staying at one of the "official" conference hotels with Americanized names. Seeking a smaller, local option, I sought out advice from tripadvisor. Hotel Fita was consistently ranked highly, and it's conveniently located near the major museums that my wife would be exploring while I attended the conference. So we made arrangement directly with the hotel at a price that was less than the discounted "official" hotels that were offered as part of the conference I was attending. Overall, we had a great stay. The owners and staff are fun, gregarious, enjoyable to talk to about any topic, and go to great lengths to make your stay pleasant. The personal touch really adds to the overall experience at this hotel. The rooms are small (welcome to Europe!), but very clean and comfortable. The neighborhood is generally very quiet, although the local school kids make some noise during their recesses (the school is located right around the corner of Hotel Fita)! My feeling, though, was that it was much quieter than other hotels located near the center of Amsterdam. If you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of central Amsterdam, yet still be conveniently located close enough to the action, this is a great option. A warning...the stairs are very steep in the hotel, but there is a small lift to accommodate those who don't want to brave the steps to the upper floors. Breakfasts are fantastic and included as part of the hotel cost. The eggs, fruit, and fresh squeezed orange juice were a great way to start each day. The location was perfect if you are a museum lover. The Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum are literally right around the corner. I think we got slightly discounted tickets from the front desk. It's about a brisk 20-25 minute walk to central Amsterdam from the hotel. Many convenient streetcar options are available within a block or two of the hotel, so walking isn't necessary. There are many local food options located within a 10 minute radius of the hotel. My personal favorite restaurant was La Falote. Just take a left out of the hotel, then a left on the first main road...keep walking for about 10 minutes. It's on the right side of the road (ask for directions at the front desk!). We arrived at this restaurant very early for dinner and were one of the only customers there. The chef came out and insisted on making me a special fish dish that wasn't on the menu. It was fabulous...my wife had one of the daily specials and loved it as well. I highly recommend this place. (It was packed by the time we left...so get there early for good seats and potentially great, personalized service!). There is a local supermarket located around the corner from the hotel...it's located underground, so you may walk right past it! Ask the front desk for details.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hotel Fita!!”
Reviews.Author: Tara3056
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fita is a wonderful hotel that I highly recommend! Itâ€™s located in the Museum District, and you can walk to either the Rijksmuseum or the Van Gogh Museum in less than 5 minutes. Iâ€™m sure itâ€™s not as centrally located as some might prefer, but we had no problem walking â€“ or bicycling (fun!) â€“ into the most central part of the city, up to Centraal station, and back again. And the beautiful, peaceful, tree-covered streets with quaint canals made me appreciate that we werenâ€™t entirely in the thick of things. The hotel room itself was very pleasant â€“ plenty large enough; we never felt like we were tripping over our luggage. The bathroom was *huge* and spotlessly clean. Just outside our door was a computer terminal with internet that any of the hotelâ€™s guests could use for free, and down the hall, was the breakfast room. The breakfasts were quite nice â€“ not terribly large or varied but still very good and much-appreciated, and the best part was the fresh-squeezed orange juice that the owner made for each guest. All of the hotelâ€™s workers were extremely nice and eager to help in any way they could. Upon check-in, the front desk worker showed us the room and offered her assistance with anything we needed, then left, only to return several minutes later with 2 glasses of sparkling wine and a bowl of nuts to snack on. So, so very nice and thoughtful! The free laundry service was another perk. We just told someone weâ€™d love to take advantage of that offer, expecting theyâ€™d tell us where to find the washer and dryer so we could wash our clothes, but instead, they told us to leave our clothes in a bag outside our door and they would be returned to us later that day, clean. We felt a bit badly, because we had about a weekâ€™s worth of laundry that needed to be done (we were in the middle of a month-long European vacation), but it couldnâ€™t be helped, and after all, we *had* chosen to stay there â€“ in part â€“ specifically because of the laundry service. Oh, and I almost forgot one of the biggest perks: free phone calls to anywhere in the world! We loved having the chance to speak with our families, to let them know everything was going okay. So, in short: the free phone calls, free internet, and free laundry service were what made us pick Hotel Fita to begin with, but the location and friendliness of the staff, as well as the general comfort of the room/bathroom, were what pushed it onto our Extremely Highly Recommended list! Before coming to Amsterdam, I hadn't expected to fall in love with it. I was *excited* about our other destinations (London, Paris, Rome, Venice, Loire Valley) but just couldn't get 'pumped up' about Amsterdam. How wrong I was! I fell in complete and total love with this small, beautiful, and most of all friendly city, even preferring it over every other destination but my first-and-always love, Paris. And part of the reason why was this hotel. I absolutely cannot wait to return to Amsterdam (and am, in fact, next year!).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dollySanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three comfortable nights at Hotel Fita this November, 2007. We were totally satisfied with all aspects. Our room, single deluxe, was large, perfectly clean, well appointed, and very comfortable. Closet space was most adequate. We very much appreciated the free access to the telephone for calls worldwide, as well as the free internet service. The staff was most friendly and helpful. Location is about as good as it gets. The Van Gogh Museum is less than a half block away as is the Reij Museum and the tram service. The area is quiet and has fabulous shopping and restaurant within minutes of a walk. We had the pleasure of meeting the proprietor of the hotel at breakfast one morning. We so very much enjoyed our chat with him and he gave us some excellent suggestions for dinners nearby. We hope to visit Amsterdam again, and will certainly make every effort to stay at Hotel Fita. Not to forget to mention that the plentiful and excellent breakfast is included in a very attractive room price. Perhaps, I should also mention that this is a small hotel (16 rooms) and that gives you a more intimate feeling, void of the impersonal feeling of the large hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: HorseLovinDee
Reviews.Content: Nice, quiet, small family run hotel. We stayed in a spacious double deluxe room (#32) on the top floor facing the front street. Room had a nice veranda. Rooms are kept very clean. Kids playing in the playground across the street make a good amount background noise during the day, but you're gone most of the day anyhow. Only problem..hotel is supposed to be no smoking, but I guess they don't enforce it. Someone nearby was regularly smoking either in their room or in the hallways and the smell seeped into our room from under the door. Solved by putting a towel at the bottom of the door. Nice breakfast is served for guests. Would definitely stay at the Fita again.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit to Hotel Fita and its still a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WidleyTraveller
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Amsterdam and yet again to the Hotel Fita. I can certainly recommend it on all counts. The rooms are clean, well appointed and include a safe. Breakfasts are good and smell wonderful. The area is safe and one road away from the Amsterdam equivalent of Bond Street in London eg Pieter Cornelisz Hooft Straat (eg Cartier, Chanel etc). We ate at the nearby restaurants L'Entrecote et les dames (Van Baerlestraat) and the Hard Rock Cafe (Leidesplein). Sadly, the service from one older waitress at L'Entrecote et les dames was not very good and despite pre-booking a table for 9 she got very flustered and had to be calmed down by a younger staff member - otherwise the food was excellent. The Hotel Fita also has free phone calls to the UK & USA and wireless internet plus a internet point by the breakfast room - all free. The staff were incredibly helpful and I can certainly recommend it. Parking outside is generally possible but not cheap. Using a nearby car park such as 'Byzantine' by Leidesplein would be my recommendation but this time we had a minibus that wouldn't fit under the barrier!! When I next stay in Amsterdam it will definitely be at the Hotel Fita.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita is a handy & very comfortable base for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Drut
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with Australian colleague couples x3 (in 60's) for 3 nights. Very comfortable, spacious ensuite rooms, but not 'high end'. (We had a very nice last night 'farewell to holiday' drinks pre-dinner meeting in one of our rooms). Friendly, helpful host Hans - he advises succintly on Amsterdam points of interest & beyond - eg he directed Priscilla & I to undertake a day's cycling adventure into a national park just over an hour by fast train from Amsterdam. We had a fantastic day in rural Holland, while also getting to understand the major attractions of Amsterdam itself in the 3 days we had there! The canals, museums, reasonable restaurants, and transport around Amsterdam are all very accessible from the Frita. Great base for Amsterdam! Denis - Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissLister
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in the double deluxe room. We were very impressed by the large room with a lovely balcony. Hans greeted us warmly and was extremely helpful. Everything super clean. Great location, loved everything. We will definitely book again when we return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with room and bed”
Reviews.Author: peanutsrio
Reviews.Content: Although we agree that this is a very well located hotel, with clean rooms and free laundry service, my wife and I were very disappointed with our stay. In our opinion it is very overrated and what we got was not what we expected based on the information on the site. We booked this hotel for 4 nights because of the reviews, hoping for something special and what we encountered was not at all what we expected. We booked the double deluxe room based on the image on the website - only to be told when we arrived that not all the deluxe rooms have a veranda, they are only deluxe because of size. The onwer couldn`t move us to one with a veranda, and admitted that the image on the website had led to this sort of problem before, and said he was going to change it.. One month later, the image remains the same. We were also diappointed with the bed. From the images, the other rooms clearly have two singles made up together, but the deluxe one looks like a double bed - but our room had 2 single beds made up separately and pushed togerther. Not what you expect at 160 euros a night! We think that the veranda and bed issue should have been clarified with us in the email communications before we finalised the booking. We certainly would not have booked the deluxe room if we had known. Lesson learnt: confirm every detail before finalising a booking - don't rely on the information/images on the website. One other thing, both my wife and I found the beds terrible for our backs - we both found them uncomfortable and left us with back pains in the morning. As soon as we went on to the next city and different accomodation these back problems went away. Apart from the very friendly girl who gave us a lot of information when we arrived , it was not easy to get advice about museums, trips etc, as reception was always empty and you had to speak to the owner on the telephone - but he seemed a little impatient and we found we got better help from the internet. It was useful having access to a computer on the internet, and also one other good thing was that local calls from thehotel room were free. We returned to Amsterdam a week later for 2 nights before flying back to Brazil and this time stayed 2 nights in Hotel Ibis and a much cheaper rate, and had a lovely double bed, which was good for our backs, and we wished we had stayed the other nights there. The tram service is very good for getting to the museums etc. We will not be staying in Hotel Fita again when we return to Amsterdam - and return we will, because it is a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “A fine stay”
Reviews.Author: Sidney2007
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel based on the glowing reviews from travelers. Yes, the hotel is in a great location (nice neighborhood - close to trams and museums), very-very-very clean and comfortable. Good breakfast, free internet/calls/laundry all very convenient. The only negative thing is the fact that in the lower rooms you can hear early in the AM the screaming kids running around the courtyard from the school next door . Furthermore I keep reading about the friendly owners and yes, Hans is very friendly and warm but all our dealings with one particular lady (I assume the wife of the owner) were not very pleasant - she was curt and not very friendly towards us...maybe she was having a bad couple of days. All in all - I recommend Hotel Fita.

Reviews.Title: “A small, wonderful hotel in the Museumplein area of Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: TheAnxiousTravelers
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay especially if you want quick access to the Rijks and/or Van Gogh museums. Hans and Loes de Rapper offer great hospitality and careful attention to detail. Public transportation is close at hand.

Reviews.Title: “extremely pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: amira1001
Reviews.Content: We were quite pleased with our stay at Hotel Fita. The owners were organized and knowledgeable about the city, offering us museum discounts and offering advice about points of interest with directions and maps. The rooms were clean, comfortable with the added bonus of free wireless and laundry done gratis... Breakfast was adequate... overall a good location and well priced C. Loewenstein New York

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: Eurotrip_7
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fita makes you feel at home and Hans and staff like close relatives. For a reasonable price you get a room that is clean along with that snug as a bug comfort. Location is everything and the Hotel Fita is perfectly located with easy walking distance to museums, sights, shopping and fine restaurants. Easy access to transportion takes you to Central Station in minutes. We enjoyed our stay as Hotel Fita made it special.

Reviews.Title: “very nice experience at the Fita”
Reviews.Author: annajustine
Reviews.Content: I spent the last 2 nights at the Fita Hotel.It was a very warm and pleasant experience.The owner knew I was in Amsterdam to work, and that I worked at night and needed sleep in the mornings.He gave me a quiet room which was very comfortable, with a big new bathroom including a huge tub to soak in. I was able to rest very well at the Fita. I also appreciated the free phone calls to Europe and the US.The only thing was that I missed breakfast, which ended at 9 30( 10 at week-ends), but that's just a minor quibble in otherwise a thoroughly relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fita Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dandy2007
Reviews.Content: We were 4 Aussie couples who were spending the last few days of a five week holiday in Amsterdam. We were delighted with our choice of Hotel Fita. On arrival the owner Hans greeted us with some peach cider and nibbles. A very nice touch. The hotel was in a quiet location,yet handy to trams & museums. Our romms were clean, and spacious with a large bathroom , an ironing board & iron, tea & coffee making facilities , writing desk, and two comfy chairs. Everything a traveller could want. Breakfasts were good, fresh orangeg juice, fruit, cereal, cheeses, toast, and cooked breakfast. Hans was only too happy to give advice on what to do and where to go and our group were very happy with his individual recommendations. Four of us had a late flight home and for an extra fee were were able to secure a room for a late check out. We were given fresh towells, making the prospect of our long haul home to Australia easier. Only imporvementI could suggest: Australians do not like powdered milk in the tea. Fresh is best!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hotel Fita”
Reviews.Author: Jolinda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a three week vacation in Europe and had the pleasure of staying one week at the wonderful Hotel Fita in Amsterdam. Upon our arrival we were offered a welcome drink from the owner himself, Hans, who is a very funny and entertaining fellow. This hotel is in a beautiful location, close to all the museums and within walking distance to everything. They also sell tickets to most museums at a discount. The staff is very friendly and helpful with any questions or recommendations to make your stay in Amsterdam very pleasant. The hotel offers free internet and phone calls (just do not take advantage) and a very nice buffet breakfast. Most hotel rooms in Europe are very small, but we had a nice size medium double room, large bathroom, small balcony, overall very comfortable. We absolutely loved the Hotel Fita in Amsterdam and will definitely stay there again on our next trip to Amsterdam. We have been to Amsterdam on several occasions and I must say the Hotel Fita is the best hotel we have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellerBrighton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found the Hotel Fita to be excellent. A very warm welcome and personal service from a charming host/owner. The hotel is ideally situated for the major museums and concert hall. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the rates were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: BlueSkies510
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only had the pleasure of staying at this nice hotel for one night, but we are glad we did. Currently living in the UK but originally from Baltimore, Maryland, USA we are always looking for a nice sized hotel room, but rarely find one because the standard European hotels are much smaller then hotels in the US. However, when we walked into our Double Medium room at Hotel Fita we were pleasantly surprised. It was a very nice size with a big bathroom and even a small balcony. Our room was spotlessly clean and included tea and coffee making facilities. We did not receive a welcome drink as stated in other reviews, but the breakfast was very good. The morning we were there they were serving some sort of meatballs and beans for breakfast which I thought was odd at first, but they were delicious! The staff was very friendly and Hans, the owner, is funny and entertaining. They are also very helpful when it comes to directions or suggestions for dining. They sell Van Gogh Museum tickets at 20% off the regular price right at the hotel. An added bonus is that they will hold your luggage for you after you check out if you are not leaving town right away. Hotel Fita is located on a quite street within walking distance to many attractions. It's also very convenient to the Tram lines. We plan to stay here again on our next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita”
Reviews.Author: Zoooz
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was excited about my upcoming visit to Amsterdam. Yes the hotel is run by super friendly people, yes the breakfast is good, yes the free internet and phone calls are definitely a perk, yes the free laundry is a luxury and the location to a couple of trams is great. The only thing I would say is that the room felt a bit that for a family run hotel, there could be a little more charm and or character. The bathrooms (large in size) have soap dispensers on the wall, same with the shower. There is no shampoo provided which I was prepared for but it would have been a nice touch. We were in a room on the bottom floor which faced a school. This wasn't a problem because we were out site seeing when school let out but it was a concern at first. Don't get me wrong, I have traveled extensively so I know what is out there. I guess it was just a little hyped up. Overall is was a good hotel and we got a great deal. It's just hard because we came from such a charming B&B in Brugge that I can't help but compare.

Reviews.Title: “The Right way, the Dutch way”
Reviews.Author: bigbertha707
Reviews.Content: One thing to keep in mind about the Dutch is that if you are ever invited into the home of a Dutch person, than this is usually considered a very special thing. I was taught that this kind of invitation means you are considered a friend, and friendship is usually not taken lightly with the Dutch. It is typically a long process. At Hotel Fita, i felt as though i was invited into a Dutch home and treated as a friend. And in reality, you are coming into the home of the owners Hans and Loes de Rapper. They own and run the hotel. The hotel was very clean and quite spacious considering it is a renovated large house. The hotel is located in the perfect position, only a hop away from the Van Gogh Museum. When greeted by Loes, she was very quick to give us a map and outline the major points of the city. And even though i had already been to Amsterdam 5 times, she introduced me to something new that i had never done before. After showing us to our room, and despite being very busy with other guest, she came to greet us further by offering us a "welcome to Amsterdam" drink. It was the perfect start to a wonderful weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine family run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert-J
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is NOT a 5 star de luxe Hotel; it is a fine small (16 bedrooms, 29 beds) hotel owned and managed by Hans and Loes de Rapper. Our room (No 32) was large, pleasantly furnished with flat screen TV, iron and ironing board, hair dryer, tea and coffee making equipment and overlooked a quiet street. Breakfasts were good with a help yourself collection of several cereals and muesli, bacon and scrambled eggs, cheeses, and a range of breads, rolls, croissants etc. Free telephone calls (to anywhere), free laundery (collected at breakfast time, delivered to your room by late afternoon), free internet, discounted tickets to the van Gogh and Reichsmuseums are all very useful. The Hotel is very conveniently located for these museums and also for bus and tram services around Amsterdam. One solitary drawback for the elderly and infirm are the dozen steps from the street up to reception. Otherwise a fine, friendly hotel

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay at the Fita”
Reviews.Author: sbduo
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights at this well located hotel. The staff was very helpful to us and the breakfast was great! The room was small (we would get a larger one next time), the bathroom well appointed, clean and large and everything was spotless. We would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great breakfast,quiet location”
Reviews.Author: cheshireguy
Reviews.Content: This is a true gem of a Hotel. Very quiet location, yet close to all the major attractions, and a minute away from the Van Goch Museum, with a discounted ticket too bought from the hotel. Fantastic breakfast, scrambled egg & bacon, and with superb breads. I always stay in this Hotel in Amsterdam, it never fails, totally clean, and run in a courteous manner by the owners.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: PhyllidaToronto
Reviews.Content: A perfect location on a classy street away from Central Station, (10 minute tram ride), but close to cultural part of city. and quick access by foot to the leidersplein. Extremely clean and comfortable triple room. Everything worked! The welcome drink was a lovely touch, and the breakfast was excellent. Staff very attentive and helpful. Cheapest parking in Amsterdam at the Olympic Stadium, and you receive a tram ticket for your return to the hotel. (five minute ride). Cars are discouraged in Amsterdam. Computer always available to check emails etc. We could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel with Holland Charm”
Reviews.Author: MacAsia
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel because of the reviews of Tripadvisor members and I was not disappointed. The hotel has a fantastic European Charm. The hotel staff (although I did not meet the friendly owners like other members) were excellent. They were very accomodating in answering our questions, booking taxis, doing our laundry. True professionals. I stayed in the twin room, it had cable tv (plasma screen), wireless internet connection (free), en suite with bath/shower, access to iron and ironing board. The two beds were put together so it is small but manageable and to be fair the location for this hotel is excellent. The small details are great, the chocolates upon arrival, the welcome drink, the parting gift. Loved it. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Baltimorons
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Fita from 8/4 - 8/9 and never once regretted our decision. Never having visited Amsterdam, I did a lot of research before making the reservation. Hotel Fita's location was absolutely perfect for us: a half block from the Van Gogh museum, two blocks from the Rijksmuseum, and the next street parallel is full of fabulous high-end shopping, sprinkled with traditional souvenir shops, where we found everything we needed to bring home to friends and family. The hotel is also a short stroll to the Leidsplein where the real action begins! When you've had enough, wander back to Jan Luykenstraat where all is peaceful and quiet. Another reason we chose this hotel was for the included breakfast. A wonderful selection of scrambled eggs, bacon, pastries, healthy cereals, fruit and yogurt and of course, fabulous coffee to get you going for the day. During breakfast the owner and his devoted staff of really nice girls will answer any questions about the area as well as offer tips on places you might not otherwise hear about. When he found out we were planning a trip to The Hague, Hans turned us on to the Panorama Mesdag, a fascinating 360 mural of the local beachscape. Another morning one of his employees hopped on the internet to help us find our way to the local castle, Muidenslot. My husband had been working in the Netherlands the week before I joined him and was in need of fresh laundry. How convenient to have free laundry service! Face it, the rooms are traditional European style. You are not going to find jacuzzis and hot tubs in historic buildings such as Hotel Fita's. If that's what you want, stay in the suburbs. But Hotel Fita is in a great location, offers wonderful customer service, and provides a quiet, comfortable and secure place to stay. Combine that with free laundry, free internet and international phone service (my husband didn't belive me!) and a fabulous free breakfast, and you have a terrific little hotel. And if you behave yourself you get a goodie bag when you leave! How cool is that?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NM43
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Hotel Fita and found it a delightful hotel. My single room was very well arranged. Even though it was relatively small, as almost all single rooms in European hotels are, it felt bigger than average because of the efficient arrangement of the furniture. The bed was comfortable, the room was quiet, the staff were friendly, the location of the hotel was convenient, and the breakfast was outstanding. I had just come from Norway and Sweden, where breakfasts look quite lavish -- long tables of all kinds of food. Breakfast at the Fita did not have that lavish look but tasted much better: freshly squeezed orange juice, apples, bananas, cereal, canned fruit with yogurt, perfectly cooked bacon and scrambled eggs, excellent pastries and other breads, good coffee. (Tea was also available.) I had only two negative experiences: (1) dragging a heavy suitcase up the steep front steps wasn't fun (but would be the same in any of the small hotels in the heart of Amsterdam), and (2) spending about two hours doing very arcane stuff to my computer in order for it to connect to the Fita's wireless network was also not fun. I enjoy experimenting with computers but not when I have limited time in a city I want to explore. I've used my computer in many, many, many hotels in various parts of the world and have never encountered this kind of problem before. Somebody less inclined than I am to experiment with strange screens buried in the bowels of the computer's software would not have had the promised connectivity. I finally succeeded -- but the Hotel Fita is now permanently implanted in my computer's guts -- I may never be able to get rid of it. I am confident that if I showed up in that vicinity a year from now and turned on my laptop, I would connect with the Fita's network. It was not a matter of the usual login screen with a password that would work for a certain period of time. It was a major engineering feat that struck me as probably hacking into the network. But once I did succeed in connecting, the connection was very good. I'm writing too much about the computer experience simply because I found it so strange. The main point of this review is to say that in most ways the Fita was perfect. I rcommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but”
Reviews.Author: sparks07
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Fita but perhaps were expecting too much after reading all the raving reviews. No doubt it is a great location: quiet, in a residential area and with easy access to the tram. The room we had was very basic , clean and large enough. Our room was classified as a double deluxe but are not sure about the deluxe. The two twin beds pushed together to form a double were very tiny and the side tables, attached to the headboard were right against the bed, leaving little room for error. On one side, the table is quite high and we had to place a pillow against its edge so that if you turned over and hit it, you would not injure your head or arm. The owners are lovely people, and very friendly. If you dealt directly with them you got great service. Our bathroom did not have soap in the dispenser, the iron and the kettle did not work or perhaps it was the electrical plugs (hard to tell). Although we mentioned it to the girl on desk, these were never attended to so we used our own soap and did without an iron or kettle. We had been told that there was an iron on another floor but having to look for it was not worth it and the deluxe room is meant to have an iron in it - part of the deluxe feature, I believe. There is little flexibility here. Although we requested a certain type of room, we did not get it. This is quite understandable as it is a small hotel and very busy. However, the girl at the desk did indicate she would add a note and move us if something came available. One right next door came available later but we were not moved even though the people who took it only stayed one night. They could have put them in our room and given us our request for the last night. I guess it was too much trouble. The breakfast was very good but perhaps not for more than two days as it is always the same. Hot foods were scrambled eggs (very good) and bacon. Then breads, cold cereal, yogurt and fruit salad. It ended at 9:30 and toward the end, things like croissants were gone so best get there early enough. The coffee was great, (freshly brewed) as was the orange juice. The atmosphere was pleasant and very friendly. I think we were spoiled by large buffet breakfasts with amazing selections that were included at our previous hotel which was about 35Euros less than Fita. The connexxion which was recommended to us by the hotel must of had some off days as it took forever for us to get to the hotel from the airport. They got us a taxi van because the conexxion was so late. The driver took forever to get himself organized, did not seem to recognize hotel names, needed addresses to the hotels from his passengers and had to use a map to locate the hotels. Some of the passengers had been waited over an hour and this added confusion took its toll . On the return trip Conexxion was late picking us up. Although it was only about 20 - 25 minutes late, thoughts that it could be an hour made us quite anxious about getting to the airport on time. I would recommend a taxi if you have a few people as the conexxion rate is per person or the tram would be a better option. On the whole we enjoyed our stay and the owners are wonderful people - kind and friendly and we feel badly having to mention some of these points but it is important for readers to know what to expect. This is what tripadvisor is about. Keep in mind that even at these prices (160 Euro a night) this is a budget hotel. If that is what you expect, this is a great choice for you. But if you are looking for a bit more then perhaps looking further would be a good idea. I think the rooms here are all quite different and therefore the experience might be as well. The best part of it was the owners. If this is important to you, then you will love this place. We were more interested in getting out and about and then having a nice place to relax after a day of activity and having a breakfast that would be enough to carry us through a busy day. I guess, it is true, different strokes for different folks. We enjoyed our stay but were expecting more.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: sewkap
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect choice! Having stayed at Dam Square before, we really appreciated the quiet and the excellent location of Hotel Fita. It took us a minute to become accustomed to the style --- very non-intrusive --- but no time to learn to love the breakfast. This hotel is a block from the Van Gogh Museum and several tram lines. Buy the I Amsterdam card, and you can sail around the city, returning to your ultra-clean (how Dutch!) room at the Fita.

Reviews.Title: “Should be ranked as the #1 hotel in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: shorefolk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel in late June for a three night pre-cruise stay. We had no problems with making online reservations and several questions we had were answered quickly. We used the recommended Connexxion Airport Shuttle which deposited us at the front steps of this quaint facility. We stayed in room 32, a deluxe double room which was large by European standards and was immaculate. The room had a small balcony and overlooked an elementary school. This retired teacher loved watching the cute Dutch children arrive on various types of parent powered bikes. The community was very quiet with ATM's within a five minute walk as well as several restaurants which proved to be good. It was very close to several museums and a stop for the Canal Bus, which we rode for hours on one rainy afternoon. Hans was the perfect host who quickly fell in love with my wife's New York accent. He provided us with a fantastic breakfast each morning which was staffed by charming college students . The free telephone calls back to Maryland and the free Internet use were welcomed pluses, as well as having our laundry done for free! Our visit ended with Hans calling a private taxi for us to go to the pier. After a flawless stay, I can't see any hotel being cleaner and the staff more friendly than at the Hotel Fita.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Lara_MM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Fita for two nights in late June 2007. I was traveling alone as I was working in Europe for a month and needed a break. This hotel was the perfect place! I was warmly greeted when I arrived by the owner Hans who was very interesting and entertaining. I was worried about my safety, being alone at night etc, and Hans put me at ease right away. He gave me the right advice and was very helpful. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very hospitable. The breakfasts were great, in fact the scrambled eggs might be the best I have ever eaten. Hans was a great host, he made me feel very comfortable and was very interested in what I had been doing on my trip. He recommended that I attend the Symphony, and I am very glad I did because it was a memorable event. I had a great time while in Amsterdam. In addition to all that the city has to offer (coffee shops and tulips), the cultural activities were very rich, I would take advantages of the museums and musical events. I would highly recommend Hotel Fita and would return on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mostrip
Reviews.Content: My family booked rooms for three night at the Fita. The rooms were large, clean. The neighborhood was great we were close to the museums and out of the wild night life but close enough that we could easily walk there when we wanted to. They had a great breakfast room downstairs with fruit, pastries, cheese, cereals, fresh squeezed orange juice, coffee and tea. Hans was down there every morning to answer all of our questions and give us tips on where to go and what to do. Hans is a delightful character that loves to answer questions and will do your laundry for free. He will not fold them, but you have to remember it's for free. This probably the best small hotel I have ever stayed at in my life. I highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: McLeanVA
Reviews.Content: Our family thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Fita. The location was perfect -- away from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam but steps away from the museums (Van Gogh and and Rijksmuseum), restaurants (Leidesplein) and upscale shopping. The rooms were spacious and spotless. Hans and Loes were the perfect hosts -- pointing us in the right direction for good restaurants and sightseeing. Most importantly, they made us feel comfortable in their hotel. There is no question that Hotel Fita will be our first choice on a return trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good overall value”
Reviews.Author: simpsonap
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita was conveniently located near Vondelpark (which is fantastic), a few key museums and plenty of food options. Not to mention the nearby tram stops if you prefer - however we walked everywhere (about 20 minutes to Dam Square). The room was simple, basic, clean and quite large for Europe - we were in a deluxe. Breakfast was good, and Hans and Loes were very helpful with directions and advice. The free laundry, int'l phone calls (to the U.S.) and internet were huge perks - laundry was done (well) in less than 24 hours!! The elevator was tiny and stairs narrow - but it wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, staff, location”
Reviews.Author: otterco
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Fita in Amsterdam on Sat-Sun, June 9-10 & was very impressed by the hotel and its staff. Check-in and check-out were very easy and quick & the two staff members I dealt with went out of their way to make sure our stay was as comfortable as possible. The breakfast was great: eggs, bacon, cereal, orange juice, coffee, cheese, pastries, bread. The included laundry service and international phone calls are definitely a plus. Hotel Fita may look a bit "outside" the city if you're looking on a map of Amsterdam but it is only a 5-10 minute walk (completely safe) to the Leidsplein, where things go on all the time. Plus, both the Van Gogh Museum and Reijksmuseum and Vondelpark are probably a 2-5 minute walk from the hotel. One thing I wasn't aware of, though: there is no air conditioner in the room, but that's typical of European hotels and made no difference in our stay or comfort level. Also, the room we stayed in had a ceiling fan, which was nice. The bed and sheets were clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spotless and everything worked fine--plenty of hot water and in-room facilities. Hair dryer, wireless net access, etc. Nice flat screen TV as well. One thing to note, in the interest of full disclosure (I didn't see this mentioned in other reviews): there is a school or daycare on the same block and kids run around a lot during the day (we left on a Monday morning and this was the only day we saw/heard this). Probably not an issue for tourists but if you planned to sleep late during your stay it might affect you. Just putting it out there... Take the Connexxion shuttle from Schipol -- we were dropped off second from the airport (maybe a 10-15 minute ride). The Hotel Fita staff gladly reserves your trip back in advance for you. No need for a cab. Another thing I didn't see mentioned is that there is a long street a block away from Hotel Fita that contains a lot of high-end shops, restaurants, cafes, etc. Plenty to see and do in the nice, secure, and quiet neighborhood around the hotel. This is definitely a plus, especially when you consider how crazy things get in the Leidsplein and Central Station areas in the evenings. it was nice to be in the "craziness" during the day and be a very short walk away to nearly total quiet at the Hotel Fita. I completely recommend Hotel Fita and would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay at the Fita!”
Reviews.Author: ShhToronto
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a six night stay at the Fita. We were warmly greeted by Loes who brought glasses of wine to our room after check in. She and Hans have gone to great lengths to ensure that their guests are treated to a wide variety of amenities. Our double deluxe room was spotless, spacious, and had a balcony and huge bathroom. The added touches to ensure our comfort included an umbrella, kettle and coffee, tea and hot chocolate, an ironing board and iron and ceiling fan in the room, with free internet and long distance phone calls and laundry. Their rates include city taxes and an outstanding breakast buffet. Fresh squeezed orange juice, bacon and eggs, croissants, sweet rolls, buns and toast, cheese, fresh fruit, Hans' homemade jams, fresh fruit salad, yogurt and fresh ground coffee start the day. Following the owners lead, the staff is friendly, accommodating, and professional. Our little duck is now in our home bathroom, and Hans' jam will be enjoyed next breakfast. The hotel web site is an honest depiction of the Fita. We loved it and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Fita!!!”
Reviews.Author: ggreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Fita for four nights and were very pleased with our accommdations. Our room was spacious and clean with a nice balcony overlooking the lovely tree-lined street. (It was very quiet except when the children were playing in the school yard across the street which was actually fun to watch.) As everyone else has said, the location is ideal. Breakfasts were really good!! We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fita is just right”
Reviews.Author: journeydog
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Fita based on TripAdvisor reviews. We got exactly what we imagined. Hotel Fita is a great little hotel. While the furnishings are basic, our room was clean and the beds comfortable. The breakfast was ample and delicious - especially the fresh sqeezed OJ. The hotel is located on a quiet, tree-lined street around the corner from the Rijkesmuseum and the Van Gogh museum. The staff was very friendly and welcoming although they are rarely at the front desk. You have to seek them out. The free international calls were great as was the free internet service. We had a very pleasant, two night stay at Hotel Fita and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: HHtravelerSeattle
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita was fabulous! Attention to detail is meticulous. They are friendly, helpful and the room is cute and clean. The location is perfect. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great City, Great Weather!”
Reviews.Author: linford95
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is in a great location, a leafy street in the museum district well away from the frenetic core of the city so it provides a restful haven following a days sightseeing. The city and all its attractions are within easy walking distance or alternatively a short tram ride of the hotel. The room we stayed in is described as deluxe and was certainly large, clean and well equiped with a sizeable en suite bathroom. Breakfast is very acceptable and staff are friendly and helpful. Discount tickets for the nearby museums are available and local restaurants we ate in were very good, particularly "De Knijp" which had an excellent atmosphere. Overall a very pleasant stay in this wonderful city. The sun shone also which was a welcome bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ladyfrommiami
Reviews.Content: Date: May 16-May 22,2007 Reviewer: Lady from Miami Stayed at this charming small hotel earlier this month and had a wonderful time. Hans and Loes were excellent hosts. The property was immaculately kept. We enjoyed the wonderful breakfasts that Hans cooked. The free phone calls that we made to relatives and free laundry service were an extra bonus. Don't expect very ornate rooms. Ours was clean and functional. The bathroom was just fine and the duck found in the room added to the charm of the hotel. The neighborhood was terrific. Near most everything and very safe. Received champagne when we arrived and a little baggie of Hans' most wonderful homemade jelly when we departed. Can't wait to return to the Hotel Fita!

Reviews.Title: “Fita still great”
Reviews.Author: UKSteve
Reviews.Content: My eighth stay at the Fita in seven years of attending the same trade show and it remains a pleasure to be off the conference circuit and somewhere that's small, intimate and spotless. It's convenient for town, trams run in all directions just a block away and now Rick Steve's guidebooks have picked it up I'll be lucky to get in next year! Seriously, I plan to take my four teenage children to Amsterdam as it is such a nice, pleasant place - an of course I'll be staying at the Fita.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cedartrail
Reviews.Content: This is a 16 room hotel on a quiet street in the museum district. It is run by a friendly couple, Hans and Loes de Rapper. The location is convenient for both walkers and those using public transportation. Energetic travelers with not too much luggage can get a tram (2 or 5) outside the train station and be at the hotel within about 10 minutes. Too far to walk with any luggage. The tram will deposit you within one block of the hotel (at the stop just opposite the Van Gogh museum). Taxi's are available, but pricey. Our room was up two flights of fairly steep stairs, typical of other hotels in Europe. A lift is available. The room was clean and very adequate. Not too small. Comfortable bed. The bath was modern and well equipped (hair dryer, soap dispenser, etc.) The breakfast buffet, included in the room rate, was excellent. This hotel was chosen after much research on this and other websites, both for its reasonable rate and location. We would definitely stay here again. An added bonus: discount tickets to some attractions are available at the hotel. Bill and Donna Anderson, Valley Center, CA, USA

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hotel Fita!”
Reviews.Author: MACCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights last April over Queen's day. Room was comfortably clean, hotel location was perfect, and breakfast was delicious. Added to that is the free phone call to the US and internet access to check your email. Hans, Loes and staff are wonderful hosts. Will definitely come back to Amsterdam and stay at Hotel Fita.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PipCornwall
Reviews.Content: Quiet situation in the "Museum District", with easy access to public transport, Vondel Park, shopping area etc. with lots of very good restaurants, bars, brown cafes within a few minutes walk. Friendly staff, happy to give advice & information. Hans has a good sense of humour, in the Basil Fawlty style! & cooks a good breakfast. The hotel is spotlessly clean, rooms have everything you could want; there's free internet access, which is useful if you want info on local attractions, train times, etc & free 'phone calls - again useful to confirm local arrangements. Two middle-aged English couples would highly reommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel FIta - A smoke free respite from the hustle and bustle that is Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: tenren
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is a respite from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam. The smoke free environment is very pleasant. A comforting feature is the free long distance capability from one's room. It definitely beats the pay phone at the train station with the calling card that sometimes works. The room we stayed in (14) was clean, comfortable and large. Even the bathroom was big. The location is excellent; a 2 minute walk to the Van Gogh Museum, a 4 minute walk to the RIjks Museum and the tram. I would definitely return to the Hotel Fita if I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita was Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: pdxschulers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Fita for 4 nights over the Queens Day weekend from April 28 to May 2 with our two children and my husbands' parents. The hotel's location is perfect, only one street over from the Van Gogh Museum. It remained remarkably quiet and peaceful even as the Queens Day celebration raged on over behind the Van Gogh Museum. That was a nice treat since we were not joining in the late night partying. The rooms were spacious and clean, the beds comfortable, and breakfast was very nice also. I agree with a former review that Hans does make the best scrambled eggs! We also liked the free internet access at the computer by the breakfast room. Hans gave us many tips for enjoying Queens Day with the children and suggestions for activities such as a concert at the Concertgebouw for my in-laws. Also, the Heineken Experience was within walking distance and was fun for all of us. We will definitely stay at Hotel Fita again if we ever return to Amsterdam. Thanks for a memorable stay in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Gracious service and practical comfort”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesNormie
Reviews.Content: Loes, Hans and staff were excellent hosts and made me feel welcome and well supported. That, along with free phone service anywhere in the Netherlands and to the States, e-mail, a great breakfast each day, and a perfect location (easy walking distance to the museums, Vondelpark, and Leidseplein), made this hotel a fabulous bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Fita suited us perfectly”
Reviews.Author: AgentEars
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at the Fita the last week of April, 2007. The location of the hotel is outstanding. The major art museums and the most upscale shopping in the city are within a block or so, and the hotel is well-served by trams 2 and 5 (Central Station.) We paid 150 euros per night for a sunny corner room with a large bath. Our room was very clean and quiet. The entire hotel is nonsmoking. Breakfast was good - cereals, fruit, bread, cheese, pastries, bacon and eggs, real orange juice. Our hosts were very helpful in suggesting restaurants and providing other advice to enhance our visit. Special pluses that we took advantage of: free laundry service and discount admission to the major art museums. Not for partiers, but perfect for those looking for a clean, quiet, well-located Amsterdam hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Mom and her Son!”
Reviews.Author: Kellly
Reviews.Content: My son Matthew (age 6) and I spent 4 nights at Hotel Fita in April 2007. First, the hotel is spotless! We had a standard room and the bathroom was 3 times the size of most European bathrooms and it was very, very clean. The bed was comfortable, a flat screen TV, safe to store valuables, closet and hot pot. Perfect. The location is fantastic as you are one block from the Van Gogh and two blocks from the Rijksmuseum. The Coster Diamond Cutting Factory is one block away and it was a thrill to see diamonds being cut. The trolley car is one block away and takes you into the city without having to transfer. It doesn't get much easier than that! The free phone calls back to the USA were a nice perk so we could call home each night to chat with my husband. I must say I have not had fresh squeezed orange juice at many European hotels but it is a daily ritual with Hans and his staff. The eggs, bacon, cereals, fresh fruit salad, pastries are unique for a budget hotel. The breakfast exceeded my expectations. Hans the owner is a delight. He entertained us each day with his jokes and antics. Thanks to Hans we made two wonderful day trips because he offered suggestions that we had not considered. It's nice to be in a friendly hotel where they go out of their way to make you feel at home in their hotel, city and country. We will definately stay there again and highly recommend it to others. Sincerely, Elaine and Matthew (age 6)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MickiMcKitty
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the Hotel Fita! Loes met me with a drink when I arrived, which set a very good mood. The rooms were very clean and well appointed, the room had a ceiling fan, windows that open for fresh air, and great water pressure in the shower. They offer laundry services, free phone calls to the US, and free Internet service. The breakfast is delicious and even includes scrambled eggs and bacon! It is located on a quiet street in the museum area, far from the racy and noisy parts of Amsterdam, but there are plenty of restaurants nearby, and a tram line. Loes and Hans are very helpful, and go out of their way to make people comfortable. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rpnj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in april 2007. We got an standard double room, and stayed there for 4 nights. It is an average hotel: 1. the location is not bad (just opposite to Van Gogh's museum, well-served by tram's lines, and about 15-20 minutes from Centraal Station by tram); 2. the staff is fine; 3. the breakfeast is okay; 4. the room was fairly clean. Overall, an average stay. Neverthless, this is not a hotel for people that like to party: breakfeast is quite early from 7h30 to 9h30, and just around 9h30 they are knocking on your door to see if they can clean your room. On the good side you have free internet access (computer next to breakfeast room); free calls anywhere in the world (that is actually the highlight of the hotel in my opinion); and free laundry. I think we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SBCATraveler
Reviews.Content: I am an active participant on Trip Advisor. My husband and I do quite a bit of traveling for business and pleasure and we never hesitate to rely on trip advisor's reviews. The reviews are usually accurate about the hotels we have stayed in. At the time we made our reservation at the Fita Hotel it was listed as #5 on trip advisor for hotels in Amsterdam. Unfortunately after spending four nights at the Fita, we don't share the high esteem this hotel has received. The best thing about the Fita hotel is the location. The hotel is in the museum district and one block away from the "ritziest" shopping street in Amsterdam. It is a quiet, convenient and safe neighborhood. Upon arriving at the Fita Hotel we were greeted by Roel, one of the workers who was very friendly and showed us our room. During the rest of our stay, we did not see anyone at the front desk, it was always deserted. It would have been nice at times to see someone at the front desk to ask some simple questions. In fact, we needed walking directions to a local restaurant to meet a friend and my husband called the number on the in-room information card. The man who answered the phone acted like he was being disturbed at 7:00pm. When my husband said to him, "How are you doing?" He replied, "I'm tired". Not very friendly. The only time you did see any staff was at breakfast. The breakfast was adequate. Fresh squeezed orange juice, eggs, bacon, cheeses , rolls, and yogurt with fruit. Breakfast is served until 10:00am on weekends and until 9:30am on weekdays. Since we arrived on a Saturday evening all we were told by Roel breakfast was from 8:00-10:00, so on Monday morning we showed up at 9:45am and was greeted "Sorry, you missed breakfast". We explained we were not told it ended at 9:30am on the weekdays, and they "Sorry" and we left without breakfast. The worst part about the Fita hotel was the cleanliness of the room while we were staying there. Our garbage was not emptied everyday. Along with the garbage can was broken and we told them about it and it was not fixed or replace. The worst was our soiled bed linens were not changed for three straight days. This was inexcusable & shameful and should be an embarrassement to the hotel. Overall at 140 euros a night the Fita hotel was a total disappointment. I guess you are paying for the location because you are certainly not paying for the friendliness, the food and definitely not the cleanliness of the hotel. Next time, we will choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: PhilipG
Reviews.Content: Arrived to a very friendly welcome and a large clean comfortable room with every facility we would need. Two glasses of champagne and a bowl of nuts arrived within minuites of us being in the room. owners could not do enough to help us. lots of information on where to visit & tourist attractions. hotel in a nice quiet area except school playground equipment by the side of hotel in pedestrian walkway. Road outside closed during our stay, so nice and quiet. However this hotel is in a quiet residential street. Trams numbers 2 & 5 run from station which is just behind hotel. Excellent indonesian restaurant two minutes walk-left out of hotel to end of road, turn right and on the right-we had fixed menu price of 22 euros per person, had so many dishes, could not manage it all!!. Worth buying 1/2/3 days tickets to include trams and hop on and off canal passes. Would certainly recommend this hotel, it is family run and of a high standard. There are steep steps to hotel. Would certainly return and recommend very highly, also free laundry service and free internet and telephone calls. Fab, hope to see you again at some point in the future.

Reviews.Title: “cold”
Reviews.Author: EssexBrown
Reviews.Content: We recieved a friendly and informative welcome, but no champagne or personal touches. Although clean, the room was incredibly cold. We made several attempts to get the problem fixed but were ignored and in the end gave up. We even considered moving to another hotel but as it was only for two nights we suffered it instead. The room was very basic, even a little run down, like rented student digs, but the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was lovely. (Even though the floor drainage wasn't great and meant taking your socks off every time you needed the loo). The staff were elusive, even on trying to pay we were left at the reception desk and the lady on the desk just didn't return. Also, a word of warning, even though they tell you the breakfast room is open until 9.30, arrive by 9 because any later and the reception is hostile, the bacon gone and only one thimble of juice is allowed. If this hotel was offered at a budget price i would say bargain, but it wasn't. It was hugely expensive for such a basic show. I wouldn't say don't stay here, but i also wouldn't say get excited because you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jamesclarke1977
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fita is a lovely hotel in a great area of Amsterdam to be staying. It is close to many of the best museums and also close to lots of exclusive shops and restaurants. The hotel itself is very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are always immaculate and there is plenty of choice for breakfast. A great place for couples and families to base themselves for a true experience of Amsterdam. James and Rachel Clarke, Chippenham, England

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel with 4 star service”
Reviews.Author: _Switzerland_Wangen_
Reviews.Content: Critic: Karin von Rohr, Switzerland The reputation of the hotel is formidable and thatâ€™s the reason why I chose the Hotel Fita. We were friendly welcomed by Loes with a drink. She gave us all the important information about Amsterdam. Why I recommend to you the Hotel Fita? The hotel was very clean. We had a big and great room. The bathroom was excellent. Hairdresser and the other little things you need in the bathroom are part of the hotel Fita standards. When your child gets dirty: No problem, you can wash the clothes free of charge in the washing machine. The phone is also free of charge. In the morning you can choose food from an English-breakfast-buffet. The food is fantastic and so you look all the time forward to the next morning. Hans is a nice person and he helps whenever you have questions or you donâ€™t know what to do. The children love him because he can be very funny. The atmosphere is like in a big family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Patsina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Hotel Fita based on recommendations from TripAdvisor members and Rick Steves, and we're glad we did! We stayed for six nights. The hotel was immaculate, the bed was very comfortable, and the staff was friendly and helpful. There is a tram stop about a block away, and Leidseplein is within walking distance. If we return to Amsterdam, we will definitely stay at the Fita again!

Reviews.Title: “great,fab,smashing”
Reviews.Author: Lwarren
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel a day late due to the snow. Received a very warm welcome. Once in the room there was a knock at the door and a glass of champagne greeted me.Room large very clean, bbc1 channel on tv what more could you ask for!! Will be going back due to great friendly staff and clean spick and span room. Good location for visiting all areas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Stay here....you'll want to stay longer!”
Reviews.Author: TTToronto
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed here late Jan/07 for a few days and i must say, it was wonderful. I have travelled a lot within Europe and i have always looked to this site for reviews and so far, i have not been disappointed. We booked directly through the hotel website with no problems. The hotel is situated in a quiet, upscale residential neighborhood, almost opposite the Van Gogh museum and yet within walking distance to all the tourist spots - we managed to see all the sites without taking the tram at all. The owners were always helpful in securing information about places to see and in providing discounts to some of teh attractions. All that was good, but what impressed me the most was the fact that the rooms were excellent - we were in room 30, a standard double which was a really good size especially for European hotels. The room was clean, clean, clean! the sheets were of good quality, bathroom was impeccable and trust me when i say i was impressed since i am a stickler for clean- i could not find any fault with the room. On top of all that, the service was great - there was a good assortment for breakfast and you could special order hot food like eggs/bacon at no extra cost. It was even better that long distance phone calls were free to Canada and the owner even offered me free calls to Africa when i had to make some. Hans, the owner, actually reminded us that they offered complimentary laundry service which my friend took advantage of. Internet service via their laptop was also complimentary and we never had a problem with requesting the laptop. I have to say that i will definitely stay here again, the service was up and above what i expected. I loved the character of the hotel and the fact that it was very European - some people may have a problem with the steep stairs but it was no problem for me. All in all i say stay here - you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “They lost my reservation”
Reviews.Author: AMSbug
Reviews.Content: I was attracted to Hotel Fita by its location and offer of free internet and long-distance telephone. I contacted them via their web site and reserved about six weeks in advance. When I arrived in Amsterdam, I went to the hotel and was told that they had no reservation for me, were not expecting me, and that they were full for the night. In the end, they helped me find another room for one night nearby (at perhaps the worst hotel I've stayed at in twenty years) and then gave me a room upgrade for the remaining night. Aside from my dealings with the owner (who was less than hospitable and crossed out my entry in their guest book), the staff were great and the hotel was clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “We WILL be back”
Reviews.Author: Blockster
Reviews.Content: My 18 year old son and I just came back from Amsterdam and a 4 night stay at the Hotel Fita. We couldn't have been happier with our accomodations. The hotel is very clean and, best of all, non-smoking. Our medium deluxe room was comfortable, with a large bathroom and lots of amenities. Breakfast is included, with lots of choices, and Hans was back from vacation and present to answer our questions and regale us with stories. The location is ideal, in my opinion. Quiet, yet close to museums and restaurants. My son and I walked everywhere. Can't imagine why you would need the tram. The free phone calls to the US provided my husband back home with "peace of mind" reports, and the free laundry enabled me to have clean PJs and jeans at the midpoint of our visit. I have never stayed in any hotel, anywhere in Europe or the US, that felt more like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “This is where you want to stay in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: kschm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from Amsterdam and a six-night stay at Hotel Fita. We couldnâ€™t have been happier with our accommodations. As was suggested to us from Hans (Fitaâ€™s very friendly owner), take the Connexxion Schiphol airport shuttle to the hotel and buy the roundtrip fare. Itâ€™s cheap, fast and no fuss. Click on the â€œdirectionsâ€� tab from Fitaâ€™s website, then on the link â€œConnexxion Airport Shuttleâ€� and look at the airport map which will show you where to purchase the shuttle tickets and then where to catch the van outside. We didnâ€™t have to wait at all ~ plenty of shuttles available. And on our return, no fuss in the AM â€“ 24 hours prior to departure, ask the Fita staff to call to reserve your spot back to Schiphol. And so about the â€œstaffâ€�â€¦â€¦.Hans and his wife were on holiday for most of our stay in Amsterdam. This was unfortunate because, as we found out on our last night there, he is a wealth of knowledge and a generally fun person to chat with. The employeeâ€™s that were there for our stay did a great job in their absence. Breakfast was served each morning from 8-9:30 and was delicious. Fresh squeezed orange juice, individual pots of coffee for each table, scrambled eggs, bacon, meats, cheeses, pastries, cold cereal, yogurt, fruitâ€¦..we left each morning â€œfueled upâ€� for the day. Our room was a double medium and was comfortable in size. Our beds were two twins pushed together which worked very well for my husband and I who are both over six feet tall. The room was large enough for a little table and two chairs. The bathroom was huge and had a great full powered hairdryer, dispensers for cups and soap, large tub/shower combo and nice size sink counter area. We really liked the soap and cup dispensers ~ nothing worse than those itty bitty bars of soap that slip and slide their way onto the floor and no worry that the glassware has leftover lipstick or baked on crusty stuff. The room also had an electric pot to make almost instant boiling water for espresso, hot chocolate and other choices for in room hot drinks. And clean, clean, clean. I was most impressed with how impeccably clean the place is. Itâ€™s a totally non-smoking facility which is quite nice. For non-smokers, there is no worry of smoke seeping in from other rooms or hallways and no nicotine residue on the walls, linens or woodwork. The free internet and long distance was a really nice and comforting touch. The Hotel is located in a quaint little neighborhood that is away from the bustling nightlife. Itâ€™s the best of both worlds really because itâ€™s only a short walk or tram ride to Leidseplein or Spui for loads of activity. And you couldnâ€™t be closer to the museums and concert hall (Concertgebouw). Iâ€™ve read a couple negative posts regarding the steepness of the stairs. Yes, the stairs are steep, but youâ€™re in Amsterdam!! This Hotel (which Hans has completely renovated) was built in 1902 and steep stairs are typical for any structure in this city of this age. The Hotel has an elevator to take you to upper floors if the stairs pose a problem. We learned to be careful managing all staircases while touring the city. I took photos of the hotel to post here but they didn't turn out. I have taken another look at Fita's website and feel that all of their pictures are very representative of the accomodations. Check it out if you haven't already. Be sure to look at the schedule for the Concertgebouw and get tickets in advance (Fita will arrange) for any concerts you might want to attend. They have free lunch time concerts (30 minutes in length) on Wednesdays. Get there on the early side as they fill up. We bought the annual museum card (available at any museum) and found it to be a good value since we visited both the Rijks and Van Gogh three times. Do your research in advance and check out the other museums on the card â€“ we would recommend Het Rembrandthuis, Museum van Loon, Museum Willet-Holthuysen and Museum Amsterlkring. You must take a quick tour through the red light district â€“ this is where Museum Amsterlking is located. And while there, check out Oude Kerk (â€œOld Churchâ€�) Anne Frank Huis is not on included on the annual museum card but worth the little they charge. Hotel Fita gives a discount coupon for a canal ride which we enjoyed. Go around dusk so that you can enjoy the city from the water while there is still a little daylight but also as the buildings and bridges light up. And although it may sound hokey, do the Heineken Experience. It was a blast!! Page down on the reviews here and look at the post for the special hand sign which will get you a free long neck to enjoy at the end.
