So, if youâ€™re planning a trip to Amsterdam, look no further for accommodations > Hotel Fita is the best value for your money and we consider it our Amsterdam â€œhome away from homeâ€�!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Leki
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in October. It has the feel of a B&B. We loved the location and the staff was very helpful as well. The only complaint I have is our bed was 2 twin beds pushed together which was not comfortable. The breakfast was a nice touch. They will do your laundry for free as well and calls to USA are free, too.

Reviews.Title: “skip the fita”
Reviews.Author: sfsusan
Reviews.Content: I would advise avoiding the Hotel Fita in Amsterdam. The staff there is testy at best, and downright rude at worst. They promise to do your laundry, but what they mean is that they will dump a pile of moist clothes on your bed which you must then hang up and iron yourself as they are a wrinkled mess. They promise internet access, but we had it only 2 out of 7 days there. When trying to discuss similar issues with them they offer no solutions and become almost surly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, Location, Hospitality And More”
Reviews.Author: Jolanda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here four nights in Sept. Location was perfect. Room was sunny and very comfortable. Walking distance to everything. We rented bicycles nearby and rode around with the thousands of locals who use this most convenient mode of transportation. It is such a pleasant way to see the city. The hotel was a comfortable walk to most locations and also near tram stops. The owner was most helpful and friendly. Can you believe that there is free laundry and email? Hotel is on a beautiful tree-lined street. Close to shopping and restaurants. We loved Amsterdam and hope to return and we will definitely stay at Hotel Fita.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Maty
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for five nights at the beginning of November, with my husband. Style: a 1902 typical Dutch building. Lobby is cosy like all hotel. Seems a private hose more than an hotel. Location: literally at the corner of Van Gogh Museum, in the Museum quarter, at a walking distance from National Museum and restaurants and cafes on Leidseplain. Rooms: I had a de luxe room. It was big and comfortable, although very essential furniture (wardrobe, armchair, writing table, chair). Tea and coffee facilities available. Big bathroom with bath tub and hairdryer. We received a welcome drink and it was a nice surprise. The rooms are very very clean and this is very important in a hotel. Do not agree with Korean Tripadvisor's Memeber on this point. Food: Very good choice at breakfast: cheeses, pastries, eggs and bacon, sausages, cereals and yogurt. Very good quality, especially for the pastries and the home-made jam. The food is worth a 4 star hotel. Staff: quite helpful. Mr De rapper very nice and welcoming. The good: Everything. The bad: Nothing, except if you are a smoker, as in this hotel the only place youâ€™re allowed to smoke is down in the street! Final advice and tips: My staying was great: everything was perfect and I would definitely stay there again. Advised restaurants nearby: De Orient (Indonesian), Pulpo (Mediterranean)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita”
Reviews.Author: waybackgranola
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel. The room was spotless and although small, was perfect. The free telephone and laundry service was excellant and a huge perk. We enjoyed the simple breakfast. We also really enjoyed the no-smoking policy.

Reviews.Title: “Super 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nalacalli
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Hotel Fita on 9/13. Had a medium size room #14 which overlook a school/side street and could walk out on the roof. Little noisy with the windows open but the ceiling fan helped to drown out street noise from people out walking around. Quiet residential area for the most part. Five minutes to the museums (Rijks/Van Gogh). Great big bathroom with a hair dryer. Room was very clean if not pretty basic. Liked this area much more than the Dam Square area. Lovely hosts and the breakfast offered in the morning was very good. Coffee was the best part........... Went to an Sama Sebo an Indonesian restaurant close by. Had to make reservations......Lots of locals. Very good food and fun atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay!”
Reviews.Author: Taupa
Reviews.Content: Absolutely delightful boutique hotel in Amsterdam. If you don't mind being out of the hustle and bustle of the city hub this is the place. The hotel is located on a precious quaint street with lovely trees. Easy to get to from the central train station - just take the number 2 or 5 tram right outside the front of the station. You can purchase your ticket for the tram on the last car. Large rooms at this fine establishment and the services are all of the comforts of home. Exceptionally clean! Non Smoking! Family owned and they take pride in their business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2-lawyers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Fita for one night (due to a long layover) in September. I was coming from the Middle East and was quite ill when I checked in. The Hotel Fita was the perfect place to lay down my head and get a good nightâ€™s sleep. The location was wonderful. The hotel was spotlessly clean and had charm to spare. A good sign was when I was checking in; some other guests told me that I would love it there. They were right. The owner's were out of town and there son was acting as host filling in. He was very friendly and very helpful. He kindly explained to me where a pharmacy was located and where nearby places to eat were located as well. He even went so far as to bring extra blankets to my room (without my asking). Although, my stay at the Fita was short, I appreciated the hospitality and quality of the hotel and I look forward to staying at the Fita when I return to Amsterdam next year for a longer stay. In my opinion, the Fita has all of the best qualities of a small hotel - cleanliness, hospitality, location and price. You cannot go wrong with Fita.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anderslj
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights and loved it! Friendly owners and staff, perfect location, large bathroom, clean rooms and a delicious breakfast. Would definately stay here again if we (which we hope) someday come back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ikaikaokaina
Reviews.Content: After my fiance and I decided to visit Amsterdam, we looked to Trip Advisor for recommendations on places to stay and came across Hotel Fita. Hotel Fita was a great choice and live up to all of the excellent reviews posted on this site. The couple that ran the hotel were friendly, the hotel was located in a quiet and beautiful section of the city (near Vondel park) and the breakfast served every morning was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “It was my first trip to Amsterdam and not knowing where to stay”
Reviews.Author: Salsalover
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Amsterdam and not knowing where to stay, my daughter who lives there visited the Fita Hotel first. She immediately gave the hotel a "thumbs up" and so the reservation was made for 8 days and nights. My family loved their stay there and would def stay there again. It was clean, the staff was polite and efficient, and the breakfast was the best in the city!! Every time we had a question, the staff helped us with the answer. It was close to everything we wanted to do and it made my stay in Amsterdam a wonderful experience! And I LOVED the non smoking policy! I would recommend this hotel to everyone for an enjoyable stay in Amsterdam! Linda B.

Reviews.Title: “Adored Hotel Fita”
Reviews.Author: Vallane
Reviews.Content: We took our first trip to Europe in May 2006. Our last stop was 2 nights in Amsterdam. We booked the Hotel Fita based in large part on Trip Advisor reviews. When we arrived we were buzzed in by Hans, who turned out to be the owner along with his wife Lus. After several minutes of pleasant conversation we were shown to our room. It was gorgeous, large with a balcony and the largest bathroom we encountered during our eight nights in Europe. As we were getting settled in there was a knock on the door and there was Hans with a bowl of peanuts and champagne. As he suggested we stood on our balcony and toasted to our first night in Amsterdam. The location is great, near the museums, in a primarily residential neighborhood. Only 1 block away you can hop on a tram or bus. Restaurants and nightlife are within a 10 minute walk. Breakfast was wonderful, and as we were told, just follow your nose downstairs in the morning. We particularly loved the fresh squeezed orange juice, eggs and bacon. We were offered discounted tickets to the museums at breakfast. Exceptional service. Two nights were not nearly enough to see Amsterdam and enjoy the Hotel Fita.

Reviews.Title: “Our appreciation for a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Fita-Although we arrived later than anticipated, we were greeted by Hans pleasantly. Our rooms were very clean and comfortable. The Hotel is in walking distance to many of the sights we wanted to see, and this made seeing the city much more enjoyable. Breakfast was ample and very tasty. The staff was courteous and attentive. We would recommend the hotel to anyone traveling to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was lovely”
Reviews.Author: janetc20
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Fita for 12 nights and had very few problems. We arrived very early in the morning (much earlier than we thought we would) so we woke up Hans at 7am on a Sunday morning in order to stow our luggage in the lobby until we could check in. He was a little cranky, but who wouldn't have been???? He had the staff give us coffee in the breakfast room and told us a few places in the neighborhood to go until we could check in -- since, of course, the people who were checking out of our scheduled room were still sleeping! Not a great situation when jetlagged but definitely not the hotel's fault. In fact, when we checked in, the front desk staff offered to explain the city layout and provide other information. We were too tired to hear it then and never got around to it but... they did bring a welcome beverage to our room, which was a nice touch. Next time, I'll time my flight arrival more sanely! In order to accomodate our long stay during a very busy time, we were scheduled to change rooms twice and we did. So we stayed in a standard, medium, and deluxe room. All were as advertised on the website, very clean and plenty spacious. Each time we changed rooms, we just did a "rough pack" and the staff moved our things. On the appointed day, the staff brought us our new room keys while we were at breakfast, explained the procedure, and it was all taken care of by the time we came back from the day's adventure to freshen up for dinner. No problems at all. We were there during a rather unexpected hot spell and there is not much in the way of climate control (well, anywhere in Amsterdam -- I think the locals were as surprised as we were) but sleeping with the windows open wasn't a problem and was mostly comfortable. The beds themselves were very comfortable and the pillows were good (two per person which I thought was plenty). The bathrooms, as I mentioned, were surprisingly spacious and clean and the showers had good water pressure and plenty of hot water. The breakfasts were good and filling with the lovely fresh squeezed orange juice and plenty of coffee. The staff in the breakfast room were very accomodating. I had an unfortunate personal situation occur during my stay and the owners and staff were as accomodating as possible and definitely (and apparently genuinely) interested in my well-being. I would not hesitate to recommend the Hotel Fita to other travelers -- in fact, I already told one of my very good friends to stay there when she travels to Amsterdam on business in October! Enjoy the Hotel Fita....I will stay there again if my travels ever take me to Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “It's the little extras that make them stand out!”
Reviews.Author: lesleyliz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in cheaper or similar priced hotels which to all appearances compared with The Hotel Fita. However it's the little extras that they offer that makes them stand out. The staff were polite, friendly and helpful. We arrived two hours before normal check in but the staff priortised the preperartion of our room and had it ready for us within the time it took us to pop out and get some breakfast. They made us feel welcome bringing us a drink and some nuts to nibble on when we checked in. The hotel offers free phone calls which saved us paying outrageous hotel call charges or the grind of finding a phone to call home and check on our son , (I hadn't realised how much easier this made life!) The breakfasts were really good, plenty of choice with eggs and bacon, croissants cooked meats etc. They are happy to do your laundry free of charge and when we checked out we were given some home made jam a fridge magnet of the hotel and some sweets in a little gift pack. I was really taken with the place and will definately go back and also recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobster4u
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is a gem of al hotel located less than five minutes from the Vincent Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum. The hotel is tucked in a safe and quiet nieghborhood approximately 10 minutes walk from the action of the Leidseplain. Hans and Loes De Rapper were attentive hosts and offered great suggestions without being intrusive. In addition, all the staff members were helpul and curtious. The hotel, breakfast lounge, and rooms were well taken care of and showed pride of ownership. The morning breakfasts were substainal (bacon, eggs, baked goods, cheeses, cured meats, fresh squeezed orange juice, cerals, yogurt, and fresh ground/brewed coffee) and tasty, a great start to each morning! I would advise my friends to stay at this cheerful, clean, and safe hotel. Mahalo for a great one week stay!

Reviews.Title: “Post-Review update.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had previously written a review on this hotel(----) and suffered a rather harrowing experience from the owners as a consequence. I am only posting this now because I had thought that the DeRappers 'hospitality' towards me had been a one off but from one of the latest reviews I see this is not neccessarily so. Having arrived home and posted my review, I received a not-very-pleasant phonecall from Hans, demanding to know why I took it upon myself to write my opinions online (which, might I add are quite balanced, and not a personal attack such as I was then subjected to). He proceded to ask me irrelevant questions such as what do I do for a living (incidently, I am in Law), and generally try to pick holes in anything that I said which did not please him. NOT charming! I'm writing this now as a sort of 'warning' sign to anyone else who may receive this kind of treatment upon not writing a glowing review, so much for freedom of speech eh! We have since stayed in genuinely brilliant B+B's with hosts who go out of their way to make sure your stay is a happy one, sorry Hans, yours just wasn't in the same league.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay at the Fita”
Reviews.Author: Wandering-Around
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fita for 4 nights in late June, 2006. We were greeted with a snack and a drink upon arrival. Our room was large, with ceiling fan and small TV. The hotel is nice and extremely clean, and the innkeepers were very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast is included and is very nice. We found the combination of location, price, free wi-fi, free calls to the US, and laundry service to be wonderful on our vacation. There are, however, some quirks that you need to be aware of: - The Fita is a small hotel, and the lift is so small that 2 people are quite cozy when riding in it. - The front desk is not regularly staffed. This did not pose a problem, as you can always dial the innkeepers, and you can be buzzed in at the front door. - A double room is commonly two twin beds pushed together. This is quite common in Europe, so be prepared. If you need a double bed or queen bed in your hotel, make sure that you are specific in your request. - The sheets were a bit rough and "industrial" feeling. - There is a kindergarten / primary school next door, and the children play outside. This can generate quite a bit of noise during the daytime. If you are expecting a cozy, comfortable, clean hotel, then the Hotel Fita is a great place to stay. If you are expecting an Americanized version of the Hilton - Fita is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly Fita”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fita 22-25 June with my wife and young daughters (7 and 4) and my elderly parents. Everything about the hotel was truly excellent. It is exactly as described - a small family- run spotlessly clean hotel. The small 2 person lift was just what was needed for my mother who has a dodgy knee. We had booked two double rooms and separate single beds had been set up in one of the rooms advance for the children Hans and Loes (the owners) are indeed very friendly and helpful - our daughters loved the attention (and little gifts). Breakfast comprises the usual hot drink choices, eggs (scrambled and boiled), bacon, bread rolls, home-made jams toast, pastries, cereals cheeses and (a favourite for the children) chocolate milk- all that you'd need. You need to arrive before 10.30pm on arrival but once you are checked in, you get a key card for the outside door and you can then came and go as you please. We had an early flight on our day of departure and although it was before breakfast was due, the staff made sure we had bread cereal toast and juice and coffee and that a taxi for 6 to turn up right on time. We arranged to "check out" the night before which was no trouble. For a family trip, it was in an ideal location - in the quiet museum quarter - only yards from the Van Gogh museum and the posh designer shops and a small walk to lots of restaurants and the tram stops to get into the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Fita”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We reserved a 'double' deluxe room on line for three nights hoping that we would recieve comfortable accommodation close to the centre at reasonable rates to spend an enjoyable time for a birthday trip. The booking was trouble free and response was good and the price was acceptable at 150euros per night. On arrival, we had to wait at the door to be let in and given a reasonably warm welcome and first impressions were that the hotel was ok. After check in, we were shown to our room after a short journey in a very small lift and on entering the room, we had an instant feeling of disappointment. Although the room was large and airy, there were two single beds pushed together (not what we expected or explained on the web site) and we found the room to be 'grubby' with a strong smell of disenfectant coming from the bathroom. I phoned the owner from the room to ask for a room with a double bed and was told that I had not booked one, furthermore, he was very offensive when I expressed my disappointment at the quality and suggested that we leave immediately (10.30p.m!) He made no attempt to help our situation, leaving us to find alternative accommodation for the following day; this meant enquiring at other hotels in the area that evening to arrange something more suitable for the remainder of our stay. Thankfully, we were successful and left the following morning, checking into a very high standard, professional hotel. On leaving Hotel Fita, we were subject to a very abrupt and cold experience and were glad to leave. The propietors of Hotel Fita need to revisit their website to amend their description of the accommodation offered, as we found it to be very misleading as to what the standard of this 'hotel' actually is, or, upgrade their rooms to meet their advertisment. Overall, I certainly would not recommend this 'hotel'.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: apples372
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were delighted with our stay at Hotel Fita. Not only were we greeted with a beverage and an offer to do our laundry, but we we able to phone home for free!! Our room was very clean and comfortable; our breakfast tasty. Better still, we felt comfortable walking in that part of Amsterdam - close to the museums. When leaving, the owner called a cab for us. No fuss! No bother!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Gem of the Museum District”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely wonderful - fab breakfasts lovely staff and beautifully clean rooms. We had the deluxe room with the balcony so we drank our tea there each morning :) Well worth a visit! Nicola & Howard Callow

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on quiet Amsterdam street.”
Reviews.Author: Spoda
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights at the Hotel Fita for a business trip, and was very pleased with the room, service, and breakfast. The hotel is very close to the Van Gogh museum and a convenient tram stop. I had a room facing the street, but found it to be very quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: EdoRuan
Reviews.Content: All the glowing things others have said about the Fita are true; this little three-star hotel is a rare gem. When I got back to NYC I got up that first morning and went into my kitchen half expecting to find a lovely Fita breakfast waiting for me. Good times die hard. The secret of the Fita is no secret at all: They just try harder, and they understand where to put that effort. Edo

Reviews.Title: “Great fit at the Fita”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arranged to visit Amsterdam, we chose not to stay at a trendy, canal side hotel, but at the less expensive hotel Fita in the museum district. The Fita also offered such perks as a full breakfast, free laundry and free phone calls to the USA and to Europe. The hotel had a lift which was welcome, since I have a bad knee, and the spotlessly clean room had a large bathroom with ample counter space. Loes de Rapper was helpful in proving information on getting around Amsterdam. She sold us discoount tickets to the museums, which saved us from waiting on long lines to get in. In the neighborhood--and it was very much a neighborhood-- were a number of good restaurants within walking distance, as were the canals and Vondel Park, an oasis of greenery, peppered with lakes and streams. The Fita felt like home for the eleven days that we stayed there. We would heartily recommend the Hotel Fita to any friends traveling to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend Hotel Fita!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Hotel Fita during a recent (May â€™06) stay. This was my fourth time visiting Amsterdam and the Hotel Fita was, by far, the best hotel I have stayed at yet. Most of the other positive reviews you will find here on TripAdvisor are accurate in my opinion. The Hotel is in a great location, it is immaculately clean, it is a good value for Amsterdam hotels, and most importantly, the owners and staff are excellent! The owners, Loes and Hans de Rapper, are very friendly and helpful. Loes was extremely helpful and a fountain of knowledge. Upon her recommendation I visited Maastricht and had a great time. Thank you Loes! Also, the staff at the hotel are all very friendly and helpful. Loes and Hansâ€™ attention to detail shows in their staff hiring as well! I highly recommend the Hotel Fita. JEFF ROSE

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita is Superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a quiet residential district right near the Van Gogh Museum. It has an electronic key entry. Hotel is clean and pleasant. Breakfast is excellent. It is served in an attractive space. Laundry and international calls are gratis. City center is ten minutes away by tram. My wife and I (we are senior citizens) loved Amsterdam and our day trips by train to the Keukenhof Gardens, Delft, The Hague, etc. The proprietors of the hotel are very nice. There is excellent dining nearby. One place we went back to several times was "Bark", an excellent seafood restaurant. Look forward to returning to Amsterdam and the Hotel Fita

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed two delightful stays at Hotel Fita within a seven month period ( October '05 and May '06.) This small hotel is perfect for the tourist who enjoys a "Bed and Breakfast" experience in a large city. Our gracious hostess not only welcomed us to Amsterdam; but provided us with invaluable tips for touring Holland. She explained the excellent tram system, pointed out the museums and attractions on a convenient map, alerted us to the free classical concert rehearsal, and recommended various restaurants in the area. Breakfast, served in a lovely setting, featured a complete buffet menu including freshly squeezed orange juice, scrambled eggs and bacon, flakey croissants, tender cinnamon rolls, cheeses and meats. The hotel is located within steps of the Van Gogh Museum, close to the Rijksmuseum and five minutes from the Concert Hall. Obviously, we enjoyed Hotel Fita and would plan to return there on any future visit to The Netherlands.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed about the room compared to the brochure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were 11 persons from my school (teachers) staying two nights from Friday to Sunday. We had different kinds of rooms - we had to accept the rooms available - which differed from the first acceptance by mail - till new mails later on. We ended up with two de-luxe- rooms and three others - and as I was also in Amsterdam in the middle of April I went to the hotel to see the rooms. I was showed a really nice de-luxe room on the first floor with a balcony and I deceided that we could accomodate a third person (in an extra bed for a supplement of 40 euro per night) as the room was so airy. It was a disappointment to get room no. 12 on the groundfloor without a balcony - we also had room no 10 . also a de-luxe room without balcony. Furthermore our window could not open the first night - this was fixed the next day. The bath-room is very nice - but the room is not what I would call a de-luxe room - it is ok but nothing special. The breakfast was not special - and you were only offered one glass of juice. The hotel is in a nice area with easy access to Vondelpark and the museums - but not as charming as the hotels closer to the city preferably in the canal-streets - where the rest of our company was placed. I would recommend a bell at the reception, we hardly did not see a person there. The last day we could store our luggage in the reception, which was nice. I am sorry to say that I will not stay at Fita again - the rooms are overpriced compared to where I have stayed before - and I did not see the friendlyness prices by other reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carol1945
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Amsterdam. We loved this hotel. It's in a great location - 2 minutes to the Van Gogh Museum. The owners are very friendly and helpful. We were welcomed with a glass of wine and snacks. The room was huge as was the bathroom. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: busygardener
Reviews.Content: We made email reservations for this well located small hotel months ago for a 50th anniversary pre cruise stay in a double deluxe room for 3 nights. We specifically requested a room on an upper floor. We were ushered into room #10 which is main level facing the street. The room was clean & comfortable but definitely not as appears in their brochure. Although we were assured it was a deluxe room in size, we would strongly advise against paying deluxe prices for that room. The hired staff was gracious and helpful. Street noise was negligble, however we left feeling we had not received what we had contracted for. We would stay there again, but definitely not spend the extra money for a deluxe room sight unseen.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a bright, quiet, family-run hotel in the museum district. Less than 5 minutes walk to Leidseplein and Vondelpark, and 2 minutes to the Van Gogh museum and Rijksmuseum. Owner Loes and her staff are excellent hosts. The breakfasts are delicious and fresh. The hotel offers free laundry service and can make arrangements for discounted museum tix. Hotel Fita is a great base for exploring the city and we'll have no hesitation to stay here again when we return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Like home”
Reviews.Author: Sueco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a very nice stay in Amsterdam. People are friendly and nice, with a very good sense of humour. And the Hotel Fita is like staying at home. Very clean and nice room, friendly atmosphere, no smoking, wonderful breakfast with fresh squeezed orange juice, toasted bread, eggs, yogurt, etc. Everything you need for a nice stay! We will definitely come back to Hotel Fita next time we visit Amsterdam. And it will be soon!

Reviews.Title: “Return to Hotel Fita”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have known about Hotel Fita since October, 2003 where I first stayed at the hotel to visit a country that I had known when much younger. In the fall of 2005, I returned to the Hotel Fita intending to spend two full weeks in Amsterdam and learn about the city as it is and it's history. Both times, I enjoyed my holiday and my stay at Hotel Fita. Morning's started with a good breakfast and after each day's adventures,it was good to come back to a place that seemed like home for the brief stay. Hotel room was clean and comfortable, enjoyed the building's architecture inside with steep staircase and it has an elevator to the upper floors. Discover and enjoy Amsterdam. Lawrence Poulin Montreal, Canada

Reviews.Title: “most comfortable short stay in town”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: - friendly, familary welcome with drink - very helpful staff - lovely bedroom with large bathroom - excellent beds (we never ever slept so well in a hotelbed - hotel location is quiet and near the center - good breakfast (including in the roomrate) - we enjoyed our stay very much and looking forward to come back to the hotel Fita.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: axle99
Reviews.Content: We travelled in a group of 12 for a suprise 60th birthday. Our group ranged in age from twenty somethings to sixty somethings. The hotel is located in a quiet area outside the city centre, close to the Van Gogh Museum. The rooms were large,comfortable and clean which are the key ingredients for a stay away from home. Steps are steep but this appears to be a feature of most properties in Amsterdam and a lift is available. All of Amsterdam can be reached on foot and we were happy to have found a hotel in a quiet location outside the centre. Accomodation in Amsterdam is quiet expensive. As a small family run hotel, the Fita Hotel offers good value for money (in comparison to some of the bigger name hotels we reviewed online) and we would happily stay there again on a return trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Basic Fita”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely weekend in Amsterdam. The sun shone for the duration and we enjoyed our stay at the Fita. Our room (number 6) cost â‚¬120 per night - it was tight for space but the bathroom had ample room. The welcome drink of champage and nuts was a nice touch. The hotel was exactly how I expected it to be - basic and clean. Breakfast tasted average Fruit cocktail 3 choices of sweet cereal 1 glass of freshly squeezed orange juice (rationed to one glass per person for some reason) A selection of croissants/bread Bacon/Scrambled egg and hardboiled eggs Cheese/ham Some people might prefer to be closer to centre of town. Its a good 25 minute walk to Dam Square but we didn't mind the location. Best way to travel to hotel is to catch the "Connextions" Hotel shuttle bus outside the airport and buy a return ticket for â‚¬17.50. It saves time and drops you right to the hotel door. I would stay at this hotel again because it was in a quiet area and it felt safe. ps the stairs would give you the head staggers!

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week in Amsterdam and wanted to be near museums and the Concertgebouw. A Dutch friend recommended Hotel Fita over more commercial hotels. We follwed his advice and were totally pleased. Loes de Rapper and her husband run a clean, pleasant hotel that serves guests a good breakfast and lots of good advice for travellers. Stairs are steep but once inside there is a lift. However, the front steps would be a problem for handicapped persons. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend the Hotel Fita to any of our friends planning to visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excllent Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Hotel Fita on our first visit to Amsterdam,and we must say what a pleasant experience it was.We were met by Mrs Loes de Rapper who made us feel most welcome.After the formalities of booking in Mrs de Rapper went to great lengths in explaining the important features of Amsterdam and the best ways of locating them and how to tavel to the different locations. Mr de Rapper did advise us to take a taxi from the Airport direct to the Hotel at a cost of apprx 30 euros. Good advice,much quicker and less hastle than using the train. The Hotel was excellent, spotlessly clean and excellent facilities.The breakfast was more than adequate, a choice of cereals, fruit juices, toast, bacon and egg. Yes the stairs were steep as someone says, but we were in Holland and thats the style in this type of property, and there was a lift. All in all we had great time in Amsterdam helped in no small way by the hospitality of the de Rapper family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Glasgow_Member06
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Hotel Fita. Good, clean basic hotel. Very warm welcome from our hosts, Mr & Mrs de Rapper. Good breakfasts with bacon and eggs if you like something hot. The hotel is very well situated - close to the main museums and concert hall and within a two-minute walk to the Number 2 and 5 trams which take you to the main station and the city centre tourist areas. Mrs de Rapper recommended some local restaurants that turned out to be real finds - excellent food at inexpensive prices. Some reviewers complain about the noise from the kids at the nearby school. Forget it; it's not a problem. My wife and I would have no hesitation in recommending the Fita. You'll find it hard to get such a warm welcome elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikatknight
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 nights at the Hotel Fita while in Amsterdam. The location was good, one block from the Van Gogh Museum. Our rate included free museum passes and free telephone calls to the US. The breakfasts were very good and included eggs, bacon, breads, cheese, etc. The only drawback was our downstairs room. I would have preferred a room on one of the upper floors as opposed to being on the ground floor as the school next door had many kids playing, during recess, right outside of the window. It wasn't a big deal for us as we were gone right after breakfast, but if you sleep in it could be an annoyance. All in all, I liked the hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrrlAnn
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fita is located one block from the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, Vondelpark, and high fashion shops (i.e. Chanel). This is a very quiet neighborhood. There is a school yard across the street that can get noisy in the morning and afternoon. We stayed in the Business Double. Very, very large room with a huge bathroom. Very tall ceilings. Everything was absolutely spotless. Our room had a small balcony which overlooked the street. There are very steep stairs that go to the upper floors. This would definitely be difficult if you have trouble walking. The elevator is the smallest I have seen in Europe. My husband would take the luggage up and I would take the stairs and meet him at the top. This is a non-smoking hotel. I don't know if that is on their website, but when you get to the hotel there are signs everywhere. They also do not advertise the features on the website once you get to the hotel (i.e. free long distance to the US, laundry service, museum tickets, etc). The hotel definitely has a mom and dad's house feel. So if you are a young person looking to spend a weekend of debauchery in Amsterdam you may feel awkward coming back to a place so homelike. Most of the clientel was 40s-60s. This doesn't seem to be a popular place for young people. The staff was very nice whenever we met with them. A young girl gave us a quick background on Amsterdam and gave us two welcome champagnes. Breakfast was fine but nothing special. The tea and fresh squeezed OJ was always good. Breads were fine but not great. I would highly recommend this hotel as an affordable place to stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: nclarry
Reviews.Content: Our room was small but very clean and quiet. Our rate included museum tickets. Hans (the owner) seemed quite gruff but this was really just an act. He was very friendly and helpful, providing restaurant advice and directions. We had to leave at 5:30 a.m. for our flight and he arranged airport transportation for us at quite a good price. The breakfast service was about what you expect in Europe--more than adequate. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have received a better welcome than we did on arrival at Hotel Fita. We were immediately provided with a map of the city and helpful advice on what to see and where to go! The hotel was very clean, the room very comfortable and the breakfasts very tasty. Hotel Fita is within 5 minutes walk of the main museums and a variety of restaurants. Trams from the Central Station stop just around the corner. The centre of Amsterdam is a 15-20 minute walk and within easy reach. However, after a day spent in the bustling city it's a great retreat to the quieter area of the city and the tree-lined street upon which the hotel is situated. We would definitely return to Hotel Fita!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita: Dutch Treat”
Reviews.Author: Mary_Barry
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at Hotel Fita at the tail end of a 3-week trip to France and Holland. Hotel Fita was by far the best value of our travel accommodations. The room (#26) was not by any means romantic - more like a very upscale dorm room - but it was reasonably sized and extremely clean. (Cleanliness appears to be somewhat of a fetish with the owners, but heck, you could experience far less wholesome fetishes, especially in Amsterdam!) This particular room had lots of windows and a balcony, which was nice. It also had amenities such as a safe, a reading light on each side of the bed, and a full-sized bathtub with - hoorah - a real shower and complete shower curtain! Beds were two singles pushed together, but each had two comfy pillows and the sheets had been washed and ironed into a state of sublime crispness. We never met Mr. and Mrs. de Rapper, the owners, but the young staff members who we did talk with were most helpful. The staff is sort of invisible most of the time, but appear when you call them, which is fine. The neighborhood is first-rate, quiet and nice for walking. The Rijksmuseum is less than 5 minutes walk away, and is worth visiting even though much of it is closed for renovation. The part that's open is excellent. Vondel Park, also very close, was a disappointment; the little ponds were full of bottles, beercans and all kinds of unsavory litter. Ac tually, much of Amsterdam was disappearing under a layer of trash and graffitti; too bad that such an interesting, cosmopolitan city appears so little cared-for by residents and visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: PJMdb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for four nights in this hotel. Our room was small, but tasteful, comfortable and very clean. We were perfectly satisfied with the breakfast. The location is ideal and we walked everywhere. One word of advice - the hotel offers free museum tickets if you stay three nights and a discount on the room rate if you stay four, but only if you booked directly and didn't use an internet booking agency, as we did. (In our case, there was no saving on the room rate by using the agency.)

Reviews.Title: “Silence City Hotel FITA”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our Group of 10 Swiss Adults had the best advices for our Amsterdam stay-over made by our hostages Loes and Hans! Just simply perfect, many Thanks and best regards from Switzerland

Reviews.Title: “An average stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Whilst glad of this hotel over some of the others seen in Amsterdam, the hotel we encountered was somewhat different to the majority of reviews read here on tripadvisor. It was easy to get to and from the hotel and airport, the shuttle leaves you to either door and the price was very reasonable. The hotel was conveniently located, being very close to the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum. It was a nice area, a street up from some fancy shops (Chanel, Gucci, etc). The short walk into the centre of Amsterdam was pleasant, so no use of public transport was needed. Our room, number 12, was of reasonable size and was comfortable and functional. It did lack character, and the bathroom could be seen as a little clinical, but at least it was all kept very clean. The double bed consisted of two singles pushed together, which whilst expected is always a little disappointing. Still, they were comfortable with plenty of pillows, which most other hotels lack. The ceiling fan was a welcome addition. Breakfast was poor. The scrambled eggs were in need of some scrambling, forming a huge omelette in their dish. The pastries were plain-tasting, and cereal lacked crunch. Milk clotted up on contact with the coffee. My girlfriend and I recommend visiting one of the patisseries down past Leidesplein where they have good coffee for little over a euro, and a huge range of delicious pastries. Many shops sell fruit, more types than you could name, and these are also good for picking up a very fresh breakfast. The de Rappers were not all they were cracked up to be. We only saw Loes once the whole stay, and Hans on the occasions we did see him was loud and standoffish. This didnâ€™t pose a problem, just is contradictory to the reports we read here prior to our visit. Having said this, Loes giving us our bearings at the start was appreciated, as itâ€™s always nice to have an idea where to start off in a new city. Without meaning to sound like I'm complaining, one day our room was not cleaned or our towels changed. This posed no real problem, but does underline the overall service as nothing special. Worth noting for those light sleepers out there is that the curtains were paper thin, and so it was never really â€˜darkâ€™ in the room. Tripadvisor left me with high expectations, but realistically the hotel was everything it should have been. All in all it was a pleasant stay and a pleasant hotel. I would recommend the hotel to others, I just donâ€™t see what all the fuss was about myself!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4travelreview
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. The service, location and warmth of welcome were exceptional. The owners could not have been more accomodating. Breakfast is served in a delightful room with a wide range of choices. The rooms and bathrooms were very clean and well appointed. We highly recommend Hotel Fita.

Reviews.Title: “Its a good hotel, not a great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: savod
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad little hotel, but frankly I didn't see what all the fuss was about (see other reviews)!! My girlfriend and I came on a three day break to Amsterdam, and it was our intention to rest and relax!! Serving breakfast until 9.30am is not consistent with my idea of R&R!! Having said that, the hotel is spotlessly clean and the the staff are polite (if not a little over-friendly which maybe my problem and not theirs!!) Our room was nice if not a little plain for what was charged. On the plus side, the location is fantastic. I would recommend this hotel in spite of my (fairly minor) criticisms.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cooper-Kent
Reviews.Content: This hotel and staff has character. My husband and I stayed here with our 2 year old son and staying at this hotel made our holiday in Amsterdam perfect. We stayed in a business room, it was clean, bright and welcoming. Most of all the proprietors of this hotel Hans and Loes were helpful and cheerful. The location of the hotel is a stones throw from the Van Gogh and Rijks museums, the road is quiet and tree lined. Breakfast is in a bright dining room. The orange juice is freshly squeezed and the breakfast was varied in choice. We only got back yesterday and I have already recommended the hotel to my parents! If you go to Amsterdam stay at this lovely hotel, it will make your holiday complete.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeteSD
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel, very friendly proprietors & staff. Great location, clean & comfortable rooms, at a great price. I would not stay anywhere else when visiting Amsterdam. Cheers Hans. Hope to see you all soon. Peter B.

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly Small Hotel in an Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for eight nights in May 2005 in a good sized room with a small balcony overlooking a quiet street and childrenâ€™s playground; it was a pleasant and enjoyable experience. We especially liked: Â·the location â€“ round the corner from the Van Gogh museum and easy walking distance to the Rijksmuseum, the Concertgebouw and the Vondelpark, useful tram stops and a supermarket, where you can buy strippenkaarten for the trams and metro. Â·the friendliness of the proprietor - who takes a great interest in his guests (and incidentally has a great sense of humour), Â·fresh orange juice and coffee for breakfast, Â·good security â€“ guests are given a plastic card to open the front door which is otherwise kept locked. We also liked the tranquillity of the place and commend the proprietor for publishing the sizes of the hotelâ€™s rooms (if only all hotels would do this!). As in most traditional Amsterdam houses, the stairs are rather steep but the lift is adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel in very good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with everything said in the previous review titled "Comfortable Hotel". We stayed in one of the larger rooms that was spotlessly clean with a very nice size bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful and tried to answer all the queries we had. The hotel location couldn't be better as it is only one block away from the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseums. It is also within a 10 minute walk to Leidesplein and then a nice stroll into the centre. Alternatively, the trams are easy to use and both the number 2 and 5 go into the centre. If you have some free time take the opportunity to walk the few blocks from the hotel to the Vondelpark which is a very large green park with several streams and ponds. On the evening we went there it seemed that most of Amsterdam was having a picnic on the grass or listening to a free open-air concert. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a good, clean, friendly hotel in a convenient location. We will be going back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling at home at Hotel FITA”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am Brazilian and I went to Amsterdam for a conference and I could not have chosen better when I chose to stay at Hotel Fita. Hotel Fita is one block away from the Van Gogh Museum and it is the cleanest hotel I have ever been to. The owners are terribly gentle, they are very kind and interested in their guests. They ask if you are doing ok, sit with you and talk to you during breakfast, they really make you you feel at home. By the way, breakfast is delicious: fruit salad, fresh squeezed orange juice, delicious butter croissants and much more. I recommend Hotel Fita without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the Hotel Fita as a good choice for a quiet, clean, well-located hotel in Amsterdam. It is two minutes walk to the Van Gogh museum (a must-see sight), and about 20 minutes walk to Anne Frank House (another must-see sight). It is located on the edge of the central core, and everything in the central core is within a 30-minute walk or a short tram ride. We stayed in a "deluxe" room for 130 euros a night, which was located on the highest floor at the back/side of the hotel (fortunately, there is an elevator!). The room was a comfortable size, with large windows looking onto a pedestrian street, and was surprisingly quiet. It also includes a small safe, which was a nice touch. The breakfast was quite substantial -- pastries, cereal, yogurt, fruit, eggs, and bacon (or some similar type of meat, which I didn't try which is why I can't remember exactly what it was). The owner is very hospitable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Best 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: revamark
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at The Fita in May.It is an excellent hotel in a great location.We has a business room which we would recommend-it is worth the extra 10 Euros per night.We can only say positive things about the Hotel,Hans & Loes & their staff.The room was very clean,the breakfasts great & the location perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Fita”
Reviews.Author: deweytruman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 4 nights at the Hotel Fita, which is near the museums, canal tours, sightseeing and shopping in Amsterdam. The couple who own the hotel were welcoming and charming. They both speak excellent English. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The bathroom was large by European standards, and had all the amenities. A nice breakfast (same menu daily) is included. The price is moderate and we felt we got great value for the money. We'd stay there again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Cleary Our Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Offseason
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the business sized rooms at the Hotel Fita for the second time in May. We loved it again. The location is fantastic. Hans, the owner, is great with his gruff sense of humor and attention to detail. He let us use his laptop to access the internet when we needed to. The room was clean, quiet and large. For anyone who wants to spend time in the Museums and the best pliens, it is clearly the best. I am even sending my 70 year old Mother and my Aunt there to stay in September.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fita is excellant!”
Reviews.Author: lbc54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fita in April for 8 days. We choose the hotel based on reviews posted on this site and we were not disappointed. The location was excellant. My husband wanted to go to the opera while we were there. It was sold out on the internet so I contacted Mrs. de Rapper and she was able to get us excellant seats! We would recommend this hotel and will stay here again when we are in Amsterdam. The location was convenient for the van Gogh, Rijksmuseum and the Concertgebow. The tram stops were at the end of the block, which made getting the train to other towns a breeze. Amsterdam in April is beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “All round perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay awake in Amsterdam, listening to drunken stag and hen parties, then this is not the place for you. However, if you want to walk 2minutes to the splendid Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum, and wander through the beautiful nearby Vondel park, then this is the place for you. All the major attractions (shops, restaurants/bars) are also within a 5minute walking distance. The hosts of Hotel Fita are welcoming and always available for guidance, with a very friendly attitude. Breakfast is a fantastic start to the day. SO..... If you want excellent value for money ....... WHY GO ANYWHERE ELSE We'll be back there soon! Richard & Dana Manchester, England

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean, Comfortable, Caring, Generous. We had a truly fine stay at the Fita Hotel. .The de Rapper family really went well beyond the call of duty to help us have a great time. Little unusual extras, like free use of a computer, free local calls and beyond made us select this as a number one place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lexicles
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently stayed at the Fita. We were in a standard room that, whilst small, certainly met all of our needs. It was very clean, the bed was comfortable, pillows good and we had a clean, large bathroom. Lots of nice little touches, for example we had a chocolate on our pillow on arrival, there is a little inflatable duck in the bathroom, and when we left we were given a fridge magnet of the hotel. My daughter loved the breakfast - freshly squeezed orange juice included. It isn't a huge selection, but what there is is top quality and very fresh. The hotel is in a very good location, close to the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum - this is especially important when you have a child with you as there are some places that you would rather not be near at night! We had no problem finding some good restaurants, including a combined Argentinian steak house/Italian restaurant just around the corner. The next street along seemed to be Amsterdams answer to Bond Street - Lacoste, Chanel etc which was nice to browse. We used the trams (get a strippenkaart at the station or the Albert Heijn supermarket round the corner from the hotel). Trams 2 and 5 stop outside the Van Gogh museum which is steps away from the hotel. Don't walk from the station - it's quite a long way with luggage. We would definitely recommend this hotel. Don't go if you want big hotel style and luxury, but if you want good value, clean accommodation and some nice extras (we got half price Van Gogh museum tickets) - then head straight there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Scotter
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita is in the Museum district, A very nice area. We wallked 1 block to catch the tram that took us wherever we wanted to go. At the end of a long day siteseeing it was nice to be dropped off so close to the hotel. We were in room 32. It was very nice and we enjoyed the quaint balcony that not all rooms had. The English breakfast buffet was delicious and was very enjoyable. There was plenty of options to have something different every morning. The hosts are the owners and they took very good care of us answering our questions each morning at breakfast. They live in the hotel which was nice for availability. We look forward to our next stay at the Hotel Fita.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had agreat experience at Hotel Fita. It was super clean and very quiet. The breakfast every morning was excellent and generally sustained us all the way until dinner ! The most entertaining part of our day was talking with the owner Hans every morning. He always had a great story and was very helpful in recommending sights to see as well as how to get there. In addition, the location of the hotel was great - close to everything. It is a family owned hotel and Hans and Loes offered wonderful hospitality. We would definitely stay again and would recommend it to anyone travelling to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Fita!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fita in Amsterdam is truly a gem! The breakfast was fresh and delicious. The rooms are neat, cozy, and most have a lovely view of the bustling streets. The staff were friendly, helpful and considerate. Hotel Fita is the ideal choice when visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpfull owners”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Fita 3 nights and ejoyed it very much. The hotel is 200 m from Reijk and Van Gogh museums The trams are at the same distance ( but who needs them..The best and easiest way to see Amsterdam is on foot). The room was big and very clean and the breakfest fresh and more then enough. The owners Mrs. and Mr De Rapper are very friendly and made all they could to make our short visit succesfull ..and for sure we shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights with a friend last year. we stayed in a 'Business' room which was spacious and comfortable and very good value. The owners and staff are very friendly and helpful, the hotel is comfortable, quiet and clean and the breakfast is excellent. The hotel is well positioned for the excellent museums, the wonderful concert hall (book well in advance) and some very good restaurants and is situated in a quiet and appealing street. Nevertheless if you want more action, it is only a short stroll away. Overall our stay was very enjoyable and I have no hesitation in recommending the Fita - I have of course booked another stay there for later this year!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Fita
HotelInfo.Address: Jan Luykenstraat 37, Amsterdam 1071 CL, The Netherlands
